job summary:
BAYLOR SCOTT & WHITE HEALTH
OR Scheduling Coordinator
Round Rock, TX

Department: Neuro
Hours: Full-Time
Required Experience: A minimum of 2 years experience required
Required Education: H.S. Diploma/GED Equivalent

JOB SUMMARY
The OR Scheduling Coordinator maintains the master list of OR schedule as well as Anesthesiology coverage. Schedules surgical patients when necessary and assists other departments in the hospital to schedule surgical time and relay patient information appropriately to the staff in Surgical Services and the Day Surgery Unit. Makes any needed changes to the schedule and contacts appropriate departments. The Coordinator also maintains access security to the surgical scheduling systems.

PROVIDES SCHEDULING SUPPORT TO ENSURE DEPARTMENT'S EFFICIENCY
Promptly and courteously answers and screens phone calls for the office or department; routes calls as appropriate within established customer service guidelines; accurately records messages and delivers to the appropriate party in a timely manner; checks voicemail, emails, and block booking frequently.
Effectively screens and edits confidential correspondence and documents related to patient care and sensitive administrative issues in accordance with established policies and procedures.
Coordinates with Anesthesiologist Hall Runner information and operating room Staff about orders, special requests, and number of operating rooms available and necessary scheduling information.
Coordinates changes, postponements, cancellations and preferred order of cases with physicians, secretaries as well as Surgical Services and Day Surgery Unit. Informs Surgical Services of possible conflicts of use of equipment in the Operating Room. Coordinates posting of cases involving multiple services and surgeons. *Note: Appointments prior to surgery, specific start times other than 8:00 on schedule and Paris, Top of schedule note on call surgeons for CT, Ortho, General, name alerts and blood precautions.
Communicates with Surgeons and Secretaries in regards to scheduling issues.
Informs our Supervisor/Director of unresolved issues. Contacts Clinic
Supervisor/Coordinators to work out unresolved issues.

COORDINATES TO FACILITATE PATIENT CARE PLANNING AND CREATE A POSITIVE EXPERIENCE FOR THE PATIENT.
Coordinates procedures with other departments in a timely manner, accurately completes documents and forms and clearly communicates directly with surgeons. Also coordinates anesthesiology coverage of inpatient on hospital units.
Monitors surgeons lineups for next day surgeries and revises as needed. Prints all paperwork for add on cases and inform PNC of any necessary changes.
Informs OR staff of equipment needs, conflicts and specialties.
Ensure cancels and add-ons relayed to DS and Control Desk for the next day, after schedule delivered until 4:00pm daily

ASSEMBLES, PRINTS AND DISTRIBUTES OPERATING ROOM SCHEDULE
Uses knowledge of Operating Room setup and availability to produce OR schedule. In advance of setting up schedule, checks blocks to ensure surgeon is in Main OR or Pavilion.
Note: 10 and 12 hours rooms on schedule and block booking.
Produces complete and accurate schedule in final form reflecting correct order of all cases in each operating room. Copies and distributes next day's schedule and 48 hour schedule at 1400 according to operative distribution list as approved by the Director of Surgical Services.
Note: Move float cases into the first available room or requested time if available. Float to follow (10:40 example) for time on schedule and Paris. Contact secretary with start time for surgeon.
Produces a two day out schedule for Day Surgery Clerk.
Maintains distribution list of OR schedules. Add and delete staff by editing the schedule distribution mailing list. Emails schedule daily. Keeps schedule 3 months out.

MAINTAINS, PRINTS AND CONTROLS THE PRINTING OF ANESTHESIA
TICKETS, (FORM 26) AND OPERATING ROOM RECORD, VERIFIES DIAGNOSIS PRESENT AND CORRECT, VERIFIES CPT CODE AND SURGICAL DESCRIPTION MATCH TO ENSURE PROPER SUPPLIES AVAILABLE AND TIME NEEDED IS CORRECT. CHECKS HISTORICAL TIME AGAINST PROCEDURE.
Note: HAR correct, inpatient status correct with room number for anesthesia record and schedule.
Enters data into OR Scheduling System, generates Anesthesia Record (Form 26) and files appropriately. Maintains patient confidentiality.
Edits Electronic Blue tickets.
Check Utilization Review report daily before printing updated 48 hour schedule.
Make any changes to Patient status.

MAINTAIN EXCEL SPREADSHEET ENTERING DAILY BLOCK INFORMATION.
NUMBER OF STARTS USED, BLOCK NOT RELEASED OR RELEASED LATE.
DISCUSS BLOCK ISSUES WITH CHIEF AND RON HOLDER.
Communicates to departments when surgery blocks returned.
Releases and reassigns returned Surgery Blocks. Builds new blocks periodically and redistributes blocks according to utilization
Meet with Chief to discuss Block changes and stop date. Keep up with starts outside the OR. Contact block bookers with changes, make changes to block allocation, build blocks out to correct stop date.
Coordinates with clinic training staff to provide education of PARIS and Block
Booking, 48 hours schedule guidelines, historical time. Contact secretary if ticket entered without block or requested time to ensure case on correct date/correct surgery.

MAINTAINS PERIOPERATIVE DATABASES: EMAIL WEBPAGES, ID AND PASSWORDS

Adds new CPT codes to the databases and eliminates old codes. Contact secretary if CPT and Description do not match, also if the code is invalid.
Monitor and contact IS administrator with following: Database log getting full, re-boot server, Bridge between I-Path and PARIS is down, Install Paris on personal computers, Cases cancelled in I-Path and PARIS is down, HAR Weblink not crossing to I-Path, Historical Time questions.
Updates phone list with new surgeons and secretaries. Distributes to Day Surgery, Control Desk, and AAU

COORDINATES ANESTHESIA ASSESSMENT UNIT'S (AAU) ACTIVITIES WITH OR
Check cancelled anesthesia records from Control desk each day to see if rescheduled if so delivered to AAU. Ensure tickets entered on any patient added same day to AAU, inform of changes in location (pavilion to main OR or vice versa), and make corrections on any errors noted or additional information provided by AAU nurse.
Ensure cases added late or having a note same day pre-op/consent have cleared admissions and AAU. Informs Dr. Gibson of issues.
Assist with doctors, doctor referral, appointment clerks, nurses and sectaries to
coordinate anesthesia in outside areas. Example: Cath Lab, Ep Lab, 3D, MRI, CT, Angio, Echo, Labor and Delivery and PACU only.
Assist Clinic and OR coordinators with questions, problem solving, corrections and teaching procedures and guidelines. Maintains OR data, Reports requested from Dr. Bittenbinder.

job summary:
Job Summary:
The Anesthesia Technologist assists licensed anesthesia provider with duties related to the care and monitoring of patients and equipment.

Responsibilities:
Cleans, sterilizes and sets up anesthesia equipment.
Assists anesthesia provider with patient assessment, monitoring, transport, positioning, insertion of intravenous and other invasive lines, and airway management.
Provides daily maintenance of equipment and troubleshoots malfunctions.
Maintains an adequate inventory of necessary equipment and supplies.
Assists in the preparation of scheduled, emergent and urgent surgical procedures involving anesthesia care providers by ensuring necessary equipment and supplies are available and ready for use.
Interacts with various vendors and assist in the trial and evaluation of new products while promoting standardization.
Works in collaboration with various vendors to ensure the availability of routine and specialty supplies for anesthesia.
Orients and assigns work as needed to the Tech in Training to meet the needs of the various departments and anesthesia care providers.
Performs other duties as assigned.
May be required to be "on-call." Qualifications

Education & Experience:
High school diploma or equivalent is required
College level coursework in the field of science is preferred
Must complete mandatory department orientation, network education, and anesthesia tech competencies
Six (6) months of on-the-job training is required.
Previous work experience in a hospital setting or health care role, or pharmacy department experience is preferred.

education level/skills required / respon: PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral...
job summary:
RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral to postoperative care. PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. Candidates for PACU jobs require critical care skills to assess incision sites, monitor body temperature, and track other indicators of stability or complications. It is important for RNs in the recovery room to quickly make critical patient assessments as the on-call doctor may be unavailable during an emergency. Ideal candidates for post-anesthesia care units have natural abilities to think critically and histories of fast, accurate diagnoses. Past experience in critical care and surgical nursing is a plus. 

Job Skills / Requirements:

Valid BLS from the American Heart Association
A valid professional license within the state of practice
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) credentials from the American Heart Association are recommended and may be required for specific registered nurses and travel nurse positions
Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific positions
Proof of right to work in the United States
Experience as a PACU nurse in a hospital setting

MedStar Emergency Physicians (MEP) is composed of seven top-tier emergency departments in the Mid-Atlantic region. job summary:
Required License/Registration/Certification

Unrestricted KY Medical License


Job Summary

The Department of Anesthesiology at the University of Kentucky seeks Board-certified or Board-eligible anesthesiologists in the areas of general anesthesia, cardiothoracic anesthesia, critical care medicine, and pediatric anesthesia, Fellowship training and eligibility for ABA subspecialty certification or TEE certification are required within subspecialty positions. These positions are open to all ranks.


UK HealthCare has undergone a sustained and remarkable growth trajectory for a decade. Clinical volumes have doubled in the past 6 years and the acuity of patient care is high. UK HealthCare’s Albert B. Chandler Hospital was named No. 1 in Kentucky in the U.S. News & World Report’s Best Hospitals rankings. The Department of Anesthesiology is a collegial group that is well-respected in the medical center. The residency program is strong and nationally recognized. The enterprise financially supports the academic and the clinical mission of the Department of Anesthesiology.


Openings are available within the following:


General Anesthesia – UK Anesthesiology provides complete, advanced anesthesiology services for all surgical procedures performed at UK Hospital, ranging from minor outpatient procedures to major operations such as transplantation.


Cardiothoracic Anesthesia – UK Healthcare has an exceptionally active, rapidly expanding Cardiac Surgery Service. Procedures include heart transplants, lung transplants aortic root replacement, TAVR , and minimally invasive thoracic surgery including pulmonary resection and esophagectomy.


Critical Care Medicine – The anesthesiology critical care medicine service provides coverage in the Neurocritical Care unit and manages cardiac surgery and thoracic surgery patients in the cardiovascular ICU as well as solid organ transplant patients in the Surgery ICU .


Pediatric Anesthesia – UK Healthcare has a Level IV Neonatal ICU . All types of pediatric surgical subspecialties are represented. Willingness to care for adults as well as children is essential.


Salary and benefits of this position are commensurate with experience and rank.


Candidate questions may be directed to the following:

Robert Gaiser, MD

Professor and Chair

Department of Anesthesiology

800 Rose Street, N202, UKMC

Lexington, KY 40536-0293

Phone: 859-323-5956

Fax: 859-323-1080

Robert.gaiser@uky.edu

eahesl2@uky.edu

No

Yes


University Community of Inclusion

The University of Kentucky is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by ensuring all our students, faculty, and staff work in an environment of openness and acceptance. We strive to foster a community where people of all backgrounds, identities, and perspectives can feel secure and welcome. We also value the well-being of each of our employees and are dedicated to creating a healthy place to work, learn and live. In the interest of maintaining a safe and healthy environment for our students, employees, patients and visitors the University of Kentucky is a Tobacco & Drug Free campus.


As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strongly encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities, women, and all minorities to consider our employment opportunities.


Any candidate offered a position may be required to pass pre-employment screenings as mandated by University of Kentucky Human Resources. These screenings may include a national background check and/or drug screen.

MedVet Medical & Cancer Centers for Pets is currently seeking a Client Services Representative to join our team in our Lexington, Kentucky practice. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast paced environment and is dedicated to delivering the highest quality of care. The recruited candidate will combine teamwork, leadership and compassion to develop client relationships.


About MedVet Medical & Cancer Centers for Pets:


Founded in 1988, MedVet is one of the largest veterinarian-owned multispecialty and emergency practices in the country. Three of MedVet’s Ohio medical centers (Columbus, Cincinnati & Dayton) were the first AAHA Accredited Specialty Referral hospitals in the state of Ohio. MedVet Columbus was named the AAHA Accredited Referral Practice of the Year for 2014.The MedVet team provides expert specialized care in areas including anesthesiology, cardiology, dermatology, emergency and critical care, integrative medicine, internal medicine, interventional radiology, medical oncology, neurology, ophthalmology, radiation oncology, radiology, rehabilitative services, and surgical services.


Responsibilities:

Greet and check-in clients.
Answer telephones and transfer calls.
Escort clients and their pets to exam rooms.
Manage medical records, charts, reports and correspondence.
Discuss payment options and process payments.
Ensure the lobby is neat and clean at all times.
Qualifications:

Ability to work successfully as part of a team and autonomously.
Ability to remain composed in stressful situations.
Flexibility with work hours and able to work additional hours when necessary.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent client service skills and phone etiquette.
Attention to detail.
Self-motivated.
Sense of urgency.
Critical thinking skills and ability to anticipate needs inter & intra-departmentally.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to maintain composure dealing with difficult/emotional situations.
General computer competency required including Microsoft word and excel.
Ability to lift up to 30lbs.
Customer service experience required.
Previous experience in veterinary setting preferred.
All candidates must complete an acceptable background check, including references and a pre-employment drug test.


Shift: The position is full time. Specific work hours to be determined based on assignment and needs of the departments. Weekends & Holidays are required.


All candidates must complete an acceptable background check, including references and a pre-employment drug screen

Full benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, short-term and long term disability, life insurance, 401K, PTO and pet care discounts are available.With practices in Ohio, Kentucky, Louisiana, Alabama, Illinois and Indiana, MedVet is one of the most dynamic specialty practices in veterinary medicine. Please visit our website at www.medvetforpets.com and check out our Facebook page for additional information.

education level/skills required / respon: Medical services include Allergy, Anesthesiology, Cardiac Rehab/Cardiology, Dermatology, Gastroenterology, Hematology/Oncology, Family Practice, Gynecology,...
job summary:
Employed Opportunity Twenty Minutes From Lexington

This excellent employment opportunity is located within twenty minutes of Lexington! Enjoy the stability of a larger system in a great family oriented community that is one hour from Louisville and one hour from Cincinnati. Kentucky Pulmonary is seeking a second pulmonologist to join the group. The new physician will provide a full spectrum of Pulmonary services including lung biopsy, diagnosis and vent management. The right candidate will experience a rapid start-up. GCH has an extensive respiratory therapy department with a pulmonary rehabilitation program. The experienced Hospitalist program will be supportive and welcoming of the new provider. The clinic is in the Medical Office Building conveniently adjacent to the hospital and is outfitted with eClinicalWorks for EHR. A generous base salary with opportunity to bonus will be offered. Full benefits include health, dental, vision, paid vacation, life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance, 401(k), short term, long term disability, CME with allowance, malpractice insurance with tail, relocation, sign-on-bonus, student loan assistance and medical education stipend considered.
About the Hospital

Georgetown Community Hospital is a 75-bed acute care facility with an award-winning history of providing excellence in healthcare. Georgetown Community Hospital has been named a "Solucient 100 Top Hospital" three times in recent years, and won Best Places to Work in Kentucky five times in the past six years. The hospital continues to add new medical services and grow the number of specialist and primary care physicians. It also features a newly renovated, 6-bed ICU, a Med/Surg Unit and a 24-hour Emergency Services Department. State-of-the-art equipment includes MRI, Lithotripsy, two CT Scanners and Ultrasound. Medical services include Allergy, Anesthesiology, Cardiac Rehab/Cardiology, Dermatology, Gastroenterology, Hematology/Oncology, Family Practice, Gynecology, Internal Medicine, OB/GYN, Occupational Therapy, Ophthalmology, Otolaryngology, Pathology, Pediatrics, Physical Therapy and Sports Medicine, Podiatry, Radiation Oncology, Radiology and Urology. Surgical services include: Bariatric (Weight-Loss), Colon-Rectal, ENT, Gynecological, Orthopedic and Urology. A recognized Center for Excellence, the Bariatric Center offers a minimally invasive weight loss surgery program, which was named a Top Five national program by Obesity Help magazine.
The Community

Highly noted for its historic homes and perhaps the best antique shopping in the state, Georgetown is also known as one of the state's fastest growing cities. Located at the crossroads of I-75 and I-64, it is ideally located just 10 miles north of Lexington, the Horse Capital of the World. Two larger cities, Louisville and Cincinnati, provide quick access to arts, entertainment, shopping and professional sports. Georgetown was founded by the Baptist minister Elijah Craig in 1790, best known for his world-famous invention, bourbon whiskey. Today, Georgetown is proud to be the American hometown of Toyota's Camry, Venza and Avalon production facility as well as host for the Cincinnati Bengals' training camp, which is held each August at Georgetown College, a four-year liberal arts school. Additionally, the University of Kentucky, Transylvania University and Midway College are all located in the surrounding area.
Recreation

Georgetown is located in the heart of Kentucky's famed Bluegrass Region. This is horse country, and the area's back roads offer beautiful scenery with horse farms, cattle fields and Irish fieldstone fences. Steeped in tradition and just 10 miles down the road in nearby Lexington, Keeneland Race Course attracts people from around the world for their yearly meets in April and October. At the Kentucky Horse Park, visitors can watch a harness maker at work, enjoy the parade of breeds or take a horse-drawn carriage tour. Historic Elkhorn Creek offers world class canoeing and fishing. There are dozens of golf courses in the area, including Cherry Blossom, Canewood Golf Course and University of Kentucky golf course.

job summary:
MEDNAX has grown from a single medical practice to a trusted health solutions partner with more than 10,000 employees and a presence in 50 states. Through our family of companies, we provide:


• physician services spanning the continuum of patient care


• revenue cycle management solutions


• performance improvement consulting


We invite you to grow with us and help shape the future of health care.


We are seeking a full-time BC/BE anesthesiologist to join our team at American Anesthesiology Associates of Georgia in Macon. The preferred candidate will be proficient in regional anesthesia, ultrasound guided anesthetic techniques and cardiac cases. Additional anesthesia services provided by the practice include: general surgery, pediatrics, OB services, Level-I trauma center, US for blocks, US for vascular access, TEEs, ortho and neurosurgery. The practice provides a full array of anesthesia services at Navicent Health, which has 29 ORs, several ancillary suites and a free standing outpatient facility. Our team consists of 15 anesthesiologists and 54 anesthetists including AAs and CRNAs, who work together in a team care model.


Physicians may live up to 30 miles away from the hospital. Consequently, may place you just a short drive away from exciting and metropolitan Atlanta, without all of the congestion.


Located in the center of the state, Macon is the economic engine of Central Georgia and represents a fascinating blend of progressive thinking and respect for history. Victorian-style mansions, ancient Indian mounds, cultural and recreational activities, good Southern food and friendly people come together to create the New Southern lifestyle. Macon offers a wonderful variety of choices in public and private education. From standard and magnet primary schools to secondary schools and post-secondary schools, Macon holds high standards for education.


We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits including:


• Health (choice of two PPO options), life, vision, dental and disability insurance

• 401(k)

• Annual CME allowance

• Potential for relocation assistance

• Employee stock purchase plan

• Stability in an organization with more than 30 years of healthcare industry experience

• Opportunities to participate alongside physicians in quality improvement initiatives

• Professional liability insurance and assistance with mandatory hospital credentialing and state licensing, and reimbursement of associated fees.

• All physicians receive the same number of vacation days and call days are shared equitably as well.


MEDNAX is an Equal Opportunity Employer


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status

job summary:
The EM Physician role will be working in the Emergency Medicine specialty, located in Jack Hughston Memorial Hospital - EM Phenix City, AL. Please contact Olevia Yates at olevia.yates@emcare.com for additional benefits information.

Job Details: We are seeking Full and Part Time Emergency Medicine Physicians in Phenix City, AL­ Physician Benefits Competitive hourly rates Flexible full-time, part-time, moonlighting, and PRN positions available Independent Contractor status­ Physician Requirements A candidate must be Board Certified/Board Eligible in EM/IM/FP Current on ACLS, BCLS, and PALS certifications Possess a current, unrestricted Alabama medical license, DEA, and Alabama ­Controlled Substances­ registration

Facility Information: Located in Phenix City, Alabama, just across the Chattahoochee River from the famed Hughston Clinic campus, Jack Hughston Memorial Hospital is an advanced acute-care hospital, offering a range of services, including orthopaedic and general surgery, physical therapy, diagnostic imaging, a pharmacy, a full laboratory, and a 24-hour emergency room.­ Comprising 110,000 square feet with 70 private patient rooms and six operating suites and offering the best in medical technology, Jack Hughston Memorial Hospital is ideally equipped to provide patients with excellent medical care.­ Emergency Department features 14,000 annual patient visits Subspecialty backup coverage in anesthesiology and surgery Ranked top 10% nationwide for both orthopedic and joint replacement care­

Community Information: Phenix City, Alabama is ­an All-American City with a rich history and a strong dedication to a progressive future. This blossoming community is located seconds away from Columbus, Georgia, and has ample recreation, cultural and educational opportunities, and a fantastic business climate.­­ Jack Hughston Memorial Hospital strives to deliver the highest quality patient care­ and is an ­integral part of the surrounding Phenix ­City community.

Benefits and Compensation: EmCare is a dynamic, physician-led organization which has been offering exceptional career opportunities since 1972. With more than 12,000 affiliated providers coast-to-coast, EmCare is nationally-recognized for delivering clinical excellence supported through innovation, integration and exceptional leadership.
Whether you are considering full-time, part-time or independent contractor opportunities with EmCare, you can rest assured you will be working for an industry-leader who delivers a vast array of benefits unmatched within the industry, including:

Physician-led organization
Strong leadership on a local, regional and national level
Exceptional quality of practice backed by comprehensive support services
Optimal staffing ratios and flexible scheduling options
“A” rated professional liability insurance
Extensive variety of practice settings coast-to-coast
Competitive compensation including several benefit options
Opportunities for professional development, mentoring and career advancement
Comprehensive education and training on leadership, management and clinical best practices, including a wide variety of CME programs
Colleague referral bonus program


Benefits vary by division, clinical specialty and employment status

Company Information: Company Information
Quality people. Quality care. Quality of LIFE. EmCare is a national physician-led practice management company. This publically held company provides outsourced clinical department recruitment, staffing, management and billing/collection services for hundreds of hospitals and health systems nationwide.

Known for its unique structure, EmCare develops local practices, supports them with regionally-located clinical leadership and operational personnel and provides them access to unprecedented national resources. Each EmCare practice has its own unique culture, but all sites recruit and hire clinicians who share the company's core values of being patient-focused, customer-centered and caregiver-inspired.

EmCare is a family of companies, each of which has clinical staffing needs. Full-time, part-time, and independent contractor opportunities are available through EmCare.

Candidates considering a career within the EmCare family of companies will find a variety of community types (from small towns to major urban areas), practice settings (small hospitals to major academic health systems), job levels (entry level to senior management), and competitive pay with exceptional benefits. Specialties supported include Emergency Medicine, Hospital Medicine, Surgery, Anesthesia and Radiology/Teleradiology.

EmCare is proud to be an EOE/AA employer. EmCare. Making Healthcare Work Better.

Job title: STS National Database Manager - Adult Cardiac Surgery
education level/skills required / respon: Work with representatives from the Society of Cardiovascular Anesthesiologists (SCA) to support the anesthesiology component of the ACSD....
job summary:
Job Descriptions:
Job Summary
Manage clinical and operational aspects of the Adult Cardiac Surgery Database (ACSD), including data collection and software specification upgrades, data manager training, and Core Group support. Work with volunteer cardiothoracic surgeons on workforces and task forces associated with the ACSD.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Clinical operations of the ACSD
Oversee and manage the specification update team made up of task force members, data warehousing and analysis staff, and data managers to formulate updated recommendations for software specifications, data definitions, and report formatting.
Assist with data mapping between versions of software specifications and with development of supporting materials, including data collection forms and training manuals.
Collaborate with data warehousing and analysis staff to help ensure timely completion of the vendor software certification process.
Oversee rollouts of new versions of software specifications.

Manage operational activities to promote data integrity:
Oversee data audit functions (including identification of audit elements), external data audit contractor, and communication of data audit results to participants and task forces; identify opportunities for improved data definitions and data manager training
Review harvest data quality reports to identify gaps requiring additional data manager education or data definition clarification
Develop and facilitate data manager training activities for the ACSD, based on clinical knowledge and a thorough understanding of the registry.
Assist in developing content for the ACSD aspects of the annual Advances in Quality & Outcomes conference.
Facilitate Database Core Group activities, including the development of the FAQ documents on STS website.
Create materials and programs to support data managers, including manuals, learning modules and webinars, in consultation with the Core Group and staff from the Education and Member Services Department.
Collaborate with the STS National Database Manager for GTSD, CHSD and staff from the Marketing and Communications Department to produce four National Database newsletters annually.
Answer questions related to Database content, data collection, report interpretation, HIPAA, etc.
Use clinical and Database knowledge to support the development and testing of National Quality Forum measures applicable to the ACSD.
Work with representatives from the Society of Cardiovascular Anesthesiologists (SCA) to support the anesthesiology component of the ACSD.

Administrative
Support workforces and associated task forces related to the ACSD.
Assist at STS and AATS meetings, as needed.
Assist Director with budget planning related to the ACSD.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Required Experience:
Education
Bachelor’s degree in a healthcare field is required. Master’s degree is preferred.

Experience
Minimum of five years of related work experience, preferably in a medical specialty association or hospital environment, is required, including three years of experience working with clinical databases. Knowledge of medical terminology and information, preferably in cardiothoracic surgery is preferred.

Essential Skills and Abilities
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to lead and direct staff
Excellent organizational, planning, and follow-through capabilities; attention to detail is essential.
Ability to multi-task and manage several projects simultaneously
Ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with co-workers, volunteer leaders, other organizations, and industry contacts; tact, diplomacy, and good judgment are essential.
Positive attitude in the workplace
Flexibility and adaptability to changing daily activities and schedules
Ability to travel, as necessary

Characteristics
Energy, creativity, initiative, eagerness to learn, and professionalism required. Candidate must exemplify the STS Core Values of Quality, Innovation, Professionalism, Inclusiveness and Teamwork.

'Equal Opportunity Employer: disability/veteran'
Keyword: STS National Database Manager - Adult Cardiac Surgery
From: The Society of Thoracic Surgeons

job summary:
Located in the northern Chicago suburb of Buffalo Grove, Veterinary Specialty Center, the leading multidisciplinary referral center in the Midwest for 40 years, is searching for Emergency and Critical Care veterinarians.


We are looking for candidates that are internship-trained or have a minimum two years of clinical experience to fill positions at our expanding Buffalo Grove and Chicago 24-hour locations.


Our main hospital is a 27,000 sq. ft. state-of-the-art facility that is home to more than 38 veterinarians & specialists, 200 support staff members, and nine departments. VSC has one of the strongest specialty teams in the country that collaborate closely on emergency and referral cases. Our specialty services include Anesthesiology, Behavior, Clinical Pathology, Dermatology, Emergency and Critical Care, Grief Counseling, Holistic Medicine/Acupuncture, Internal Medicine, Massage Therapy, Nephrology, Neurology, Nutrition, Oncology, Pain Management, Radiology & Imaging, Rehabilitative Therapy, and Surgery.


We have three satellite locations as well: Chicago (in collaboration with the University of Illinois), Crystal Lake (in collaboration with Companion Animal Specialty & Emergency Hospital), and Mokena (in collaboration with the Animal Emergency of Mokena).


VSC has state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment tools, such as in-house MRI & CT, nuclear scintigraphy & nuclear medicine, digital & computed radiology, linear accelerator/radiation therapy, endoscopy, thermography, ultrasound, 12 channel ECG telemetry, long-term mechanical ventilation, fluoroscopy, echocardiography, in-house reference laboratory, hyperbaric oxygen therapy, and hemodialysis/CRRT.


We are also one of the few specialty centers that are still privately owned. We believe that this fundamental difference allows us the freedom to treat our team members with the respect and professionalism they deserve. We also have the best team of technicians and in-house staff and administrators to assist in patient care.


At VSC, we emphasize excellence in medicine. That focus has produced a specialty team that takes pride in our work and empowers our staff to provide superb care to our patients, the pet owners and referral veterinarians who rely on us.


VSC prides itself on providing an outstanding work environment with excellent compensation and benefits. Our benefits include competitive salaries, health and pet insurance, vison and dental insurance, CE stipend, 401K plan, college saving plan, paid time off, disability, and more.


Inquiries about this dynamic opportunity should be direct to:


Jennifer Herring, DVM, MS, DACVECC


Veterinary Specialty Center


1515 Busch Parkway


Buffalo Grove, IL 60089


jherring@vetspecialty.com


Fax: (847) 808-8900

job summary:
ASST/ASSOC/FULL PROFESSOR OF ANESTHESIOLOGY. The University of Illinois at Chicago’s Department of Anesthesiology is seeking additional anesthesiology faculty to join our rapidly growing Division of Pediatric Anesthesiology. The applicant must be fellowship trained and board certified or board eligible in pediatric anesthesiology.

Duties of the position include providing anesthesia for both pediatric and adult patients at the University of Illinois, and covering challenging cases at Shriners Hospital for Children ranging from orthopedic procedures to difficult airways in patients with craniofacial abnormalities. The candidate will also participate in resident and fellow education.

The applicants are required to complete an online job application through https://jobs.uic.edu/ and upload a letter of application, CV, and names and address of three references by November 30, 2016. For questions regarding the position, contact David E. Schwartz, MD, Professor and Head at: chairanesthesia@uic.edu.

The University of Illinois at Chicago is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

The University of Illinois may conduct background checks on all job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent offer. Background checks will be performed in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

education level/skills required / respon: The Anesthesia Technician II provides perioperative technical and clinical support to the members of the anesthesia team in relation to all anesthesia
job summary:
The Anesthesia
Technician II provides perioperative technical and clinical support to the
members of the anesthesia team in relation to all anesthesia procedures.
1. Clinical Responsibilities: The Anesthesia Technician II works as a member of
the surgical team, providing patient care under the direct supervision of a
licensed anesthesia provider. Clinical responsibilities may include but are not
limited to the following: Cell Saver-Blood Salvage (sets up and runs machine
during surgery). Blood draws from patient lines (e.g. ACT-Clotting time,
ABGs, venous samples, type & cross). Immediate emergency response
- provide clinical and technical support. Assists with patient
transfer (to and from the OR bed). Removes jewelry (e.g. rings /
collaborating with circulating nurse re: OR protocol). Assists with
patient positioning (especially arm placement and security). Places
monitoring equipment (e.g. ECG leads, BP cuff, BIS Sensor, Pulse Oximeter
probe). Assists with intubation, which may include the following at the
direction of the anesthesiologist: ensures all necessary equipment available
& in working order, applies cricoid pressure, assists with fiberoptic
intubations, provides jaw thrust, tongue pull, pulls stylet, inflates ET cuff,
secures airway or manually ventilate while the anesthesiologist confirms
placement). Prepares patient for access line placement and invasive
monitoring (e.g. preps patient, prepares sterile field / equipment, prepares
arterial lines, central venous lines, additional peripherial vascular lines,
cardiac catheters, femoral lines, unilateral ventilation, fiberoptic TEE probe
management). Assists the licensed anesthesia provider in confirming
patient identification. Verifies blood products per hospital policy
(Blood Administration 5.91) with the hospital approved health care professional
who will be transfusing the blood product. The Anesthesia Technician II does
not transfuse any fluids including blood products. Under the direction of
the licensed anesthesia provider assembles IV fluids for infusion, including
blood products. The Anesthesia Technician II but does not transfuse or monitor
infused fluids. Provides patient security (e.g. during placement of
spinal & epidural catheters, during intubation and extubation, during
induction / intubation, and during extubation / recovery from
anesthesia). Patient Transport. 2. Anesthesia Equipment: Prepares,
disinfects, and troubleshoots all anesthesia-related equipment and supplies for
anesthetic procedures. This includes but is not limited to the following:
Anesthesia Machines (e.g. Draeger Narkomed GS, Draeger Apollo,
Datex-Ohmeda ADU, Draeger Mobile Machine and Tiro). Performs
anesthesiology-related point-of-care testing. Monitors (e.g. GE Marquette
Patient Monitor, Capnography and Gas monitors, Aspect BIS Monitor). Drug
Infusion Pumps (e.g. Alaris, Hospira). Blood Infusion Equipment (e.g.
Belmont). Hotline-Fluid warming equipment. TEE-Echo Probe.
Intubation equipment, including fiberoptic bronchoscopes and video
laryngoscopy. Gas cylinders. Breathing circuits. Assists with
movement of equipment and supplies to support room turn-over and
readiness. Maintains appropriate inventory levels of supplies and
equipment related to anesthesia care. 3. Off site: Provides clinical and
technical support to anesthesia staff wherever needed in the institution (e.g.
ICUs, IR, MRI, GI, CT, EP, ED). Serves as a resource for anesthesia to
staff in other departments. Requirement: Physical ability to lift,
push, pull and move at least 35 lbs. Attend in-services for continuing
education / maintenance of competency. Orients new staff to the
Anesthesia Technician role. Additional responsibilities as
assigned. Patient care/age specific responsiblities and qualifications:
Child 3-12 years old, adolescence 12-18 years old, early adult 18-29 years old,
young adult 29-40 years old, middle adult 40-64 years old, and geriatrics 64
years and older. The Anesthesia Technician II position is 24/7 coverage,
and all positions are rotating to meet the needs of the department and
hospital. AA/EOE.


Required:

Completion of an Associate Degree program, or 1-2 years Anesthesia Technician experience, or similar technical health care experience.

Desired:

Basic Life Support (required upon hire).
Certified Anesthesia Technician (certification required within 6 months of eligibility).
Completion of Bachelor's Degree, or Certified Anesthesia Technician.

Our Joliet Anesthesia practice is seeking a full-time BC/BE anesthesiologist, proficient in cardiac, to join our growing group practice in Merrillville and Gary, IN. Cases include: general, cardiac, thoracic, neuro, OB, healthy peds and bread and butter cases. Residents and fellows are welcomed to apply.


Gary and Merrillville, IN are in Lake County located by the beautiful shores of Lake Michigan and only 30 miles southeast of Chicago. Lake County offers a myriad of recreational activities such as golf, water sports, casinos, hiking trails and horseback riding. The area also offers many restaurants, shopping centers and cultural arts. Only thirty minutes away, the city of Chicago is home to several major league sports franchises and numerous universities. job summary:
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
:


Management of all Surgical Services staff. Conduit to hospital nursing operations to ensure adherence to operations standards. Executes nursing professional practice model and professional development to achieve Magnet accreditation. Collaboratively structures block time schedule to best accommodate workload, surgical prioritization and efficiency. Work with Preoperative Team, NMG, Private Faculty, NLFH and NMH hospital leadership to plan strategically for future needs, both short and long term, and throughput of Surgical Services for all phases of care (pre-op, intra-op, post-op).Define performance standards, goals and initiatives to continually monitor and improve Surgical Services Operations. Acts as team member with Director of Anesthesia and Director of Surgical Services - meeting weekly to discuss plans and remediation related to operations. Develop OR Budget, Capital Equipment Planning List, and expansion planning with Perioperative Team for Executive Leadership Approval. Responsible for achieve budget targets to support exceptional financial performance. Ensure departmental compliance with accreditation, licensure and other regulatory standards including IDPH, Joint Commission and CMS. Establishes and executes Establish annual and long-term program or service goals, strategies and plans (including business plans) consistent with hospital goals and strategies. Develop and maintain strong working relationships with clinical leadership as appropriate and senior management to ensure close coordination of medical staff and administrative goals, plans, and strategies. Acts as a good citizen of the organization as exemplified by integrity and ethics in personal behavior and willingness to participate in task forces, special events (e.g. United Way), and/or external community commitments. Additional Functions, Work with the Triad to manage and assure Anesthesia Technician and Technologist staffing, education, and assigned duties are appropriate. Work with Anesthesiology Medical Directors to assure smooth implementation of new operations and quality programs. Work with ACMO for Pharmacy and Therapeutics to manage addition of and education concerning new drug additions to the formulary, and to manage drug shortages. Work with Anesthesiology Equipment Coordinator to manage the evaluation of new equipment, manage the addition of and education concerning new equipment, and manage the replacement of aging equipment. Serves to support Nursing’s Shared Leadership Structure as an active leader on the Chief Nurse Committee. Develops and implements, in collaboration with the CNE and other Director of Nursing, Nursing’s Strategic Plan. Strive for personal excellence and advanced professional growth in skills and knowledge required for effectiveness in current position; set and carry out personal development objectives as part of annual objective setting process which are appropriate for position and personal development objectives, e.g.: Leadership roles in relevant professional groups. Publication in professional publications. Participation in relevant association meetings. Continuing education as participant, presenter, and/or planner. Mentor/teach own and other staff through informal and formal roles. EOE/AA.

QUALIFICATIONS
:


Required:

The Director shall be and remain a member in good standing of the NMH.
The Director shall be qualified by training; experience, interest and demonstrated current ability, and shall be willing and able to discharge the administrative qualifications of his/her office.
He/She should have proven ability as manager and leader.
Bachelors Degree in Nursing and a Masters degree in Nursing Administration or Business Administration, 7-10 years in progressive management roles including management of large capital and operational budgets, demonstrated experience in managing relationships with surgeons and physicians, anesthesiologists, and senior management.
Previous OR management experience.

Desired:

The Director should possess administrative, interpersonal, and management skills, excellent clinical judgment and quality assessment skills and a working knowledge of trends in hospital management and economics.
Demonstrates ability to interact with individuals of multiple disciplines.
Certification in area of specialty.

job summary:
Director, Distribution and Partnerships


Job Summary

Shape your future


The Director, Distribution & Partnerships for CONMED’s Healthcare Solutions Team reports to the Vice President & General Manager Healthcare Solutions, and is responsible for managing the strategic direction of CONMED's portfolio within the Distribution Channel, including opportunity definition, pursuit plan development and execution. Span of responsibilities includes Customer Relationship Management, Customer Advocacy, Strategic Planning, and interfacing within a matrix environment across all CONMED business units supporting Sales, Marketing and Delivery Teams. The role will align activities to CONMED strategic, commercial, and operational objectives. Management of MedSurg Distributors (e.g Owens & Minor, Cardinal Healthcare, Medline) and Custom Kit Packers (e.g. Cardinal Presource, Medical Action, DeRoyale).


Duties & Responsibilities:

Drive systematic process for gathering, assessment and integration of market and customer insights into opportunity development and product / service pull-through

Drive division engagement through market needs analysis and opportunity definition


Develop business plans and roadmaps, ensuring alignment with BU goals, resources and strategies as well as overall corporate goals and objectives


Create and manage pursuit development timelines (including deliverables, milestones and task owners)


Develop and manage budgets applicable to solutions development projects


Coordinate with HCS and Division Sales & Marketing Leadership Teams regarding key program decisions, issues, resources and constraints


Interact with operations / implementation teams to support delivery, performance tracking, opportunities for improvement


Develop on-going enhancements to current and future solution offerings that may include process or service improvements


Create content, drive development and delivery of training for sales and operational delivery teams


Identify and reduce/eliminate the grey market.

Strong communication and relationships. with internal and external customers, at varying levels throughout different organizations. Examples of key stakeholders are including but not limited to:


All CONMED Business Units: Dotted line responsibility to Sales and Marketing Leadership and Region Management.


Current and potential business partners: Existing BPO, JV, or provider/supplier relationship including other potential strategic and/or technical partnerships


National Associations: Association of Healthcare Resource Materials Management (AHRMM), Healthcare Financial Management Association (HFMA), Healthcare Information and Management Systems Society (HIMSS), American College of Healthcare Executives (ACHE), Health Industry Distributors Association (HIDA), Society for Healthcare Strategy and Market Development (SHSMD), Medical Device Supply Chain Council.


Customer Leadership: VP, Strategic Sourcing; VP Supply Chain; VP Resource Management; Chief Information Officer; Product Category Leads; VP/AD Sales; VP Operations


Industry experts throughout the Healthcare market:


Other duties as assigned


Work Experience:

Significant sales experience, particularly working across multiple divisions


Ability and proven track record in establishing, managing and over achieving a sales quota.


Prior experience working together with MedSurg Distributors


Prior experience working together with Custom Procedure Kit manufacturers

Experience putting together strategic plans with growth objectives 

Education Requirements:
Bachelor Degree required, MBA preferred


Knowledge Requirements:

Basic understanding of MS Office (spreadsheets, email, and Word processing)


Able to negotiate and review contracts, and be accountable for results


Good presentation skills with PowerPoint and a good communicator


Physical Requirements:

Able to travel between 40-60%, mostly domestically, with limited international

Benefits

Be rewarded 

CONMED offers competitive compensation


Excellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage


Short & long term disability plus life insurance – cost paid fully by CONMED


Retirement Savings Plan (401K) – company match dollar for dollar up to 7%


Employee stock purchase plan – allows stock purchases at discounted price


Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses


About CONMED

Get in


CONMED Corporation is a progressive, global medical device company. Through thoughtful leadership, innovation and team work, we are changing the future of medicine. Our 3,500 employees worldwide make meaningful contributions, positively impact the business, and advance in their careers as our company and product portfolio grows.


We are a leader in Orthopedics, General Surgery, Gynecology, Gastroenterology, Pulmonology, and Anesthesiology and our employees enjoy challenging and diverse job opportunities across these varied specializations. We are headquartered in upstate New York with additional domestic facilities in FL, CA, MA, NJ, CO, and GA. We have an international presence in more than 20 locations throughout Europe, Australia , Latin America, Asia, North America, and the Middle East .


CONMED is an Equal Opportunity Employer & an Affirmative Action Employer

education level/skills required / respon: Position Summary: The Certified Nurse Anesthetist provides anesthesia care in the operating room and off site settings, based on educational preparation and
job summary: Position Summary: The Certified Nurse Anesthetist provides anesthesia care in the operating room and off site settings, based on educational preparation and/or certification in the CNA role to a specific patient population. Care goals include preanesthesia assessment, administration of general and regional anesthesia, airway management and post anesthesia care and patient discharge. The CNA assumes the management of patients, functioning in both an independent and collaborative role with the physician, case manager, and other members of the health care team. As an expert practitioner, the CNA performs selected invasive procedures, designs individualized treatment plans, evaluates outcomes, and modifies the treatment plan as needed. The CNA facilitates the transition of patients between service units and provides/coordinates complex patient and family teaching. Recognizes and consistently applies knowledge of Loyola's 14 Magnet Forces. Position Requirements: Minimum Education: Required: Masters Degree Minimum Experience: Required: 3-5 years of previous job-related experience Preferred: 6-10 years of previous job-related experience Licensure/Certifications: Required: ACLS (Advanced Cardio Life Support Certified) ,Current Registered Nurse License State of Illinois,NBCRNA-National Board of Cert & Recert for Nurse Anesthestists,Nurse Practitioner License State of Illinois Preferred: CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation) Position Responsibilities: Ensures that care delivered to patients, meets/exceeds standards of care and is provided according to Loyola University Medical Center?s mission, strategic plans and all internal/external regulations, policies and procedures. Functions independently and collaboratively with the physician to provide continuity of health care services for individuals, families or groups. Evaluates the health status, acute episodes of illness, and health care needs of individuals through emphasis on comprehensive history, physical exam, and psychosocial assessment. Analyzes data to identify health/illness problems, the human responses to actual or potential health/illness problems, identifies variations from the norm in diagnoses emergent problems and complications. Designs and evaluates individualized treatment plan. Demonstrates and maintains expertise in the performance of selected complex invasive procedures. Coordinates care for optimal continuity of care across the health care continuum. Facilitates patient/family participation in health care by identifying learning needs and providing specialized education to enhance decision making. Exhibits professionalism by performing research, education, and leadership in clinical practice.

Job in Burbank IL
An exceptional career opportunity is now available for a CRNA in one of Illinois’s premiere hospital systems. This medical center is seeking an ambitious and knowledgeable Nurse Anesthetist with a passion for excellent clinical care.

The CRNA will be working in a rapidly expanding non-profit medical center that provides a wide range of medical services to a highly diverse patient population. This hospital is well known for their excellent clinical care and has been recognized as one of the Nation’s Top 100 Hospitals.

The CRNA will be working alongside a highly skilled team of anesthesiologists, surgeons, physicians, and nursing staff and will be responsible for preparing each patient for anesthesia to ensure proper sedation and pain management.

Not only will the CRNA be working in one of the strongest hospital systems in Illinois, they will also be within close proximity to multiple high-end restaurants, shops, and entertainment venues in downtown Chicago. This will give the nurse anesthetist a wide variety of fun amenities and activities to choose from outside of work.

Take advantage of this amazing career opportunity today as positions within this reputable medical center are highly sought after by healthcare professionals.

The CRNA will be offered a highly competitive salary along with a full suite of benefits.

LPNs also ensure Medical Record documentation is in SOAP format, problem oriented and corresponds to the therapeutic order. Ensures all documentation is timed, legible and signed. Ensures all verbal or telephone orders are countersigned within seventy-two (72) hours. * Contribute to the assessment of the health status of patients. * Participate in the development and modification of a patient\'s plan of care. * Perform delegated tasks, activities and functions that are consistent with prior educational preparation and within scope of practice. * Provide direct basic care to assigned (multiple) clients within the structure of the healthcare program at their facility. * Provide safe and effective nursing care and assumes responsibility for the care delivered. * Implements patient education based on established teaching plans.Benefits of a Corizon Health LPN * Paid Time Off * Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance * Tuition Assistance * 401(k) with company match * Free online Continuing Education program * Comprehensive Onboarding * Mentor and Preceptor ProgramsAs the correctional healthcare pioneer and leader for 35+ years, Corizon Health provides client partners with high quality healthcare and reentry services that will improve the health and safety of our patients reduce recidivism and better the communities where we live and work.This position may require a background check, security clearance, and/or drug screening. Corizon Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. job summary:
MedVet Medical & Cancer Centers for Pets is currently seeking an Accounts Receivable/ Accounts Payable associate to join our Finance team in our Columbus, Ohio practice. This individual will be responsible for handling client billing issues for multiple locations. This includes some "soft collections" and understanding of collection laws.

About MedVet Medical & Cancer Centers for Pets:
Founded in 1988, MedVet is one of the largest veterinarian-owned multispecialty and emergency practices in the country. Three of MedVet’s Ohio medical centers (Columbus, Cincinnati & Dayton) were the first AAHA Accredited Specialty Referral hospitals in the state of Ohio. MedVet Cincinnati was named the AAHA Accredited Referral Practice of the Year for 2016.The MedVet team provides expert specialized care in areas including anesthesiology, cardiology, dermatology, emergency and critical care, integrative medicine, internal medicine, interventional radiology, medical oncology, neurology, ophthalmology, radiation oncology, radiology, rehabilitative services, and surgical services.

Responsibilities:
Answer and return phone calls about billing questions.

Apply payments to client accounts.

Process credit card payments.

Call clients in a timely manner when an additional deposit is needed.

Speak to clients that are on-site who need help with financial issues.

Follow up on payment agreements.

Work with Clinical managers and client relations on billing issues and complaints.

Print monthly statements and mail them to all regular clients.

Analysis outstanding balances and follow up with letters or phone calls.

Send 10 day letters to clients that have not responded to verbal or written communication.

Send clients that do not respond to the 10 day letters to the collection agency.

Update and maintain collection spreadsheets.

Handle relationship with collection agency and follow up on any collection issues.

Apply discounts to client and employee accounts as needed.

Assist with open PVL's and open Invoices.

Review client credit AP report weekly and process client returns.

Assist with daily deposits and balancing as needed.

Assist with accounts payable close as needed.

Take deposits to the bank as needed.

Perform other duties as requested.

Be competent utilizing Microsoft Office programs including MSWord, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook, etc.

Proficient knowledge of Excel and be able to work with complicated formulas.

Working knowledge of QuickBooks.

All accounts receivable/accounts payable accountants will back up each other not limited to the following:

Speak to clients that are on-site who need help with financial issues.

Change client ID's, classification, prompts as needed.

Discount when client is here and ready to check out.

Post payments to accounts and process credit card Care Credit payments including refunds.

Call clients if payments do not match open balance.

Adjustments to client accounts.

Education and/or Experience:
An Associates degree in Accounting or Business is a plus, as well as 2-5 years of accounts receivable experience is required.

All candidates must complete an acceptable background check, including references and a pre-employment drug test.

Full benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, short-term and long term disability, life insurance, 401K, PTO and pet care discounts are available.

With practices in Ohio, Kentucky, Louisiana, Alabama and Indiana. MedVet is one of the most dynamic specialty practices in veterinary medicine. Please visit our website at www.medvetforpets.com/employment and check out our Facebook pages for additional information.

About MedVet Medical & Cancer Centers for Pets:
Founded in 1988, MedVet is one of the largest veterinarian-owned multispecialty and emergency practices in the country. Responsibilities:
Perform vaccine demonstrations.

Perform vaccine formulations.

Assist with appointments.

Assist with various end-of-day duties.

Assist with phone calls and scheduling appointments.

Assist with patient restraint.

Qualifications:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Excellent client service skills and phone etiquette.

Ability to inspire, teach, multitask and be a highly functional team member.

Self-motivated.

Attention to detail.

Work successfully as a team member and autonomously.

Sense of urgency.

Critical thinking skills.

Effective patient restraint.

Proficient in calculations (drugs, constant rate infusions, unit conversions, etc.).

Flexibility with work hours and able to work additional hours when necessary.

Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

Prior veterinary experience required.

All candidates must complete an acceptable background check, including references and a pre-employment drug test.

Shift: The position is full time, Monday - Friday 9am-530pm. Weekends, on-call and holidays based on needs of the department.

Full benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, short-term and long term disability, life insurance, 401K, PTO, continuing education, uniform allowance and pet care discounts are available.

job summary:
MedVet Medical & Cancer Centers for Pets is currently seeking a Purchasing Agent to join our Operations team. The Operations Purchasing team is accountable for the design and execution of demand and supply planning, forecasting, product deployment and expediting processes; and the development and implementation of a stocking optimization model to minimize costs and inventory while delivering on service requirements.


About MedVet Medical & Cancer Centers for Pets:


Founded in 1988, MedVet is one of the largest veterinarian-owned multispecialty and emergency practices in the country. Three of MedVet’s Ohio medical centers (Columbus, Cincinnati & Dayton) were the first AAHA Accredited Specialty Referral hospitals in the state of Ohio. MedVet Columbus was named the AAHA Accredited Referral Practice of the Year for 2014. MedVet Cincinnati was named the AAHA Accredited Referral Practice of the year for 2016.


The MedVet team provides expert specialized care in areas including anesthesiology, cardiology, dermatology, emergency and critical care, integrative medicine, internal medicine, interventional radiology, medical oncology, neurology, ophthalmology, radiation oncology, radiology, rehabilitative services, and surgical services.


Summary

Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
Works on projects of moderate scope and complexity
Identifies possible solutions to a variety of technical problems and takes actions to resolve.
Applies judgment within defined parameters
Receives general guidance; may receive more detailed instruction on new projects.
Work reviewed for sound reasoning and accuracy.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities Include the following, other duties may be assigned.

Process purchase orders for MedVet sites to suppliers using hospital management system.
Research and procure equipment and supplies as needed. This includes but is not limited to clinical, office, and/or facilities equipment and supplies.
Set up par levels for pharmacy and supplies in the hospital management system, and update them as needed.
Track orders from order to delivery and expedite them as needed.
Comply with regulatory agencies requirements. This includes but is not limited to DEA, SBOP, FDA, OSHA, etc.
Works collaboratively with clinical managers and leadership teams across sites to determine weekly orders for consistent and on time for processing.
Ensure that inventory is processed and received into hospital management system accurately and on time, while updating cost changes.
Works collaboratively with Administrative Leadership Team on hospital capital equipment needs.
Set up and discontinue items in the hospital management system.
Process returns of product and/or equipment to suppliers.
Provide on call support for team members.
Perform completion of tasks as delegated.
Participate in meetings and functions as a team member.
Audit medical records when requested and/or indicated.
Execute on process improvements to achieve goals on productivity and efficiency metrics, while reducing and potentially eliminating process errors or defects.
This position may require up to 10% travel to other MedVet sites.
All candidates must complete an acceptable background check, including references and a pre-employment drug test


Competencies

To perform this job successfully, an individual must demonstrate the following competencies:


Problem Solving: Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner.

Customer Service: Manages difficult and emotional staff, referral partner and client situations.

Teamwork: Balances team and individual responsibilities. Contributes to building a positive team spirit and highly functional team.

Ethics: Treats people with respect. Works with integrity and ethically.

Professionalism: Reacts well under pressure.

Safety and Security: Observes safety and security procedures.

Adaptability: Deals with frequent change, delays and unexpected events.

Attendance/Punctuality: Is consistently at work and on time. Ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; arrives at meetings/appointments on time.

Dependability: Follows instructions: responds to management requests.

Initiative: Asks for and offers help when needed. Seeks increased responsibilities.

Design: Demonstrates attention to detail.

Oral Communication: Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations. Responds well to questions. Participates in meetings.

Interpersonal Skills: Displays a willingness to make decisions.

Judgment: Displays a willingness to make decisions.

Innovation: Generates suggestions for improving work. Effectively creates and facilitates change.

Delegation: Delegates work assignments.

Must be competent utilizing Microsoft Office programs including MSWord, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.

Ability to learn industry-specific program.

job summary:
The Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist is an advanced practice nurse that works in collaboration with the surgical team, providing and utilizing a variety of anesthetics for medical and surgical procedures. The Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist cares for the patient during the course of the anesthetic including preoperative assessment, administration and maintenance, and recovery.


Responsibilities:

A. Anesthetic Management


The CRNA performs a preoperative assessment/chart review of the patient to formulate an anesthetic plan according to the individual needs of the patient.


The CRNA responds appropriately to any significant physiological, anesthesia changes and treats accordingly, informing the staff anesthesiologist when appropriate.


The CRNA provides for optimum resuscitative care for life threatening conditions and/or emergent situations in the hospital.


B. Professional Development


The CRNA will assist with orientation of new CRNA staff.


The CRNA will assist with orientation and instruction of student nurse anesthetists and other anesthesia personnel.


The CRNA will assist in the evaluation of these professional personnel and report to the Director of Clinical Education according to policy stated by the Department of Anesthesiology.


All presentations under the auspices of Children’s Anesthesia Associates, Inc., and the Department of Anesthesiology require peer review and approval of the Corporation and the Chairman of the Department of Anesthesiology.


The CRNA attends educational offerings and in services to maintain and expand clinical knowledge base.


The CRNA is eligible for or a member in good standing of the AANA and meets continuing education standards in accordance with AANA requirements as measured by employee testimony.


The CRNA implement anesthesia practice changes based on research findings and current standards by demonstrating the use of accepted anesthesia technology and pharmacology.


The CRNA participates in research projects as directed.


C. Work Habits


The CRNA works when scheduled according to the terms prescribed by the Corporation in accordance with the Employment Agreement. Clinical assignments are completed in a timely fashion.


The CRNA agrees to perform tasks as required or directed by the Corporation.


The CRNA develops and maintains a positive work climate and demonstrates overall adherence to the team concept of anesthetic care.


The CRNA identifies strategies to increase the effective use of resources.


D. Conduct


The CRNA demonstrates professional and ethical conduct and compassion in all patient interactions and demonstrates respect and concern for all members of the health care team.


Other information:

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED


The CRNA must be a graduate of an accredited school of registered nursing with current licensure as an RN in the state of Ohio and the CRNA must be a graduate of an accredited school of nurse anesthesia with eligibility for membership with the AANA and completion of the NBCRNA national examination.


MINIMUM PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS


Note frequency as Constantly (67-100%), Frequently (34-66%) and Occasionally (0-33%) for each requirement. Also note any lifting requirements with pound limit.


Sitting - Occasionally

Talking on phone/in person - Frequently

Typing on a keyboard - Frequently

Standing/walking - Frequently


The above list of duties is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this classification. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive list of duties performed by the individual so classified, nor is it intended to limit or modify the right of any supervisor to assign, direct, and control the work of employees under his/her supervision.

Detail oriented

Associates Degree

Founded in 1988, MedVet is one of the largest veterinarian-owned multispecialty and emergency practices in the country. Three of MedVet’s Ohio medical centers (Columbus, Cincinnati & Dayton) were the first AAHA Accredited Specialty Referral hospitals in the state of Ohio. MedVet Columbus was named the AAHA Accredited Referral Practice of the Year for 2014. MedVet Cincinnati was named the AAHA Accredited Referral Practice of the Year for 2016.

The EM Physician role will be working in the Emergency Medicine specialty, located in Jack Hughston Memorial Hospital - EM Phenix City, AL. Please contact Olevia Yates at olevia.yates@emcare.com for additional benefits information.

Job Details: We are seeking Full and Part Time Emergency Medicine Physicians in Phenix City, AL­ Physician Benefits Competitive hourly rates Flexible full-time, part-time, moonlighting, and PRN positions available Independent Contractor status­ Physician Requirements A candidate must be Board Certified/Board Eligible in EM/IM/FP Current on ACLS, BCLS, and PALS certifications Possess a current, unrestricted Alabama medical license, DEA, and Alabama ­Controlled Substances­ registration

Facility Information: Located in Phenix City, Alabama, just across the Chattahoochee River from the famed Hughston Clinic campus, Jack Hughston Memorial Hospital is an advanced acute-care hospital, offering a range of services, including orthopaedic and general surgery, physical therapy, diagnostic imaging, a pharmacy, a full laboratory, and a 24-hour emergency room.­ Comprising 110,000 square feet with 70 private patient rooms and six operating suites and offering the best in medical technology, Jack Hughston Memorial Hospital is ideally equipped to provide patients with excellent medical care.­ Emergency Department features 14,000 annual patient visits Subspecialty backup coverage in anesthesiology and surgery Ranked top 10% nationwide for both orthopedic and joint replacement care­

Community Information: Phenix City, Alabama is ­an All-American City with a rich history and a strong dedication to a progressive future. This blossoming community is located seconds away from Columbus, Georgia, and has ample recreation, cultural and educational opportunities, and a fantastic business climate.­­ Jack Hughston Memorial Hospital strives to deliver the highest quality patient care­ and is an ­integral part of the surrounding Phenix ­City community.

Benefits and Compensation: EmCare is a dynamic, physician-led organization which has been offering exceptional career opportunities since 1972. With more than 12,000 affiliated providers coast-to-coast, EmCare is nationally-recognized for delivering clinical excellence supported through innovation, integration and exceptional leadership.
Whether you are considering full-time, part-time or independent contractor opportunities with EmCare, you can rest assured you will be working for an industry-leader who delivers a vast array of benefits unmatched within the industry, including:

Physician-led organization
Strong leadership on a local, regional and national level
Exceptional quality of practice backed by comprehensive support services
Optimal staffing ratios and flexible scheduling options
“A” rated professional liability insurance
Extensive variety of practice settings coast-to-coast
Competitive compensation including several benefit options
Opportunities for professional development, mentoring and career advancement
Comprehensive education and training on leadership, management and clinical best practices, including a wide variety of CME programs
Colleague referral bonus program


Benefits vary by division, clinical specialty and employment status

Company Information: Company Information
Quality people. Quality care. Quality of LIFE. EmCare is a national physician-led practice management company. This publically held company provides outsourced clinical department recruitment, staffing, management and billing/collection services for hundreds of hospitals and health systems nationwide.

Known for its unique structure, EmCare develops local practices, supports them with regionally-located clinical leadership and operational personnel and provides them access to unprecedented national resources. Each EmCare practice has its own unique culture, but all sites recruit and hire clinicians who share the company's core values of being patient-focused, customer-centered and caregiver-inspired.

EmCare is a family of companies, each of which has clinical staffing needs. Full-time, part-time, and independent contractor opportunities are available through EmCare.

Candidates considering a career within the EmCare family of companies will find a variety of community types (from small towns to major urban areas), practice settings (small hospitals to major academic health systems), job levels (entry level to senior management), and competitive pay with exceptional benefits. Specialties supported include Emergency Medicine, Hospital Medicine, Surgery, Anesthesia and Radiology/Teleradiology.

EmCare is proud to be an EOE/AA employer. EmCare. Making Healthcare Work Better.
