For confidential consideration please forward your formal CV to:

Brian Richardson

Senior Physician Recruiter

The Nemours Foundation

brichard@nemours.org


As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours is committed to providing all children with their best chance to grow up healthy. We offer integrated, family-centered care to more than 280,000 children each year in our pediatric hospitals, specialty clinics and primary care practices in Delaware, Florida, Maryland, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Nemours strives to ensure a healthier tomorrow for all children – even those who may never enter our doors – through our world-changing research, education and advocacy efforts. At Nemours, our Associates help us deliver on the promise we make to every family we have the privilege of serving: to treat their child as if they were our own.


Located in Orlando, Florida, Nemours Children’s Hospital is the newest addition to the Nemours integrated health care system. Our 100-bed pediatric hospital also features the area’s only 24-hour Emergency Department designed just for kids and outpatient pediatric clinics, including several specialties previously unavailable in the region. A hospital designed by families for families, Nemours Children’s Hospital blends the healing power of nature with the latest in health care innovation to deliver world-class care to the children of Central Florida and beyond. In keeping with our goal of bringing Nemours care into the communities we serve, we also provide specialty outpatient care in several clinics located throughout the region.


Our dedication to professionals who are dedicated to children frequently earns Nemours a spot on the list of top workplaces in the communities we serve. Our Associates enjoy comprehensive benefits, including our unique “Bridge to a Healthy Future” pediatric health plan, an integrated wellness program, opportunities for professional growth, and much more. As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.


Don’t miss out on important health care news and updates from Nemours – connect with us on…

education level/skills required / respon: Facebook (Fan Page) | YouTube | Twitter | Flickr Career, Employment, Jobs, Opening, Occupation, Compensation, Salary, Hospital, Health Care, Healthcare, Medical...
job summary:
Nemours Children’s Hospital is seeking a Pediatric Cardiologist to serve as Director of the Pediatric Echocardiography Lab at Nemours Children’s Hospital in Orlando, Florida. This is a full-time position for a non-invasive pediatric cardiologist who is boarded in pediatric cardiology and has additional fellowship training in advanced cardiac imaging, including all forms of echocardiography (transthoracic, transesophageal and fetal echo). Additional experience with cardiac MRI and CT is beneficial, but not required. Nemours' Heart Center services children in central Florida and beyond for all forms of cardiovascular care. This position will help extend and support an outreach network in central Florida.


The successful candidate will join a vibrant and rapidly growing, multi-institutional academic community of collaborative clinicians and scientists and will have an impact on the lives of the nation's third-most populous state. Join us in building a leading pediatric cardiology program to include academic and research programs within one of the leading pediatric health care enterprises in the United States.


Salary and benefits are competitive and commensurate with experience. Candidates must have completed an ABMS-recognized fellowship in Pediatric Cardiology, be board-certified in Pediatric Cardiology, and have an unrestricted Florida Medical License.


For confidential consideration, interested candidates should forward their formal CVs to:

Peter Wearden, MD

Director and Chair, Nemours Cardiac Center

Nemours Children's Hospital

c/o Aimee McKinney

aimee.mckinney@nemours.org


As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours provides world-class clinical care in four states: Delaware, Florida, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. In October 2012, Orlando became home to Nemours Children’s Hospital, part of a unique health campus that includes a new Nemours Children’s Clinic, an ambulatory diagnostic center, and extensive research and educational facilities. This new state-of-the-art, academic, free-standing children’s hospital will set a new standard for patient and family experience with up to 137 inpatient beds (over 250 inpatient beds in phase 2), ambulatory clinics, a research and education center including a 250-seat auditorium, translational research facilities (phase 1) and two research towers (phase 2), and full-service intensive and acute care inpatient and outpatient services covering more than 30 medical and surgical subspecialties.


Located in Orlando’s new Lake Nona Medical City, adjacent neighboring institutions – including the University of Central Florida (UCF) College of Medicine and Burnett Biomedical Research Institute, the Sanford-Burnham Medical Research Institute (with access to resources of 5 campuses nationwide), the Orlando Veterans Affairs Medical Center, the M.D. Anderson Orlando Cancer Research Center, and the University of Florida (UF) Translational Pharmacology Institute – offer resources and partnerships for vibrant research and academic collaboration, including an NIH-funded CTSI. The vision is for the institution to differentiate itself through a combination of excellent family experience, creation of multidisciplinary tertiary programs, and cutting-edge research.


Nemours, an equal opportunity employer, is committed to focusing on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.

The Department of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine at Nemours Children’s Hospital (NCH) is seeking an experienced pathologist to serve as Medical Director of Anatomic Pathology . The successful candidate should have an MD degree and possess (or be eligible for) unrestricted Florida medical licensure. He/she should be board-certified in anatomic pathology or anatomic and clinical pathology, as well as have certification or extensive experience in pediatric pathology. In addition, more than 3 years of experience as a pediatric pathologist with additional training in molecular genetics, cytology or other subspecialty focus is desirable. Candidates recently graduating from the pediatric pathology fellowship will be considered if they have an outstanding record of clinical and academic accomplishments in pediatric pathology and/or the above mentioned subspecialty area.


Interested applicants should submit curriculum vitae, as well as the names and contact information for three references, to:

Lili Miles, MD

Chairman of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine

Nemours Children’s Hospital

Orlando, FL 32827

Office phone: (407) 567-3883

Email: lili.miles@nemours.org


The Department of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine provides services in anatomic pathology, microbiology, clinical chemistry, hematology, flow cytometry and molecular testing. There is a wide spectrum of anatomic pathology subspecialties, such as bone and soft tissue pathology, muscle biopsy, epilepsy pathology and fine needle aspiration cytology. The successful candidate will join the team of three pathologists, including two pediatric pathologists and one hematopathologist.


Nemours Children’s Hospital, which is currently in its fourth year of operation, is a state-of-the-art pediatric hospital that serves as the anchor for pediatric medicine in Orlando’s new Medical City located in the renowned Lake Nona community (see http://learnlakenona.com ). The Medical City includes the University of Central Florida College of Medicine, Orlando VA hospital and University of Florida Research and Academic Center, all of which provide opportunities for research and academic collaboration. The Medical City complex, located minutes away from Orlando International Airport, includes multiple new residential developments, hotels, schools and business centers that make the Medical City part of a unique community. This is an ideal position for an individual with strong clinical and leadership skills who seeks personal and professional growth in a new and developing environment with many academic, administrative and clinical opportunities.


As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours is committed to providing all children with their best chance to grow up healthy. We offer integrated, family-centered care to more than 280,000 children each year in our pediatric hospitals, specialty clinics and primary care practices in Delaware, Florida, Maryland, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Nemours strives to ensure a healthier tomorrow for all children – even those who may never enter our doors – through our world-changing research, education and advocacy efforts. At Nemours, our Associates help us deliver on the promise we make to every family we have the privilege of serving: to treat their child as if they were our own.


As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.

Job title: Neonatologist, Board-Certified in Neonatology (Physician, Pediatrics, NICU)
education level/skills required / respon: Facebook (Fan Page) | YouTube | Twitter | Flickr Career, Employment, Jobs, Opening, Occupation, Compensation, Salary, Hospital, Health Care, Healthcare, Medical...
job summary:
Nemours is seeking a Neonatologist to join our staff in the Division of Neonatology at Nemours Children’s Hospital (NCH) in Orlando with the potential for a leadership role serving NCH and community outreach based on experience, expertise and interest. Physician candidates must be board-certified in Neonatology and eligible for an unrestricted Florida Medical License. Compensation and benefits will be competitive.

The division is composed of a collaborative group of neonatologists and advanced practitioners in a Level IIIC, all-private-room NICU at NCH, offering a full range of services, including HFOV, HFJV, iNO and whole body cooling, with access to a comprehensive range of pediatric subspecialists, specialists in maternal fetal medicine and interventional radiology, and a full surgical program, including neonatal interventional cardiology and cardiac surgery. Support staff include a unit-based pharmacist, dietician, respiratory therapist, OT and PT. The division also staffs Level II NICUs at leading hospitals serving the communities where our families live and work. A vibrant set of air and ground transport teams complement our service. We are members of the Vermont Oxford Network and active participants in the Florida Perinatal Quality Collaborative.

Responsibilities include clinical care of NICU patients, recruitment and retention of well-trained and qualified professional staff to the division, optimization of clinical operations in the NICU, mentorship of our team of faculty and advanced practitioners, practice management (including achieving productivity and safety targets and physician and family satisfaction scores), and support of the educational and research activities of the Division of Neonatology and Department of Pediatrics. The candidate is responsible for contributing to an environment that enhances the professional development of her/his division members with the goal of achieving a highly motivated team. The candidate will be attentive and responsive to the professional needs of the faculty, nurture staff in their professional development, and monitor work-life balance with the goal of achieving the best possible opportunities for professional advancement and satisfaction. In addition, the candidate will represent the "face" of Nemours in their specialty and will build external relationships, expand the sphere of influence, advocate for improvements and change within the specialty, and seek external support and philanthropy.

For confidential consideration, please submit formal CV to:
Caroline Chua, M.D.

Medical Director, Division of Neonatology

caroline.chua@nemours.org

Located in Orlando, Florida, Nemours Children’s Hospital is the newest addition to the Nemours Children’s Health Care System. Our 100-bed pediatric hospital also features the area’s only 24-hour Emergency Department designed just for kids and outpatient pediatric clinics, including several specialties previously unavailable in the region. A hospital designed by families for families, Nemours Children’s Hospital blends the healing power of nature with the latest in health care innovation to deliver world-class care to the children of Central Florida and beyond. In keeping with our goal of bringing Nemours care into the communities we serve, we also staff inpatient acute and intensive care units, emergency rooms and specialty outpatient clinics in our surrounding communities located throughout the region.

As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours is committed to providing all children with their best chance to grow up healthy. We offer integrated, family-centered care to more than 280,000 children each year in our pediatric hospitals, specialty clinics and primary care practices in Delaware, Florida, Maryland, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Nemours strives to ensure a healthier tomorrow for all children – even those who may never enter our doors – through our world-changing research, education and advocacy efforts. At Nemours, our Associates help us deliver on the promise we make to every family we have the privilege of serving: to treat their child as if they were our own.

Job title: Pediatric Emergency Medicine Physician, Board Cert/Elig (Pediatrician, ER, ED)
education level/skills required / respon: Facebook (Fan Page) | YouTube | Twitter | Flickr Career, Employment, Jobs, Opening, Occupation, Compensation, Salary, Hospital, Health Care, Healthcare, Medical...
job summary:
Nemours is seeking a Pediatric Emergency Medicine Physician to join our team in Orlando, Florida.


We are building the future of Pediatric Emergency Medicine at Nemours Children’s Hospital in Orlando. Our four year-old hospital is located in Lake Nona, an Orlando suburb that is a perfect fit for new professionals and families alike with access to outdoor activities, night life and family entertainment. There is easy access to downtown Orlando and all the theme parks, and it’s less than 45 minutes to the beach.


The positions in Pediatric Emergency Medicine offer unique opportunities to contribute to the ongoing development of a new department and academic division. With clinical process design and operations management, development of education programs, and initiation of quality research, the ambitious candidate will find challenges to meet their goals. As a new department, we are growing rapidly. Actual visits were 22% greater than the prior year for last year with steady growth leading to an anticipated 37,000 visits this year and 43,000 projected for next year. With this growth, our average daily visits for the first quarter of this year were 111 with median time to room and provider 13 and 34 minutes respectively, median LOS of 132 minutes. Commensurate with our numerical growth, we are seeing an increase in the acuity and complexity of our patients.


Our current PEM staff is eleven physicians, including one nocturnist and one weekender. In addition, we have two board-certified pediatricians and four advanced practice nurses providing double, triple and quadruple coverage in our department. We also have a core of moonlighters composed of advanced practice nurses and physicians boarded in pediatrics, various subspecialties. In order to manage our ongoing growth, we are budgeted to add another pediatrician and two PEM physicians, as well as an additional nurse practitioner over the next year. We are actively seeking enthusiastic BC/BE PEM physicians who are interested in helping to build this new academic program.


Interested candidates should forward their formal CVs to:


Brian Richardson, Physician Recruiter

The Nemours Foundation

brian.richardson@nemours.org


PEM Physician candidates must be board-certified or board-eligible in Pediatric Emergency Medicine. Candidates for acute care Pediatrician spots must be board-certified or board-eligible in General Pediatrics. All candidates must be eligible for unrestricted Florida Medical Licensure.

Job title: Division Chief, Neonatology, Neonatologist, Board Cert (Physician, Pediatrics)
education level/skills required / respon: Facebook (Fan Page) | YouTube | Twitter | Flickr Career, Employment, Jobs, Opening, Occupation, Compensation, Salary, Hospital, Health Care, Healthcare, Medical...
job summary:
Nemours is seeking a Neonatologist to join our staff in the Division of Neonatology at Nemours Children’s Hospital (NCH) in Orlando with the potential for a leadership role serving NCH and community outreach, based on experience, expertise and interest. Physician candidates must be board-certified in Neonatology and eligible for an unrestricted Florida Medical License. Compensation and benefits will be competitive.


The division is composed of a collaborative group of neonatologists and advanced practitioners in a Level IIIC all-private room NICU at NCH, offering a full range of services, including HFOV, HFJV, iNO and whole body cooling, with access to a comprehensive range of pediatric subspecialists, specialists in maternal fetal medicine and interventional radiology, and a full surgical program, including neonatal interventional cardiology and cardiac surgery. Support staff include a unit-based pharmacist, dietician, respiratory therapist, OT and PT. The division also staffs Level II NICUs at leading hospitals serving the communities where our families live and work. A vibrant set of air and ground transport teams complements our service. We are members of the Vermont Oxford Network and active participants in the Florida Perinatal Quality Collaborative.


Responsibilities include clinical care of NICU patients, recruitment and retention of well-trained and qualified professional staff to the division, optimization of clinical operations in the NICU, mentorship of our team of faculty and advanced practitioners, practice management (including achieving productivity and safety targets and physician and family satisfaction scores), and support of the educational and research activities of the Division of Neonatology and Department of Pediatrics. The candidate is responsible for contributing to an environment that enhances the professional development of her/his division members with the goal of achieving a highly motivated team. The candidate will be attentive and responsive to the professional needs of the faculty, nurture staff in their professional development, and monitor work-life balance with the goal of achieving the best possible opportunities for professional advancement and satisfaction. In addition, the candidate will represent the "face" of Nemours in their specialty and will build external relationships, expand the sphere of influence, advocate for improvements and change within the specialty, and seek external support and philanthropy.


For confidential consideration, please submit formal CV to:


Caroline Chua, MD

Medical Director, Division of Neonatology

caroline.chua@nemours.org


Located in Orlando, Florida, Nemours Children’s Hospital is the newest addition to the Nemours Children’s Health Care System. Our 100-bed pediatric hospital also features the area’s only 24-hour Emergency Department designed just for kids and outpatient pediatric clinics, including several specialties previously unavailable in the region. A hospital designed by families for families, Nemours Children’s Hospital blends the healing power of nature with the latest in health care innovation to deliver world-class care to the children of Central Florida and beyond. In keeping with our goal of bringing Nemours care into the communities we serve, we also staff inpatient acute and intensive care units, emergency rooms and specialty outpatient clinics in our surrounding communities located throughout the region.

Job title: Pediatric Anesthesiologist, BC/BE, PRN / Per Diem (Physician, Anesthesiology)
education level/skills required / respon: Please feel free to contact our Anesthesiology and Pain Management Department at 407-650-7646. Facebook (Fan Page) | YouTube | Twitter | Flickr Career,...
job summary:
Nemours Children's Hospital (NCH) in Orlando is seeking a Pediatric Anesthesiologist to join our growing medical staff. This is a full-time (1.0 FTE) position.

Physician candidates must have completed an ABMS-accredited fellowship program in Pediatric Anesthesia, be eligible for unrestricted Florida license, and be board-certified or board-eligible in Pediatric Anesthesia. Call will be for Pediatric Anesthesia service only with no adult call. Candidates with cardiac and pain management skills are encouraged to also apply. These skills are not required.

Please feel free to contact our Anesthesiology and Pain Management Department at 407-650-7646. Contact our Chair of Anesthesia, Dr. Carlos A. Archilla, MD, FAAP, at carlos.archilla@nemours.org . Please have your CV available.

Our new state-of-the-art, academic, freestanding children's hospital includes a new level for patient and family experience, up to 137 inpatient beds (over 250 in phase 2), ambulatory clinics, and a research and education center, including a 250-seat auditorium.

Located in Orlando's new Lake Nona Medical City, adjacent neighboring institutions – including the University of Central Florida (UCF) College of Medicine, Sanford-Burnham Medical Research Institute, Orlando Veterans Affairs Medical Center, and University of Florida (UF) Research and Academic Center – offer partners for research and academic collaboration. The vision is for the institution to differentiate itself through a combination of excellent family experience, creation of multidisciplinary tertiary programs, and cutting-edge research.

As one of the nation's leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours provides world-class clinical care in four states: Delaware, Florida, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. In 2012, Orlando became home to Nemours Children's Hospital, part of a unique, state-of-the-art health campus that includes a new Nemours Children's Clinic, an ambulatory diagnostic center, and extensive research and education facilities. As part of Nemours' fully integrated system of care, we have access to the specialists and resources of the Nemours/Alfred I. duPont Hospital for Children in Wilmington, Delaware – named among the nation's best in pediatric specialty care by U.S. News & World Report .

Nemours physicians practice a coordinated team approach by using a sophisticated, industry-leading electronic medical record (EMR).

As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours is committed to focusing on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.

job summary:
Nemours Children’s Hospital (NCH) in Orlando is seeking a Pediatric Critical Care Physician to join a team of nine intensivists. This is a full-time position to diagnose and treat children admitted to a General Pediatric Unit and a Pediatric Intensive Care Unit at one of our partner hospitals in the community, as well as the PICU at Nemours Children's Hospital (NCH). We are seeking an experienced Intensivist (5+ years experience post-training) who has an interest in mentoring junior faculty and house staff in the future.

Required qualifications include board certification/eligibility in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine, fellowship training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine, and eligibility for unrestricted Florida Medical License. Compensation and benefits will be competitive.

Interested candidates should forward formal CV to:
Al Torres, MD, MS, FAAP, FCCM

Chief, Critical Care and Transport

Medical Director, Clinical Logistics

Nemours Children's Hospital

atorres@nemours.org

Nemours is an internationally recognized, multi-site pediatric health care system that is built upon a centralized, efficient and collaborative infrastructure committed to improving the health of all children. The mission of Nemours is to improve the health and health care of children by seeking new approaches to the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of childhood diseases and to educate the next generation of leaders in children’s health.

The new Nemours Children’s Hospital is located in Lake Nona Medical City in Orlando, Florida, and opened for patient care on October 22, 2012. This 630,000-square-foot, 100-bed facility combines state-of-the-art inpatient and outpatient facilities for the evaluation and management of infants and children with complex medical conditions, including children with cancer. It serves as a regional referral facility with academic ties to the University of Central Florida College of Medicine, University of Florida, and the Sanford-Burnham Medical Research Institute.

Currently, more than 300 active research projects and clinical trials are in progress under the direction of 100 Nemours physician-scientists, 22 Ph.D. center directors and laboratory heads, and 165 support staff.

As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.

Job title: Pediatric Orthopaedic Surgeon, Board Cert / Elig, FL Lic (Physician, Orthopedic)
education level/skills required / respon: Facebook (Fan Page) | YouTube | Twitter | Flickr Career, Employment, Jobs, Opening, Occupation, Compensation, Salary, Hospital, Health Care, Healthcare, Medical...
job summary:
Nemours is seeking a Pediatric Orthopaedic Surgeon (board-certified/board-eligible) to join our team in Orlando, Florida.


Nemours Children’s Hospital is the newest addition to the Nemours integrated health care system. Our 100-bed pediatric hospital also features the area’s only 24-hour Emergency Department designed just for kids ands outpatient pediatric clinics, including several specialties previously unavailable in the region. A hospital designed by families for families, Nemours Children’s Hospital blends the healing power of nature with the latest in health care innovation to deliver world-class care to the children of Central Florida and beyond. In keeping with our goal of bringing Nemours care into the communities we serve, we also provide specialty outpatient care in several clinics located throughout the region.


Candidates seeking a unique opportunity to help build on an already strong orthopedic practice in Central Florida are encouraged to apply. There is strong interest in advanced minimally invasive surgery with accessibility to the existing 6 OR suites. This position offers a unique mix of academic and private practice rarely found elsewhere.


Academic appointments are available to a number of academic institutions, including Florida State, University of Central Florida, University of South Florida, and Florida Polytech based on academic interest of the applicant. There are also outstanding research opportunities, both clinical and laboratory-based, through Nemours and its academic affiliates. Candidates interested in outcomes research would enjoy Nemours’ clinical volume and available collaborative enterprise institutional database.


In addition to the surgeons, the team includes a full nursing staff who provides inpatient coverage and management of post-op and follow-up clinics, 5 physician assistants who provide front-line coverage of phone calls and consults, and 4 cast technicians, along with full clinical support staff. Inpatient care is delivered at Nemours’ state-of-the-art, 137-bed facility with a 10-bed surgical NICU, 9-bed CCCU and 9-bed PICU with 24-hour critical care coverage. Nemours is a pediatric multispecialty group with over 100 medical and surgical physicians and psychologists at the Orlando campus, where 24/7 in-house pediatric hospitalist coverage, 8 pediatric anesthesiologists and all pediatric surgical specialties are represented. The orthopedic surgery team works together to provide the highest level of quality patient care.


Requirements

Current board certification/eligibility by the American Board of Orthopedic Surgery with a subspecialty certification in pediatric orthopedic surgery.
Possess a valid Florida medical license.
Qualified to hold a faculty appointment in the Department of Orthopedics and an appointment to the medical staff of Nemours Children’s Hospital, Orlando.

As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours is committed to providing all children with their best chance to grow up healthy. We offer integrated, family-centered care to more than 280,000 children each year in our pediatric hospitals, specialty clinics and primary care practices in Delaware, Florida, Maryland, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Nemours strives to ensure a healthier tomorrow for all children – even those who may never enter our doors – through our world-changing research, education and advocacy efforts. At Nemours, our Associates help us deliver on the promise we make to every family we have the privilege of serving: to treat their child as if they were our own.


Nemours offers a competitive salary and benefits package that includes, but is not limited to, productivity and quality-based financial incentives, relocation, health, life, dental, CME, 403B retirement plan with matching, 457 retirement savings plan, licensure and dues allowance, and premium-free, in-network health coverage for children of full-time employees.


Our dedication to professionals who are dedicated to children frequently earns Nemours a spot on the list of top workplaces in the communities we serve. Our Associates enjoy comprehensive benefits, including our unique “Bridge to a Healthy Future” pediatric health plan, an integrated wellness program, opportunities for professional growth, and much more. As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.


Don’t miss out on important health care news and updates from Nemours – connect with us on…

job summary:
Southwest Medical is a vital and expanding part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of companies. We’re a highly successful multispecialty medical practice group that’s the career home of more than 340 providers. We’re serving over 320,000 patients annually through 20+ health care centers that include six urgent care centers and two state of the art outpatient surgery centers. Headquartered in Las Vegas, we have over 40 years of experience and provide a wide spectrum of care including specialties including Cardio, Gastro, PM, Podiatry, Wound Care, Neurology, Rheumatology, Endocrinology, and Anesthesiology as well as innovative programs such as Women’s health Breast Care Program, Congestive Heart Programs and Total HomeCare. Get to know us and you’ll discover why this could be an opportunity to do your life’s best work.(sm)


Southwest Medical, part of OptumCare, is seeking a per diem Hospice and Palliative Care Physician to join our team located in Las Vegas, NV.


Southwest Medical Associates (SMA) has an integrated care system and this position participates with Medical Management to develop, collaborate and assesses patient for palliative post-acute care for opportunities. This may include consultation in facilities and long term care to better upstream palliative concepts earlier in care delivery.


The Per Diem Hospice and Palliative Care physician will be responsible for determining patient eligibility for hospice services, evaluating the patient's medical status, assuming responsibility for the general medical needs of the attending physician and according to patient/family choice, working with the interdisciplinary team in establishing, implementing and reviewing the hospice program plan of care for each patient and preparing and recommending medical standards, policies and protocols.


Primary Responsibilities:

Works with Medical Director to assure the overall continuity of Hospice and Palliative medical care services


Responsible for the overall medical component of the care and treatment of terminally ill patients and their families


Provides palliation and management of terminal illness conditions related to the terminal illness


Provides medical care interventions targeting unmet general medical needs


Demonstrates knowledge in communications and counseling patient and family in dealing


Participates in resolution of interpersonal conflict and issues of clinical and ethical concerns


Documents care provided in the medical record providing evidence of progression of the end- stage disease process


Required to travel to homes of patients, facilities and meetings at various locations


Provides Pre-election Evaluation and Counseling services


Reviews patient’s clinical information before certifying and recertifying terminal illness and provides written certification at appropriate levels of care as per standards


Completes and/or ensures Hospice Face-to-Face visits are completed prior to recertifying hospice patients as per standards


Obtains privileges at one or more hospitals / nursing facilities which provide inpatient services to hospice program patients


Participates in the on-call physician rotation support – 24 hours a day, seven days a week


Participates in reviewing and developing protocols for treatment, patient care policies and proposing the most current options for interventions


Maintains current knowledge of the latest research and trends in Hospice care and pain and symptom management


Develops and achieves professional competencies, goals and objectives and reviews with supervisor 

Required Qualifications:

M.D. or D.O. degree


Completion of accredited ACGME or AOA Residency in Internal Medicine or Family Medicine


Board Certified or Board Eligible in Internal Medicine or Family Medicine and/or demonstrated experience in hospice and palliative care


Active and unrestricted medical license in the State of Nevada or ability to obtain prior to employment


DEA License or ability to obtain prior to employment


Preferred Qualifications:

Completion of or in the process of completing Hospice and Palliative Medicine Fellowship


Board Certified or Board Eligible in Hospice and Palliative Medicine


1+ years of practice experience in the principles of palliative medicine and symptom management


Training and experience in the psychological and medical needs of the terminally ill


Knowledge of palliative care with particular emphasis on control of symptoms associated with terminal illness


Ability to work collaboratively with hospice employees and volunteers as part of an interdisciplinary group


Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Proficient in business computer skills


We offer patient care that is compassionate, appropriate and effective for the treatment of health problems and the promotion of health. Our employees work with professionalism, as manifested through a commitment to carrying out professional responsibilities, adherence to ethical principles, and sensitivity to a diverse patient population.


We run a systems-based practice, as manifested by actions that demonstrate an awareness of and responsiveness to the larger context and system of health care and the ability to effectively call on system resources to provide care that is of optimal value.


We offer an attractive base salary, sign on bonus, quarterly bonus plan, and comprehensive fringe benefits package, including medical, dental, and life insurance, STD/LTD, professional liability, matching 401K, relocation costs, three weeks paid vacation, one week paid CME with $3500 allowance, and eight paid holidays. Differential for supervision of extenders.


Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Southwest Medical, part of OptumCare, is seeking a Breast Care Nurse Practitioner.

In this position with our breast care team, you will build meaningful relationships with patients, their family members, healthcare providers, and office staff while providing high quality direct patient care in a clinic setting. You will enjoy profound job satisfaction as you impact the care and comfort of our patient population. You will perform the clinical breast exam (CBE) and offer educational information about breast health and breast disease. You will collaborate with a physician to achieve the best health outcomes for the patient. You will enjoy opportunities for career growth and continuing education opportunities.

Primary Responsibilities:
Perform the Clinical Breast Exam (CBE)

Offer educational information about breast health and breast disease

Provide same day imaging results to patients and help to prepare them for their next step if needed (i.e. biopsy, MRI, ductogram)

Work with the Breast Care team to assist the patient with surgical consultation and emotional support when needed

Help to ensure that all patients receive the care that is needed in a timely manner

Document treatment plans in the medical record

Collaborate with physician and documents physician guidance as needed

Coordinate care for patients

Exposure to patients with potential infectious disease Required Qualifications:

National Nurse Practitioner certification in Adult, Family, Women's Health or ability to obtain, or Physician Assistant certification

APRN or PA-C licensure in Nevada, or ability to obtain

DEA or ability to obtain prior to employment

1+ year of experience as a Nurse Practitioner in a Women's Health clinic setting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to formulate a differential diagnosis

Intermediate level of technical proficiency in the use of computer programs for medical records or Internet search for clinical practice

Ability to complete clinical care lifting in a provider office environment

Proficient in assessment and development of treatment plans

Ability to conceptualize the needs for the team or department and actualize plans for implementation

Ability to develop plans of action and gain team consensus towards common goals

A background in managed care

Familiarity with ICD-9 coding

education level/skills required / respon: PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral...
job summary:
RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral to postoperative care. PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. Candidates for PACU jobs require critical care skills to assess incision sites, monitor body temperature, and track other indicators of stability or complications. It is important for RNs in the recovery room to quickly make critical patient assessments as the on-call doctor may be unavailable during an emergency. Ideal candidates for post-anesthesia care units have natural abilities to think critically and histories of fast, accurate diagnoses. Past experience in critical care and surgical nursing is a plus. 

Job Skills / Requirements:

Valid BLS from the American Heart Association
A valid professional license within the state of practice
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) credentials from the American Heart Association are recommended and may be required for specific registered nurses and travel nurse positions
Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific positions
Proof of right to work in the United States
Experience as a PACU nurse in a hospital setting

job summary:
Valley Anesthesiology and Pain Consultants is one of the nation's premier providers of anesthesia and pain management services; a group of more than 200 anesthesiologists and pain management, and CRNA specialists nationally recognized for its commitment to the highest standards of patient care, serving patients and their physicians throughout Phoenix, Scottsdale, Glendale and other communities in Arizona, since 1983.


Valley delivers services to surgeons and their patients with clinically excellent and compassionate care in hospitals and ambulatory surgery centers throughout the greater Phoenix area including:

Banner Health System
Barrow Neurological Institute
Phoenix Children's Hospital
Scottsdale Healthcare System
St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center

Valley also administers specialized services in the following areas: cardiovascular and thoracic anesthesia , obstetric anesthesia , neurosurgical anesthesia , pediatric anesthesia and transplant anesthesia . Since 2009, Valley has been providing office-based anesthesia services to medical and dental offices throughout greater Phoenix. Valley is the only office-based anesthesia provider in Arizona accredited by the Accreditation Association for Ambulatory Health Care (AAAHC) .


Phoenix ranks as one of the fastest-growing cities in the nation. Because of our beautiful weather, you’ll be able to enjoy most activities all year-round.


Phoenix is the capital of the southwestern U.S. state of Arizona. Known for its year-round sun and warm temperatures, it anchors a sprawling, multicity metropolitan area known as the Valley of the Sun. It's known for high-end spa resorts, Jack Nicklaus–designed golf courses and vibrant nightclubs. Other highlights include the Desert Botanical Garden, displaying cacti and numerous native plants.

Is familiar with the scope of practice of the transport team members and the State regulations in which the transport team practices. Works with the other transport team members to coordinate care of the patient during transport; once called, readily available/arrive at specified location, within 45 minutes before wheels.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.Preflight responsibilities: Obtains medical report from Medical Director or designee, to include addressing diseases affected by altitude.Calls for update with discharging facility / Physician when appropriate.Participates in Pre-Flight debriefing with other members of the medical team, pilots and flight coordinator.Familiar with the location and use of all medical equipment and supplies.Participates in pre-flight checking of medical equipment and supplies when necessary and requests additional supplies as needed specific to patient’s condition and needs, based on available patient report and distance of transport.Participates in loading and securing equipment in the aircraft.Understands and follows Reva, Inc.’s Guidelines, Policies and Procedures.Transport responsibilities: Performs and documents a complete head to toe assessment of the patient.Assist the medical crew in obtaining appropriate documentation from the patient and passengers, i.e., passports, visas, and/or documentation of medical events and interventions.Safe guards all medical records, x-rays and other medical documentation as per HIPPA regulations.Assist the medical crew in obtaining signatures on consent forms.Assist the medical crew in safe transport from facility to aircraft.Assures delivery of minimum standard of care (see: Minimum Standard Patient Care Requirements) bedside to bedside.Maintains constant communication with medical team and pilots. materials recognition and response review.Does not participate in risk-taking behavior while on transports.QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Emergency Medicine, Internal Medicine, education level/skills required / respon: Post by Jobing - Since 1957, the Arizona Humane Society (AHS) has fostered the belief that every pet deserves a good life. Our goal of saving more pets' lives
job summary:
Post by Jobing - Since 1957, the Arizona Humane Society (AHS) has fostered the belief that every pet deserves a good life. Our goal of saving more pets' lives is possible with the hard work of our valued employees and partnerships in the community. We offer a friendly, professional work environment with a culture that promotes innovation, compassion and excellence.POSITION SUMMARY: Assists the veterinarians in the treatment of animals and independently evaluates animals to determine adoptability. Assists the veterinarians in all aspects of AHS clinics including surgery, radiology, dentistry, laboratory diagnostics, client education, clinic asepsis, fluid therapy and the administration of prescribed medications.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Assist in the admission of patients.

Administer treatment to the injured animals currently in the hospital. Collect, prepare and submit all lab samples to outgoing vendors. Perform physical exam on all animals; verify adoptability determination or appropriate avenue for disposition. Assist in training Clinic Trainees.

Keep all clinic areas clean and orderly; restock supplies as needed. Shoot, develop, log and file radiographs adhering to all required radiation safety procedures. Assist in all areas of surgery. Perform Felv, Felv/Fiv and Heartworm tests, implant microchips and administer any necessary vaccines.

Complete and maintain all records. Clean and prepare all instruments for packing and autoclaving. Clean and disinfect kennels after patients are released. Fill veterinarian prescriptions and provide clients with instructions for administration.

Follow departmental procedures for euthanasia including administration of drugs and loading deceased animals in the dump truck. All diagnostic results, complications or instructions will be conveyed to the owner by the veterinarian on duty or relayed verbatim per their instructions.Other duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS: High school diploma and preferably the completion of a Veterinary Technician OR minimum of five years' of experience at a veterinary hospital. Education may substitute for experience. Must have specialized training under the direct supervision of a veterinarian or from a veterinary technician school.

Must know phlebotomy, immunology, parasitology, endocrinology, pharmacology and perform safe and humane animal handling.Must be proficient in anesthesiology.Language Skills: Able to speak, read and write English; Spanish language helpful.Mathematical Skills: Ability to perform basic mathematical skills.Computer Skills: Proficiency with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook and Explorer; able to learn other software programs as necessary. Proficiency with or able to learn/use Chameleon software (for use with animals in a shelter environment).Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: Valid AZ Driver's License and insurance.Other Skills, Abilities and Qualifications: Regular attendance. Access to reliable transportation. The person in this position interacts daily with the public, clinic staff and other shelter personnel.Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls, reach with hands and arms, climb stairs, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, talk or hear, taste or smell.

The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Work Environment: There will be exposure to dust, heat, cold and temperature changes; occasional wet floors, and animal noises, odors and dander. Most time will be spent in a typical air conditioned and heated office environment.

education level/skills required / respon: PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral...
job summary:
RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral to postoperative care. PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. Candidates for PACU jobs require critical care skills to assess incision sites, monitor body temperature, and track other indicators of stability or complications. It is important for RNs in the recovery room to quickly make critical patient assessments as the on-call doctor may be unavailable during an emergency. Ideal candidates for post-anesthesia care units have natural abilities to think critically and histories of fast, accurate diagnoses. Past experience in critical care and surgical nursing is a plus. 

Job Skills / Requirements:

Valid BLS from the American Heart Association
A valid professional license within the state of practice
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) credentials from the American Heart Association are recommended and may be required for specific registered nurses and travel nurse positions
Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific positions
Proof of right to work in the United States
Experience as a PACU nurse in a hospital setting

Job title: Director of Nursing (Antelope Valley Surgery Center, CA)
education level/skills required / respon: With 4 operating rooms, we provide anesthesiology, urology, ophthalmology, general surgery, gynecology, orthopedic surgery, pain management, and podiatry...
job summary:
SCA owns and/or provides management services to 194 ambulatory surgery centers, surgical hospitals, and hospital surgery departments, in partnership with approximately 2,800 physicians and in affiliation with 105 health systems. SCA's clinical systems, service line growth strategies, benchmarking processes, and efficiency programs create measurable advantage for surgical facilities – clinically, operationally, and financially. For more information on SCA, visit www.scasurgery.com.


Surgical Care Affiliates (SCA) isn’t just a place to build a career. It’s an opportunity to work alongside people who share your values and provide outstanding care. The SCA family works together to make a difference in people’s lives and in the quality of healthcare in America. It is a place where your contributions are appreciated and rewarded.


SCA is seeking a Director of Nursing to join the team in the Antelope Valley, CA area. SCA operates more than 190 surgical facilities – including ambulatory surgery centers, surgical hospitals, and hospital surgery departments – in partnership with approximately 7,500 physicians and in affiliation with more than 45 not-for-profit health systems across the country. SCA's clinical systems, service line growth strategies, benchmarking processes and efficiency programs create measurable advantage for surgical facilities – clinically, operationally and financially.


Facility Description


The Antelope Valley Surgery Center is a multi-specialty ambulatory surgery center located in Lancaster, California. Our center has provided care for patients since 1992. Our physicians operate in a surgical environment that provides an efficient extension of their offices for cost effective alternatives. With 4 operating rooms, we provide anesthesiology, urology, ophthalmology, general surgery, gynecology, orthopedic surgery, pain management, and podiatry services.


Accountabilities / Responsibilities:
The Director of Nursing (DON) is responsible for all aspects of nursing care delivery in the facility. They will assume responsibility as Department Manager of OR/Preop/PACU. The DON is also responsible for the Quality Improvement/Risk Management Program for the center and Education Coordinator for the facility as well. The DON will assume some responsibility of the Administrator in his/her absence. As a Registered Nurse, the DON is also responsible for assessing, planning, implementing and coordinating patient care from admission to discharge.


Skills and Abilities 
Correlates clinical data with patient’s medical and nursing care Provides direction to others that is clear, concise and promotes efficiency throughout the clinical areas of the facility. Communicates well with patients, families, teammates, physicians, other healthcare workers, etc. Recognize legal and policy limits of individual practice.
Clinical Quality 
Assesses, plans, evaluates and ensures the implementation of the patients care to achieve identified outcomes and delivers safe patient care according to facility policy and procedure Assumes a leadership role in the provision of quality nursing care for patients receiving care Demonstrates continued competence in assessing, treating, and caring for individuals based on age-specific needs utilizing developmental perspective Demonstrates appropriate and continued knowledge and competence of designated skills identified for position Demonstrates appropriate knowledge and competence of designated skills identified for position in patient care duties

Teamwork/Accountability/Integrity 
Utilizes time effectively. Follows established facility policies and procedures with regard to attendance Completes all documentation to ensure the availability of accurate and up to date information in accordance with established standards Adheres to established facility safety requirements and procedures to ensure a safe working environment Assists with housekeeping tasks as necessary to provide a safe environment for patient’s, teammates, physicians, guests Performs all other duties as assigned by management

Continuous Improvement 
Maintains and evaluates own clinical expertise and clinical practice Responsibly demonstrates the importance of continuing education to the performance of facility responsibilities and growth in profession Performs all other duties as assigned by management

Compliance 
Upholds and practices the principles and policies of the SCA Compliance program Demonstrates the safe operation of equipment and machinery and follows procedures for reporting and correcting an unsafe situation

Service Excellence 
Communicates patient information to assure confidentiality and continuity of care Interacts with all patients, families, visitors and fellow employees in a mature, responsible manner to ensure a positive and professional facility environment Fosters a positive and professional facility environment by interacting with all persons in a considerate, helpful and courteous manner and by participating as a team member Maintains dress and appearance according to standards as observed by management Strives to be professional, courteous, helpful and cooperative Demonstrates understanding and puts into practice the SCA value of Service Excellence

Financial Skill 
Completes appropriate financial management responsibilities Participates in periodic inventory count as assigned by leadership

Physical Requirements 
Good visual acuity, accurate color vision Ability to lift/transfer patients in excess of 100 pounds, which may require pushing, pulling and essentially utilizing a full range of body movement Ability to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch and/or crawl Ability to reach, grasp, use fine finger movement and feel fine sensation to discern temperature, texture, size and shape
Machine/Equipment Used

Clinical equipment used for patient care, i.e., suction machine, patient diagnostic equipment, patient monitoring equipment, office equipment: computer, Xerox machine

Qualifications:

Graduate of an accredited school of nursing with a BSN 2 years of nursing and management experience in a hospital or ambulatory surgery center At least one (1) year OR circulating experience required Current CA state licensure to practice Successful completion of Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS), Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS), and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) or obtain within 90 days of employment

education level/skills required / respon: PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral...
job summary:
RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral to postoperative care. PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. Candidates for PACU jobs require critical care skills to assess incision sites, monitor body temperature, and track other indicators of stability or complications. It is important for RNs in the recovery room to quickly make critical patient assessments as the on-call doctor may be unavailable during an emergency. Ideal candidates for post-anesthesia care units have natural abilities to think critically and histories of fast, accurate diagnoses. Past experience in critical care and surgical nursing is a plus. 

Job Skills / Requirements:

Valid BLS from the American Heart Association
A valid professional license within the state of practice
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) credentials from the American Heart Association are recommended and may be required for specific registered nurses and travel nurse positions
Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific positions
Proof of right to work in the United States
Experience as a PACU nurse in a hospital setting

education level/skills required / respon: Works collaboratively with physicians, various departments such as Anesthesiology, Nursing directors, and Ancillary directors and staff to improve the clinical...
job summary:
Must use clinical specialization to provide primary and/or acute care to patients and their families. Works collaboratively with physicians, various departments such as Anesthesiology, Nursing directors, and Ancillary directors and staff to improve the clinical outcomes and processes of care for all patients. Brings clinical expertise, leadership, consultation, teaching, and research to patients and physicians. Utilizes in-depth knowledge of that specialization to drive improvement through various roles and alliances.


Licensed Nurse Practitioner with at least 5 years experience in a clinical area and BLS or ACLS certification is required. Sound technical, critical thinking, and teamwork skills required. Must be skilled in physical and mental health assessment, diagnosis, treatment, pharmacology and advanced clinical nursing practice. Possess the ability to work effectively with all members of a care team. Previous experience working in a clinic setting preferred. Will need experience working with the indigent and mental health patients.

education level/skills required / respon: American Anesthesiology is a division of MEDNAX, an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are seeking CRNAs to join our growing anesthesia practice in Burlington,...
job summary:
We are seeking CRNAs to join our growing anesthesia practice in Burlington, North Carolina. Our practice provides anesthesia services at Alamance Regional Medical Center and welcomes new graduates, as well as experienced candidates. The potential for weekly shifts is available, as well as an opportunity for voluntary call coverage on weekend shifts for additional compensation. Working in together in a care team model, our CRNAs and anesthesiologists care for patients in a dynamic clinical environment. Procedures include OB/GYN, orthopedics, general surgery (including robotics), ophthalmology, vascular, urology (including robotics), pediatrics, ENT, and endoscopy (no heads, no hearts, and no trauma).


This practice is offering a sign on bonus and relocation assistance.


Burlington, NC is located only a few hours’ drive from the picturesque Blue Ridge and Great Smoky Mountains to the west and the scenic coastal beaches to the east. Also, because it is also only a one hour commute to Raleigh, residents can enjoy both a slow paced environment and a fantastic city life. Additionally, because of its location on the Sunbelt, Burlington has a mild year-round climate with four seasonal changes. The city offers rich history, exciting cultural attractions, outdoor recreational activities, great dining and countless sporting events. Alamance County is home to one of the best school systems in the state and is in the heart of college athletics and campuses.


We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits including:


• Health (choice of two PPO options), life, vision, dental and disability insurance

• 401(k)

• Annual CME allowance

• Employee stock purchase plan

• Stability in an organization with more than 35 years of healthcare industry experience

• Opportunities to participate alongside physicians in quality improvement initiatives

• Professional liability insurance and assistance with mandatory hospital credentialing and state licensing, and reimbursement of associated fees.


To apply for this opportunity, please click on the APPLY button below or contact Kathleen Schlemmer at (954)839-2149


American Anesthesiology is a division of MEDNAX, an Equal Opportunity Employer

job summary:
job in North Carolina : One or two additional pediatricians are needed in our growing community to help keep up with demand. This position can be set up in a number of ways: hospital employed in a solo or multiple-practitioner setting, or a solo start-up with income guarantee. The physician will have full specialist support in neurosurgery, obstetrics and gynecology, ophthalmology, otolaryngology, orthopedics, podiatry, general surgery, and urology, nephrology, oncology, cardiology, and pulmonology. Hospital-based specialties include anesthesiology, emergency medicine, hospitalists, pathology, and radiology.Additional details: Depending upon the desired practice model, the compensation package can include solo start-up assistance with an income guarantee, or a competitive salary based on experience and training utilizing MGMA data as well as RVU incentive, health insurance, life insurance, malpractice, 403B retirement plan, voluntary 457B plan, relocation expenses, paid vacation, and CME allowance.Candidates must be board certified or board eligible if they have just completed training.Call is expected to be between 1:5 and 1:7.The case load would be 40% well child care visits, 55% acute care visits, and 5% hospital care, including attending C-sections.Community informationThe community is situated in the northern piedmont of North Carolina and enjoys a moderate climate with four definite seasons.

It is only 30 miles from Greensboro and 45 miles from Winston-Salem. The Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia are less than one hour and the coast is three hours away.Several large area lakes as well as rivers offer boating, fishing, water sports, kayaking and canoeing.Cost of living is 9% below the national average.Excellent public and private schools are available.

job summary:
Seeking board certified OB/GYN's to consider joining our team at Saint Agnes Medical Center.

Overview:
management of obstetrical patients including pregnant trauma patients, GYN surgical assists, and inpatient/ER consultations.
Management of unassigned patients and any assigned community clinic patients
Full time typically equates to 7-8 twenty-four hour shifts per 28 day block
Level III NICU
MFM/Perinatologist availability
In-house Anesthesiology dedicated to OB
Average OBED patients for hospitalist: 350-400
Estimated monthly deliveries for hospitalist group: 36

About Ob Hospitalist Group
Ob Hospitalist Group (OBHG) began in 2006 with a vision to elevate the standard of women’s healthcare by delivering specialized services that improve quality and positively impact women’s healthcare by ensuring every expectant mother has the security of consistently and unconditionally seeing a physician when presenting to the Labor and Delivery department or Emergency Room.

OBHG leads the industry in developing and managing in-house OB/GYN hospitalist programs staffed with highly-skilled, Board Certified physicians 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Our team of dedicated professionals serves sacrificially to save lives, improve patient outcomes, relieve and support medical staff, and to promote evidence based best practices and clinical excellence. In partnership with hospitals, nursing staff, physicians and hospitalists we have developed a unique, comprehensive, financially viable OB/GYN hospitalist program that positively impacts the lives of women, their newborns, and the families we serve.

job summary:
The Reimbursement Analyst III will perform functions the Department involving gross charges of $30+ million. The Reimbursement Analyst III is responsible for coordination and oversight of the billing activities of the Department; coordinating and performing detailed analyses of charges and collections and effecting appropriate change mechanisms in response to the analyses; and providing expertise regarding Federal, State, and Commercial guidelines which continually adjust to a changing health care environment.--Certified in one of the nationally recognized hospital/professional coding bodies: CPC Certification through the American Academy of Professional Coders (AAPC) or CCSP Certification through the American Health Information Management Association (AHIMA).
--Experience managing assigned day-to-day billing operations.

--Experience identifying, reporting, and correcting billing report errors and inconsistencies.
--Experience preparing and interpreting financial reports and statistical data.
--Experience with clinic operations, billing and A/R, planning, Managed Care contracting, and administrative workflow and management.
--Advanced understanding of hospital and outpatient clinic operations.
--Advanced knowledge of common PC-based spreadsheets (Excel) and word processing programs (Word).
--Understanding of relative values vs. anesthesia values and calculating Anesthesia charges and payments.
--Thorough understanding of all medical billing reimbursement related protocols.
--Knowledge of professional and facility fee billing as well as reimbursement for third party payors.
--Advanced knowledge of current Federal, State, and local regulation and policies regarding medical billing, reimbursement and compliance guidelines (especially as they relates to Anesthesiology).

audits and analysis of billing efficiency and effectiveness
--Demonstrated knowledge of Professional Fee Billing, Hospital Billing, working in both Academic and Private Organizations, Third Party Payors, and Special Reimbursement Programs.

education level/skills required / respon: ' American Board of Anesthesiology Certified. ' American Board of Anesthesiology Certified or Board Eligible. This position requires a thorough comprehension of...
job summary:
The Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine is dedicated to providing excellence in quality patient care and services to improve the health of the University of California Davis Health System (UCDHS) patients, basic and clinical research, education, and community service; and is one of the largest departments in the School of Medicine with an annual budget of $40 million. The Department is currently organized across five locations: UCD Pavilion, Lawrence J. Ellison Ambulatory Care Center (ACC), UC Comprehensive Cancer Center, Otolaryngology (ENT) Glassrock facility, and at the UC Davis Spine Center; providing service to 40 plus operating suites each day and over 28,000 anesthetics annually. The Department is comprised of 200 plus staff, which include faculty (56), residents and fellows (51), nurse anesthetists (28), and administrative support staff.

The Associate Physician (Board Eligible) / Associate Physician Diplomate (Board Certified) reports directly to the clinical Vice Chair and Chair of the Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine and exercises a peer relationship with other faculty, residents, fellows, medical students, nursing personnel, and ancillary personnel in the role of patient care.

It is the expectation that physicians will work in a collegial manner combining clinical duties with instruction of residents, medical students, and certified registered nurse anesthetists. This position requires a thorough comprehension of the complex interactions between physiology, pathology, co-morbid medical conditions, pharmacology and procedural disruptions of homeostasis as such comprehension underlies the safe and effective practice of the discipline of anesthesiology. MSP providers must possess an understanding of quality of care standards as set forth by the American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) and UCDHS to administer anesthesia to a wide range of patients undergoing surgical, obstetric, diagnostic, therapeutic and interventional procedures across UCDHS locations.REQUIREMENTS
' Experience performing functions of an anesthesiologist.
' Experience documenting anesthetics and procedures in the Electronic Medical Record (EMR) is preferred. All applicants must successfully complete the UCDHS EMR training.
' Skills to teach residents, medical students, student nurse anesthetists and others while in the operating rooms or other locations.
' Physically and mentally able to perform duties of an anesthesiologist within the limits set by the operating rooms and other locations anesthesia is given.
' Communicate to give feedback on residents' performance when required.
' Provide feedback for CQI purposes.
' Must have a DEA license or ability to obtain license.

ASSOCIATE PHYSICIAN (BOARD ELIGIBLE)
' Valid California Medical License
' American Board of Anesthesiology Certified or Board Eligible.
' 50 hours of CME in last two years.

ASSOCIATE PHYSICIAN DIPLOMATE (BOARD CERTIFIED)
' Valid California Medical License
' American Board of Anesthesiology Certified.
' 50 hours of CME in last two years.

job summary:
Supports simulation related training and performance assessment events in multiple locations (e.g., STAR Center, classrooms, in-situ). Programs scenarios and operates high-to-low fidelity simulators, task trainers, and anatomical models to clinical specifications. Provides training, supports outreach activities and performs simulation related administrative operations (e.g., maintain simulator inventory and event schedules).


Responsible for day-to-day operations associated with preparation, operation and maintenance of the simulators, task trainers and anatomical models (hereafter referred to as simulators) used for competency based training and low-high stakes performance assessment events. Work with clinical content experts (e.g., physicians, nurses, EMTs) to design training scenarios to meet specifications. Program simulators to meet these requirements. Apply clinical and technical knowledge to effectively operate high-fidelity simulators during training events. Set up/take down the sim rooms, simulators and equipment needed for training events (e.g., anesthesia machine, ventilator, defibrillator) to maximize fidelity/realism. Create a maintenance schedule and perform regular upkeep of equipment. Work with Simulator Technician to troubleshoot equipment. Create/obtain peripherals to support scenarios (e.g., mock EHR, x-ray/MRI images, lab results).


Simulation Administration : Update and maintain internal simulation event calendar. Track usage for billing purposes. Organize and maintain simulation supply inventory. Work with STAR Center Senior Administrative Assistant to order needed equipment and supplies. Be point of contact with equipment manufacturer technicians to troubleshoot equipment/systems problems. Maintain simulator related records (e.g., repairs, purchases). Identify/evaluate/recommend equipment replacement and/or new additional equipment as needed to Program Manager.


Training & Outreach : Train event faculty (e.g., physicians, nurses, EMTs) in operational aspects of simulation to achieve competency-based outcomes. Orient trainees to simulator features and use to prepare them for training scenarios. Serve as educational resource for faculty and students planning simulation-based medical education courses and classes. Provide tours and information about the STAR Center to various constituencies (e.g. MCW and other health profession educators, medical student applicants; public affairs/development).


STAR Center Support : Support STAR Center events including those using hybrid or human simulation (e.g. Standardized Patients). Support/collaborate with event directors on QI efforts and educational scholarship (e.g., studies, abstracts).


Preferred Schedule:

40-45 hours weekly-Time dependent on events schedule


Position Requirements:

Education: Associate Degree in medical/health profession, Information Technology, and/or education related fields.


Experience: 3 years of experience in medical and/or Information Technology. Strongly preferred: certification or experience in healthcare (Nursing, EMT, Paramedic, RT, Anesthesiology Tech or other allied health field) and/or Information Technology degree. If degree is in Informational Technology, additional background knowledge of and experience in clinical operations is preferred.


Certifications/Licenses: ACLS and/or PALS Certified preferred. CHSOS or CHSE Certification preferred .

Job Dimensions


Collegiality


Exhibit confidentiality, honesty, and actions that build trust and strengthen relationships. Listen to others and effectively communicate in a clear and concise manner through written and verbal communication. Demonstrate respect and commitment to the values of diversity and equity; seek out and incorporate diverse perspectives into decision making.


Excellence & Creativity


Exhibit initiative and ingenuity by taking ownership of tasks to proactively improve services, avoid problems, or develop opportunities. Generate novel and valuable ideas to impact missions. Identify and implement new methods to increase efficiency and quality.


Education & Development


Participate in design, development and/or evaluation of instructional materials, methods, courses or programs. Seek out mentorship and learning opportunities. Develop and maintain professional affiliations.

Resourceful in deviating from the routine; adapt behaviors, priorities and work methods to meet needs of others. Support transformational change to achieve institutional vision and strategies.


Dependability & Judgment


Demonstrate logical, rational, and objective decision making. Use analysis, experience and logic to solve problems and offer solutions and suggestions that are effective in addressing problems. Show reliability and accountability in the successful completion of all work.


Stewardship & Institutional Citizenship


Be an active and thoughtful participant in institutional initiatives, meetings and committee work. Conserve resources and use in an efficient and cost effective manner across all MCW missions. Look for ways to improve and promote quality within area of influence.


Primary Functions


1.


Work with the Department Administrator to create an internal and external communication plan. Provide input on program design for all advertising needs of the Department as well as implement, and maintain communication links with the Department membership, and Department staff at both MCW and partnering institutions.


2.


Coordinate the development of program materials including Website(s), Newsletters, press releases, marketing materials, annual report, calendars, forms, reports, and other materials. Develop and submit press releases for the Department and build a relationship with area media.


3.


Maintain communication plan timeline including tracking deadlines for plan components. Organize internal and external meetings, site visits, and special events


4.


Coordinate and manage program outreach activities including acting as a liason with community organizations, and other creative and marketing departments at partner institutions


5.


Develop and manage communication program budget


6.


Schedule people and material resources related to special events and/or ad hoc projects.


7.


Collect, analyze, and disseminate Department communications data. Report communications data and progress to Department stakeholders, including the Department Administrator and other Sr. Leaders.


8.


Participate in the development of Department resources through contact with Development staff, outside programs, and review and solicitation of funding opportunities.


9.


Participate on appropriate committees relevant to the advancement of the Department communications and the profession.


10.


Assure compliance with regulatory and institutional policies.
