job summary:
Supervise and independently perform studies to advance the goals of the principal investigator’s research projects. Perform experiments, analyze data, compile results, and monitor quality control processes to ensure integrity of research.


Organizational Structure


Location:


Medical College of Wisconsin


Department:


Anesthesiology


Division:


Research


Reports to (title):


Quinn Hogan MD, Professor


Direct Reports (title):


Quinn Hogan MD, Professor


Collaborates with (title):


Bin Pan PhD, Assistant Professor


Job Dimensions


Collegiality


Exhibit confidentiality, honesty, and actions that build trust and strengthen relationships. Listen to others and effectively communicate in a clear and concise manner through written and verbal communication. Demonstrate respect and commitment to the values of diversity and equity.


Excellence & Creativity


Exhibit initiative and ingenuity by taking ownership of tasks to proactively improve research productivity. Generate novel and valuable ideas to impact the project. Identify and implement new methods to increase.


Education & Development


Participate in design, development and/or evaluation of instructional materials, methods, courses or programs. Seek out mentorship and learning opportunities. Develop and maintain professional affiliations.


Agility


Resourceful in deviating from the routine; adapt behaviors, priorities and work methods to meet needs of others. Support transformational change to achieve institutional vision and strategies.


Dependability & Judgment


Demonstrate logical, rational, and objective decision making. Use analysis, experience and logic to solve problems and offer solutions and suggestions that are effective in addressing problems. Show reliability and accountability in the successful completion of all work.


Stewardship & Institutional Citizenship


Be an active and thoughtful participant in institutional initiatives, meetings and committee work. Conserve resources and use in an efficient and cost effective manner across all MCW missions. Look for ways to improve and promote quality within area of influence.


Primary Functions


1.


Design and execute complex research procedures in federally funded research projects exploring electrophysiology related to pain mechanisms and experimental pain therapies. Techniques the candidate would need to know or learn include rat microsurgery for generating pain models and harvesting tissues for physiological experiments, patch electrophysiological recording from dissociated neurons and brain slices, teased fiber recordings, and intact animal sharp electrode recording. Other approaches include optogenetic neuronal stimulation, microfluorimetric recording, and immunohistology.


2.


Collaborate with principle investigator in study design, statistical analyses, and presentation of results in abstracts, papers, and presentations.


3.


Assist in developing new methodologies for lab procedures.


4.


Coordinate research study activities; lead and manage projects.


5.


Participate in meetings with principle investigator and research staff for evaluating and interpreting the data.


6.


Implement animal care and safety regulatory duties.


7.


Maintain supplies, track purchase orders.


8.


May over see the work of laboratory personnel including training and development as well as daily work direction/delegation/prioritizing.


Preferred Schedule:

Full-time role with expectations for coverage during core work hours and flexibility required as necessary to accommodate research needs.

Occasional exposure to noise, temperature changes, or contact with water or other liquids. Work is performed in an controlled environment.

job summary:
Sales Representative – Advanced Surgical - Milwaukee, WI


Job Summary 

Shape your future
As a Sales Representative on our Advanced Surgical team, you will be able to offer your customers a full range of products and solutions in the general surgery market. Conmed is committed to providing differentiated products that help physicians achieve superior outcomes for their patients. Our product offering includes both capital and disposable products that will provide you an opportunity to use both your strategic and clinical selling skills, and to sell at every level as you establish yourself as the “go-to” person for your accounts’ needs. Through top-notch training and development, we will invest in you to help you be as successful as possible. If you delight in the challenge of competing and winning, then we invite you to come make a name for yourself with us. We are passionate about developing people and promoting from within. If you are ambitious and want to advance into management, you will have an excellent opportunity to build a long-term career with the organization. All of this adds up to a tremendous career growth opportunity!


Qualifications

Leave your footprint


• Bachelor’s degree required.

• 3-5 years of experience in outside medical sales

• Proven track record of meeting or exceeding quota and growth


Benefits

Be rewarded


CONMED offers competitive compensation

Excellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage

Short & long term disability plus life insurance – cost paid fully by CONMED

Retirement Savings Plan (401K) – company match dollar for dollar up to 7%

Employee stock purchase plan – allows stock purchases at discounted price

Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses


About CONMED

Get in

CONMED Corporation is a progressive, global medical device company. Through thoughtful leadership, innovation and team work, we are changing the future of medicine. Our 3,500 employees worldwide make meaningful contributions, positively impact the business, and advance in their careers as our company and product portfolio grows.


We are a leader in Orthopedics, General Surgery, Gynecology, Gastroenterology, Pulmonology, and Anesthesiology and our employees enjoy challenging and diverse job opportunities across these varied specializations. We are headquartered in upstate New York with additional domestic facilities in FL, CA, MA, NJ, CO, and GA. We have an international presence in more than 20 locations throughout Europe, Australia, Latin America, Asia, North America, and the Middle East.


CONMED is an Equal Opportunity Employer & an Affirmative Action Employer

Typically requires 2 years of experience in an Anesthesia Technician position.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Previous experience and/or certification in the operation of autologous blood recovery systems and intra-aortic balloon pumps.Ability to work on multiple tasks, set appropriate priorities, and accomplish assignments.Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.Basic computer proficiency.
Primary Purpose
Provides ongoing clinical and technical assistance under the direction of an Anesthesiologist during complex anesthetic procedures. Assists in the acquisition, preparation, application, evaluation and maintenance of equipment and supplies required for the administration of anesthesia. Supports the clinician in the establishment and management of invasive pressure monitoring.

Major Responsibilities
Starts, operates, and knows the parameters of all anesthesia-related monitors, machines and computers which include: electrocardiograph (ECG), invasive and non-invasive blood pressure, body temperature, oxygen saturation, cardiac output, intra-aortic balloon pump, pulse oximeter, transesophageal echocardiography imaging units, defibrillator, rapid infusers, anesthesia gas analyzers, fiberoptic scopes, autologous blood recovery system, activated clotting time machines, and pacemakers.
Alerts the Physician to abnormal conditions as they arise and prepares for any clinical support required. Sets up monitoring equipment in the operating room; calibrates pressures and recording systems within the patient monitoring system to ensure and maintain precise readings. Troubleshoots equipment malfunctions or failures and takes necessary steps to promptly return equipment to a safe and reliable operating condition, using backup equipment when necessary.
Assists in central venous and Swan-Ganz catheter insertion using sterile technique; assists in the insertion of arterial pressure lines during surgical procedures. Configures the monitors for optimum numerical data and waveform interpretation. Operates ultrasound blood vessel imaging device for line placement.
Assists Anesthesiologist with intubations. Identifies and assembles the various types of intubation blades and fiberoptic bronchoscopes as well as any other special equipment and supplies required for difficult intubation. Keeps Anesthesiologist constantly apprised of the patient's blood pressure and oxygen saturation status. Uses sterile technique, inserts indwelling radial and brachial arterial catheters upon direction of the Anesthesiologist.
Draws arterial and/or venous blood samples for diagnostic testing and point of care analyses. Accurately transcribes all lab results on patient records. Anticipates when blood samples will be required based on the type of surgery, its normal progression, and associated complications (both common and rare). Alerts Physician of unexpected or abnormal lab values that may require intervention.
Performs preoperative autologous blood collection using bags prefilled with anticoagulant for postoperative reinfusion. Pauses or terminates collection whenever adverse conditions or hemodynamic intolerance are note or suspected.
Operates the autotransfusion system for intraoperative blood recovery, processing, and reinfusion. Includes determining the proper mode of operation based on the type of procedure, complexity of the case, and the patient's religious beliefs concerning blood administration.
Checks ventilators for proper operating efficiency; operates monitor and recording systems. Operates transesophageal echocardiography imaging unit (TEE) and intra-aortic balloon pumps perioperatively. Efficiently and independently troubleshoots and corrects all machine malfunctions and alarm conditions.
Collects all data sheets and transports them with the patient, establishes ECG and pressure monitoring at the destination, and reports monitoring status to the receiving Nurse.

0530-1400

Our strength stems from teamwork and collaboration among a talented and diverse group of professionals.

education level/skills required / respon: The Medical College of Wisconsin (MCW) seeks a collaborative physician-leader to serve as Chief of the Division Obstetric Anesthesiology within the Department...
job summary:
The Medical College of Wisconsin (MCW) seeks a collaborative physician-leader to serve as Chief of the Division Obstetric Anesthesiology within the Department of Anesthesiology. The successful candidate will be have a proven track record as a strategic and accomplished leader/administrator, well versed in best practices, who is able to leverage the Division’s strengths to advance and support excellence in the delivery of clinical care, education, and research. The Chief of the Division of Obstetric Anesthesiology will continue to strengthen the clinical services at the two clinical care sites -- Froedtert Birth Center and St. Joseph's Regional Medical Center. Together, these hospitals, both regional high risk centers, provide obstetric services for nearly 5,000 deliveries per year.


The successful candidate will join the Department of Anesthesiology, one of the largest in the country, dedicated to providing cutting-edge, compassionate care of the highest quality and safety to patients in Southeast Wisconsin. The Anesthesiology Department’s large biomedical research division has diverse ongoing studies ranging from the level of the single ion channel up to human clinical research. The state-of-the-art teaching techniques, such as simulation, provide a destination of choice for future fellows and residents.


This position requires a recognized clinician and academician, with proven administrative skills to lead a patient-centered division in all facets of obstetric anesthesiology and to grow multi-disciplinary and interdisciplinary research. The successful candidate must be licensed to practice medicine in the State of Wisconsin and be board certified in Anesthesiology or have equivalent qualifications in compliance with the MCW credentialing processes. The Division Chief must work effectively in collaboration with others to integrate activities that are in line with the department and the greater institutional goals. Reporting to the Chair of the Department of Anesthesiology, the Division Chief also serves as a member of the Department Executive Committee.


All replies will be held in strict confidence. Correspondence and applications, which should include a curriculum vita and a letter of interest, should be submitted electronically.


Denise Gaffney is leading this search with Jamie Sands.


The Medical College of Wisconsin is an equal opportunity/ affirmative action employer and encourages applications from women and minority candidates.

job summary:
Job in Waukesha WI
An award-winning health system in central Wisconsin is now looking to add a Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist (CRNA) to their dedicated and accomplished Anesthesia.

The hospital is a Trauma Center, an Accredited Chest Pain Center and a designated Primary Stroke Center. This hospital system is consistently awarded and recognized by both local and national organizations, in particular for the their commitment to value and quality of patient care. They received the Best in Value Award from Press Ganey and the Consumer Choice Award by the National Research Corporation. Additionally, many local and national organizations have named this hospital a great place to work, with a supportive environment and family-friendly policies.

The CRNA would join a busy OR that sees Trauma, Orthopedics (including Total Joints), Coronary and Vascular interventions, Oncology, General Surgery and ENT/Plastics. They average over 10,000 surgeries per year and are growing. The CRNA would oversee and be responsible for anesthesia care during procedures and subsequent monitoring of patients during the procedure.

The Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist will report to both the Chief Nursing Officer and the Medical Director of Anesthesiology and join a team of four CRNA’s that cover the OR. In addition to duties in the OR, the CRNA will assist with staff education as necessary.

This position is located in a midsize community that offers much in the way of entertainment and activities. The area is known for a large number of parks and recreational activities. Vibrant downtown, steady growth and great museums are a few of the reasons this area boasts a high quality of life!

Excellent compensation and benefits are available, including relocation funds, loan forgiveness and tuition reimbursement. New graduates are welcomes and will be provided a supportive orientation and introduction to the hospital and the role of Nurse Anesthetist.

job summary:
RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral to postoperative care. PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. Candidates for PACU jobs require critical care skills to assess incision sites, monitor body temperature, and track other indicators of stability or complications. It is important for RNs in the recovery room to quickly make critical patient assessments as the on-call doctor may be unavailable during an emergency. Ideal candidates for post-anesthesia care units have natural abilities to think critically and histories of fast, accurate diagnoses. Past experience in critical care and surgical nursing is a plus.

Valid BLS from the American Heart Association
A valid professional license within the state of practice
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) credentials from the American Heart Association are recommended and may be required for specific registered nurses and travel nurse positions
Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific positions
Proof of right to work in the United States
Experience as a PACU nurse in a hospital setting

job summary:
The Department of Anesthesiology has an opening for a full-time Professional Research Assistant.


The laboratory is interested in basic and translational research in critical care, sepsis, nutrition,perioperative medicine, probiotics/microbiome and GI physiology.


The applicant must have a significant background in executing independent experiments and providing leadership and assistance to laboratory members of variable backgrounds and experience while managing the laboratory.


Applicant should have extensive histology, microbiology,and molecular biology skills.


In addition, the applicant should have extensive experience with maintaining rodent colonies and genotyping several strains of mice.


Previous experience in sepsis and pneumonia rat/mouse models, teaching and supervising students, residents, fellows in the laboratory, and experience writing scientific publications/grants will be given preference.


Supervision Received: The candidate will report to the Professor (PI) on a weekly basis.

Supervision Provided: The candidate will provide supervision and training to research assistants and students (high school, undergraduate, graduate/medical students, residents, fellows,and junior faculty).


Duties and Responsibilities: #


Molecular biology work including conventional PCR, real time PCR, protein analysis such as Western blotting, immunohistochemistry, and ELISA


#Tissue culture work, including feeding and splitting of epithelial cell lines


#Microbiological work, including isolating and identifying microorganisms from the GI tract


#Expertise in Microbiome sample collection and preparation in the clinical and laboratory setting.


#Maintaining animal colonies, including ordering, breeding, and genotyping of mice


#Designing and performing in vivo studies, feeding of rodents, surgical procedures


#Supervise students of all levels in laboratory setting and manage all members of the group


#Data interpretation and analysis, statistical analysis proficiency will be given preference


#Writing scientific publications


#Work independently and in a team environment, be highly motivated,willing to learn


Minimum Qualifications

Additional information and provision for requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by each hiring department.

Anesthesiology 

Physician


The Department of Anesthesiology at Duke University Medical Center is seeking a full time neuroanesthesiologist.


Responsibilities will include providing clinical care to neurosurgical patients, including a growing volume of both patients undergoing cortical mapping and those having endovascular procedures, and participation in resident and fellow education. In addition, faculty will have opportunity to participate in and/or develop research projects.


The Division of Neuroanesthesiology is nationally recognized for excellence in basic neuroscience research, clinical research, and neuroanesthesia education. The Division covers a large and rapidly growing neurosurgical (all subspecialties) and interventional neuroradiology practice. Recently expanded intraoperative MRI & CT imaging and endovascular neuroradiology suites increase the range of surgical capabilities and are integral to the neuroanesthesia practice. Duke University Hospital is a Level I trauma center, a JCAHO Certified Stroke Center, and home of the world-renowned Preston Robert Tisch Brain Tumor Center.


Salary and rank will be commensurate with training and experience. The Department of Anesthesiology offers a robust compensation plan that rewards clinical productivity and academic excellence. Additionally, faculty members enjoy Duke’s comprehensive benefit package including 401K, dental, vision, CME, moving allowances, and tuition assistance.

Ideal candidates will be BC/BE in Anesthesiology, have a commitment to teaching and research, and be fellowship trained in Neuroanesthesiology (or have significant experience and expertise in the field). Neurocritical Care experience would be an asset but is not required.

Physician


The Department of Anesthesiology at Duke University Medical Center is seeking a full time obstetric anesthesiologist to join the Division of Women’s Anesthesia. Ideal candidates will be BC/BE in Anesthesiology, have a commitment to teaching and research (clinical or basic sciences) and possess fellowship training in obstetric anesthesiology (or have significant experience and expertise in the field). job summary:
Exciting new opportunity!


EmCare is a leading provider of physician services for emergency departments, inpatient physician services, inpatient radiology management programs and anesthesiology services. Founded in 1972, EmCare has more than 570 exclusive contracts with client hospitals in nearly 42 states. We have an excellent opportunity for an Enrollment Coordinator to join our team!


POSITION SUMMARY:


This position provides support to the Enrollment function for the division including, but not limited to, the front end process of sending and receiving enrollment applications back from the providers within established guidelines.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Support the Enrollment process in meeting performance standards and deadlines, by updating and generating enrollment packets within Enrollment System for all billing contracts for the division. Following established procedures print applications from system populating as many fields that are feasible, review file and tag all applications for signature and completion by the practitioners, requiring acute detail-orientation and accuracy to ensure completeness of information pre-populated on the enrollment applications.
Prepare spreadsheet and notify RTI/Billing Company of new providers, obtain RTI billing numbers and enters data into Enrollment System prior to printing provider agreements.
Submit applications to the Enrollment Specialists for quality review prior to sending to the practitioners for completion. Using established templates prepare cover letter to include all documents that need to be returned with applications, prepare all Federal Express mailing envelopes and returns for packets, track all packets by date sent and received.
Conduct follow-up calls to providers for all outstanding packets in a timely manner for return to the division prior to first shift worked. Scrutinize applications for accuracy and completeness before submitting returned enrollment applications to Enrollment Specialists final review and processing to the payors.
Maintain Enrollment applications files following established procedures by practitioner and by facility including grids with medical expiration dates for all practitioners at all facilities, logs and information on NPI issues, including confirmation of all group NPI being loaded into Enrollment System and attest to the Medicaid numbers on the various Medicaid website.
May open the Enrollment department mail, logging applications that are returned, rejected and/or requests from payors for additional information, immediately disseminate Enrollment mail.
Adhere to all company policies and procedures.

Effective information systems security is a team effort involving the participation and support of every EmCare employee who deals with information systems. It is the responsibility of every employee to: Attend Information Systems security training, when offered. Comply with Information Systems security policies, standards and procedures. Use all available protections to safeguard computer systems under their charge from unauthorized access. Report all suspicious requests, incidents, and situations


Non-Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Perform other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications:


Education/Licensing/Certification:

High school diploma or GED required; Bachelor degree a plus

Experience:

Previous enrollment and/or insurance carrier billing experience preferred

Knowledge and Skills:

Strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills
Possess good analytical, organizational and detailed oriented skills
Ability to multi-task working under high volume and deadlines in a fast paced environment
Enthusiastic, self-motivated, able to work independently
Proficient in Microsoft Window applications (Word and Excel a must)
Versatile database management skills required
Capable of meeting time-sensitive deadlines and multi-tasking

Benefits :


We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes:

Full Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
Company Matching 401 K
Tuition Reimbursement
Company paid Life Insurance and Long-term Disability
2 weeks paid vacation

EOE including Veterans and Disabled

job summary:
Biostatistics and Clinical Outcomes group Occupational Summary:


The Biostatistics and Clinical Outcomes group in the Department of Anesthesiology at Duke University Medical Center is currently recruiting a Master's or Ph.D.'s-level biostatistician with experience in clinical research.


He/she will collaborate with faculty investigators, fellows, and residents in Duke's Anesthesiology department on the analysis of clinical, epidemiological, and basic science projects.


Duties include providing statistical recommendation/needs for project planning and protocol development, preparing statistical analysis plans, managing data needed for the analysis, selecting appropriate statistical methods for analysis, preparing analysis summary reports to the study team, and participating in manuscript writing.


Good communication skill is required to interact with clinical investigators and statistical colleagues.


Projects include both short term collaborations and long term research efforts.


Position Title: Biostatistician III Duties & Responsibilities:


# Provide guidance for study design and protocol development, which include writing statistical method section for protocols or grant application, conduct power calculation to estimate sample size needed for the study.


# Prepare statistical analysis plan (SAP) for the project, which outlines study hypothesis, outcomes variables, demographic and clinical variables, and statistical analysis methods. Select appropriate statistical models and conduct statistical analyses utilizing SAS, R and other statistical packages.


Prepare comprehensive summary reports and assist investigators in the interpretation of statistical results.


# Work with investigators closely to prepare statistical-related components for scientific presentations, conference abstracts, manuscripts, study protocols, and grant proposals. This includes the preparation of tables, figures, and graphs depicting research results


# Participate in Biostatistics group meetings, share knowledge and new analysis methods/tools with members in the Biostatistics group, and perform other related duties.


Programming and Data Set Documentation


# Design analysis data set specifications.


# Write own SAS and/or R code, find errors, corrects, and validates output and results.


# Perform complex programming such as complicated SAS procedures and options, SAS macros, and R functions


. # Program with increasing efficiency.


# Demonstrate understanding of clinical data used in each project.


# Maintain excellent documentation for each project.


Minimum Qualifications

Duke University is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individual's age, color, disability, genetic information, gender, gender identity, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, or veteran status. ******************************************************* Essential Physical Job Functions: Certain jobs at Duke University and Duke University Health System may include essential job functions that require specific physical and/or mental abilities. Additional information and provision for requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by each hiring department.
Education


Position requires a minimum of a Doctoral degree in (bio) statistics or related field and no relevant experience, or a Master's degree in (bio) statistics or related field and 2 years relevant experience, or a Bachelor's degree in (bio) statistics or related field and 4 years relevant experience.
Experience


OR AN EQUIVALENT COMBINATION OF RELEVANT EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE Contribution to analysis of clinical trials and/or clinical research projects, and/or participation in preparation of academic manuscripts or other written summaries of analysis results, thorough experience with SAS, and solid command of the English language is required. Desirable experience includes prior role as a lead statistician on clinical trials and/or clinical research projects that have delivered the agreed-upon end products on time, and prior guidance of lower level or less experienced staff.

job summary:
Job Summary

Shape Your Future


CONMED Orthopedics is seeking an ambitious Territory Manager to represent our expansive product offering of MTF biologics, Linvatec sports medicine implants and instrumentation, Hall Surgical Powered Instruments and the best fully autoclavable HD video available on the market. This is an exceptional opportunity to leverage these exciting products to grow business in prime accounts in the fast growing Houston orthopedic market. If you are a talented, experienced surgical rep who has strong relationships with orthopedic surgeons and a successful track record of converting business, we want you on our team. Make your mark here and you will be rewarded, appreciated and recognized!


Working closely with surgeons and OR staff, you will provide exceptional service and ensure your customers’ total satisfaction with our amazing line of quality products. This opportunity offers tremendous job satisfaction to those who are not only interested in lucrative, uncapped earning potential, but also in the things that make going to work every day personally rewarding:

Developing strong, long-term customer relationships
Opportunities for professional growth and advancement
A supportive sales management team who is committed to your success and helping you win
Having a positive and meaningful impact by offering the best and latest technology to improve patient outcomes
Take a fresh look at CONMED. We offer an attractive compensation structure that rewards growth and success. We offer innovative corporate programs that will empower you to compete for and win business. We need talented people like you on our team as we launch this exciting new chapter of growth. Apply now for immediate consideration!


Qualifications

Leave your footprint 
Bachelor's degree required. Degrees in Kinesiology, Pre-Med, Health Sciences, Athletic Training or related life-science degrees preferred. 3-5 years' outside sales experience detailing surgical implantable devices or surgical disposables to orthopedic surgeons and in hospital operating rooms. Demonstrated track record of success and goal-attainment. Strong organizational, time management and communication skills
Clean driving record.
Benefits

Be rewarded


CONMED offers competitive compensation

Excellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage

Short & long term disability plus life insurance – cost paid fully by CONMED

Retirement Savings Plan (401K) – company match dollar for dollar up to 7%

Employee stock purchase plan – allows stock purchases at discounted price

Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses


About CONMED

Get in


CONMED Corporation is a progressive, global medical device company. Through thoughtful leadership, innovation and team work, we are changing the future of medicine. Our 3,500 employees worldwide make meaningful contributions, positively impact the business and advance in their careers as our company and product portfolio grows. We are a leader in Orthopedics, General Surgery, Gynecology, Gastroenterology, Pulmonology, and Anesthesiology and our employees enjoy challenging and diverse job opportunities across these varied specialties. We are headquartered in upstate New York with additional domestic facilities in FL, CA, MA, NJ, CO and GA. We have an international presence in more than 20 locations throughout Europe, Australia, Latin America, Asia, North America, and the Middle East.


CONMED is an Equal Opportunity Employer & an Affirmative Action Employer.

job summary:
Emcare is a leading provider of physician services for emergency departments, inpatient physician services, inpatient radiology management programs and anesthesiology services. Founded in 1972, EmCare has more than 570 exclusive contracts with client hospitals in nearly 42 states. We have an excellent opportunity for a Director of Credentialing and Enrollment to join our team!


POSITION SUMMARY:


The main focus in this position is to act as a liaison with our billing companies and the EmCare divisional offices to support and ensure accurate/timely provider enrollment. This position is also responsible for maintaining a credentialing training manual. Additional responsibilities include: monitoring the credentialing process to assure compliance and standardization in accordance with EmCare, JCAHO and client standards, and analyze and report credentialing statistics as well as other relevant informational data.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Support the division and Specialists in facilitating the enrollment of the Practitioners with the various third party billing entities that require provider numbers.
Interpret complex payor rules and regulations and resolve payor issues.
Maintain Emtrac Database and knowledge of RTI Edison database.
Communicate with internal departments at EmCare, RTI and MedTrust to resolve managed care issues, electronic filing, ownership and practice administrator issues.
Act as a liaison with billing companies to oversee provider enrollment.
Preparation and audit of monthly Hold Report.
Interpret guidelines established by JCAHO, HCQA, and HFCA.
Reinforcement of EmCare’s credentialing standards.
Develop and maintain credentialing training program and manual.
Identify and monitor potential credentialing coordinators and follow up for further development.
Interpret client’s credentialing expectations and incorporate into EmCare credentialing process.
Responsible for developing and implementing educational programs that will promote development of credentialing personnel.
Work with Operations to assist in the overall credentialing process and be a resource for all individuals to promote growth within the company.
Adhere to all company policies and procedures.
Mentor employees, conduct performance evaluations, counsel and provide disciplinary actions to assigned personnel, and works to facilitate individual and team development that drives positive results.

Non-Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications:


Education/Licensing/Certification:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or equivalent experience.

Experience:

Ten years of related experience and/or knowledge of healthcare credentialing
Five years of management experience.

Knowledge and Skills:

Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong analytical abilities.
Exercise performance and independent judgment in performance of duties.
Proven leadership skills and extensive knowledge of organizational structure, flow of work and inter-relationships between departments.

Benefits :


We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes:


Full Medical, Dental and Vision benefits


Company Matching 401 K


Tuition Reimbursement


Company paid Life Insurance and Long-term Disability


2 weeks paid vacation


Eligibility to participate in Company Bonus Program

Job title: Assistant, Associate, Full Professor, in Neuroscience
education level/skills required / respon: More than 30,000 patients are diagnosed and treated annually by CVM clinicians and the NC State Veterinary Hospital is a major referral center for veterinarians...
job summary:
The Department of Molecular Biomedical Sciences is one of three departments at the College of Veterinary Medicine ( CVM ) and consists of 42 faculty who have a diversity of research, clinical, and teaching interests.

The CVM is located on the Centennial Biomedical Campus at NC State University and includes state-of-the-art research facilities in the CVM Research building (100,000 square feet) which opened in 2005 and in the Main CVM Administrative building where 7,000 square feet of laboratory space was recently renovated and an additional 7,000 square feet is currently undergoing renovation. At this time, construction of a new 40,000 square foot research building, the Biomedical Partnership Center is scheduled to be complete in April of 2017.

The Comparative Biomedical Sciences graduate program in the CVM consists of several different “tracks”, allowing students to focus their research in the areas of cell biology, infectious diseases, pharmacology, pathology and population medicine and a new focus in neurosciences is being developed in coordination with neuroscientists at the CVM and other Colleges at the University. Other graduate programs at NCSU with which department faculty are affiliated include programs in immunology, physiology, functional genomics, microbiology, toxicology and genetics.

More than 30,000 patients are diagnosed and treated annually by CVM clinicians and the NC State Veterinary Hospital is a major referral center for veterinarians from throughout the Southeast and (related to the advertised positions) includes active Anesthesiology, Radiology and Neurology services. The patient case load allows for student and house officer instruction and the opportunity for clinical trials and translational research that advance animal health and well-being. The Veterinary Hospital is composed of the 110,000-square-foot, state-of-the-art Randall B. Terry, Jr. Companion Animal Veterinary Medical Center which opened in 2011, the Equine and Farm Animal Veterinary Center and the Veterinary Health and Wellness Center and Satellite and Field Veterinary Services.

North Carolina State University’s College of Veterinary Medicine ( CVM ) is a dynamic community whose members are dedicated to training veterinarians and basic scientists while advancing animal and human health from the molecular cellular level through entire ecosystems.


Essential Job Duties

The Department of Molecular Biomedical Sciences in the College of Veterinary Medicine, North Carolina State University is recruiting two research intensive tenure-track faculty members (open rank) in basic and translational neuroscience to build on strengths at the College and University. These include regenerative medicine, neural development, mapping of pain/itch circuitry, retinal function, behavioral neurobiology, neurotoxicology, neuroendocrinology, neuro-machine interface, functional genomics, and the ability to translate discovery through collaboration with clinicians at our highly rated Veterinary Medical Hospital.

We are seeking candidates who employ state-of-the-art and innovative approaches that bridge disciplines. Members of this cluster are expected to establish strong collaborations within the university and other organizations in North Carolina’s Research Triangle area and to establish extramurally funded programs with national recognition. Translational research through veterinary and human medical collaborations is an important component of these positions. Successful candidates will be part of a growing interdepartmental and intercollegiate neuroscience community. These positions receive full salary support (12 month) from the College of Veterinary Medicine at NC State University.

Research activities across the University are directly or indirectly focused on neuroscience and include over 40 faculty in seven colleges which include departments as varied as Molecular Biomedical Sciences, Clinical Sciences, Biological Sciences, Chemistry, Biomedical Engineering, Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering, Entomology, Psychology, and Molecular and Structural Biochemistry, as well as prominent NC State Centers and Institutes and research core facilities. Additionally, there are regional opportunities for collaborations in this area, including Duke University, University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill, Research Triangle Institute, NIEHS , and EPA .

Relevant websites:

Neurosciences at NC State: http://www.meitzenlab.org/neuroindex.html

Research Triangle Chapter of the Society for Neuroscience: http://www.trianglesfn.org/

Center for Human Health and the Environment: https://chhe.research.ncsu.edu/

Comparative Medicine Institute: https://research.ncsu.edu/cmi/

Keck Center for Behavioral Biology: http://keck.sciences.ncsu.edu/

Bioinformatics Research Center: https://brc.ncsu.edu/

Kenan Institute for Engineering Technology and Science: https://kenan.ncsu.edu/

College of Veterinary Medicine: https://cvm.ncsu.edu/

Department of Molecular Biomedical Sciences:

https://cvm.ncsu.edu/research/departments/mbs/

Interested candidates must submit the following:

1) Curriculum Vitae;

2) Two-page research plan;

3) cover letter describing qualifications for the position; and

4) contact information of three references.

A comprehensive review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the positions are filled. Start date is targeted for 2017. Questions about this cluster hire may be directed to the Chair of the search committee, Dr. Troy Ghashghaei (tghashg@ncsu.edu).


Other Work/Responsibilities

Teaching is an essential component of the position and can include didactic lectures in the DVM and/or PhD curriculum, participation in problem solving courses, journal clubs, seminar series and graduate and post-doctoral training.


Minimum Education/Experience

PhD required, DVM or MD desirable


Departmental Required Skills

Demonstrated excellence in neuroscience research. Ability to work with others in establishing productive collaborations. Excellent communication skills required.


Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education

Strong research background in neuroscience, preferably with post-doctoral experience. Established funding record is necessary for Associate or Full Professor rank.


Required License or Certification

N/A


Special Instructions

Applications should include a letter of intent specifying qualifications, a two page research plan, a current curriculum vitae, and contact information of three references.

Description

ANESTHESIOLOGY TECHNOLOGIST

Location: Surgical Services-Main Hospital

Scheduled Work Hours: (Evenings-Core Shift) 2:00pm-10:30pm, Weekday Shifts; Subject to change per department needs. There will be a six-week orientation on the day-shift: 6:00am-2:30pm.

The Anesthesia Support Department operates 24/7. The anesthesia tech duties will perform technical work setting up, calibrating and troubleshooting anesthesia equipment; assisting the Anesthesiologist or CRNA with placing invasive and non-invasive monitoring devices on patients, ensuring necessary equipment is in good working condition and properly set up for the anesthesia procedure.

Learn more about Anesthesia Tech positions at UNC Health Care


LI-RC1

Qualifications

Requires graduation from an accredited Anesthesia Technician program; or high school diploma and two years of operating room experience in calibration, maintenance, and repair of anesthesia equipment or similar equipment, or related experience in a hospital/healthcare setting.

To be considered as a trainee, candidates must have high school diploma and one year of operating room experience involving direct patient care and/or equipment maintenance and calibration. Post high-school education will be considered for partial equivalency.

Job

Anesthesiology

Primary Location

United States-North Carolina-Chapel Hill

Organization

U-1000-ANESTHESIA SUPPORT

Schedule

Full-time

Unposting Date

Ongoing

Employee Status

Regular

job summary:
Serving the community since 1961, WakeMed Health & Hospitals is a nationally recognized, private, not-for-profit health care organization founded and based in Raleigh, N.C. The largest health system in Wake County, WakeMed exists to improve the health and well-being of our community by providing outstanding, compassionate, patient- and family-centered care to all. The 919-bed system is accredited by The Joint Commission and designated Magnet by the American Nurses Credentialing Center. WakeMed is a leader in cardiac and vascular care, women’s and children’s services, emergency medicine and trauma care, physical rehabilitation, orthopaedics and neurosciences. Specialty facilities include the WakeMed Heart Center, Children’s Hospital, Rehabilitation Hospital, Adult and Children’s Emergency Departments and a Level 1 Trauma Center. WakeMed’s team of more than 8,200 employees, 250 employed physicians, 1,500 volunteers, 1,200 affiliated physicians use the most advanced technologies along with the best minds and the biggest hearts to ensure the finest quality in health care and community health. For more information, visit www.wakemed.org .

Position Information
The Team Leader serves as the point person for the patient care technicians within Surgical Services. Coordinate plans with identified personnel to ensure supplies and equipment are available for operating room procedures; thereby, focusing on issue resolution.

Experience Requirements :
Two years of patient care technician experience required.

Education Required :
High School Graduate or equivalent required.

Licensure/Certification Requirements :
Hours of Work : 0645-1515
Weekend Requirements : As Needed
Call Requirements : As required

education level/skills required / respon: Candidate should have completed an ACVA or ECVA residency in Anesthesiology and be either Board Certified or Board Eligible....
job summary:
The NC State Veterinary Health Complex ( VHC ) strives to provide safe and humane care to all animals accepted for treatment. One way this is accomplished is through the administration of anesthetic agents. Anesthesia is used extensively in the practice of veterinary medicine, not only for surgical procedures but to minimize animal stress. Many VHC services administer anesthesia in order to safely and humanely facilitate diagnostic or minor surgical procedures. All graduate veterinarians employed by the VHC are qualified to prescribe and administer anesthetic agents to animals under their care by virtue of their professional training and their licensure by the North Carolina Veterinary Medical Board.


Essential Job Duties

A 12 month position teaching and supervising veterinary students, interns residents and technicians with administration of anesthetic agents for surgical procedures on both large and small animals.


Other Work/Responsibilities

Off clinic time may be devoted to other scholarly activities such as board preparation and research activities.


Minimum Education/Experience

DVM , VMD or foreign equivalent and completion of three year comprehensive veterinary anesthesia training program.


Departmental Required Skills

Must be able to lift up to 60 pounds.


Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education

Candidate should have completed an ACVA or ECVA residency in Anesthesiology and be either Board Certified or Board Eligible.


Required License or Certification

Must be eligible for a Faculty Certificate or license in North Carolina.


Special Instructions

education level/skills required / respon: The Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist will report to both the Director of Anesthesiology and the Medical Director of Anesthesiology and join a team of CRNA...
job summary:
Job in Knoxville TN
A nationally recognized, not-for-profit hospital system in Eastern Tennessee area is currently looking to add a Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist to join their supportive and friendly Anesthesiology team.

This hospital is is nationally recognized and consistently is recognized in the top 10% of hospitals nationwide in multiple specialties. They have acclaimed heart and emergency services programs, as well as a comprehensive oncology program. Employees here are known to truly love the culture of the hospital and both tenure and retention is high for clinical staff.

The CRNA would join a well-established Anesthesia Department that performs approximately 10k surgeries per year, including both inpatient and same day surgeries. Their major service lines include Ortho, Cardiac, Urology, General Surgery and GI. The CRNA would be responsible for delivery of anesthesia during main OR surgeries, in the maternity department and emergency airway support in all areas of the hospital.

The Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist will report to both the Director of Anesthesiology and the Medical Director of Anesthesiology and join a team of CRNA’s that cover the OR, Same Day Surgery, Cath Lab, Special Procedures, OB and MRI Suite. Additionally, there is an opportunity to teach and educate staff, if the CRNA is interested. It is not a requirement of the job, however.

The CRNA position is located in Eastern Tennessee, close to the border of Kentucky. This region is known as the Mountain Empire. It is a scenic area, with many trees, rivers and lakes, very near two national parks. This is an area with a fantastic quality of life and people here report loving their community.

This position offers a great compensation package that includes competitive salary, health and wellness coverage and relocation funds.
Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist, CRNA, Certified Nurse Anesthetist, Nurse Anesthetist, Tennessee 5000 2016-11-01

Quality people. Quality care. Quality of LIFE. EmCare is a national physician-led practice management company. education level/skills required / respon: PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral...
job summary:
RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral to postoperative care. PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. Candidates for PACU jobs require critical care skills to assess incision sites, monitor body temperature, and track other indicators of stability or complications. It is important for RNs in the recovery room to quickly make critical patient assessments as the on-call doctor may be unavailable during an emergency. Ideal candidates for post-anesthesia care units have natural abilities to think critically and histories of fast, accurate diagnoses. Past experience in critical care and surgical nursing is a plus. 

Job Skills / Requirements:

Valid BLS from the American Heart Association
A valid professional license within the state of practice
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) credentials from the American Heart Association are recommended and may be required for specific registered nurses and travel nurse positions
Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific positions
Proof of right to work in the United States
Experience as a PACU nurse in a hospital setting

education level/skills required / respon: Harborview Anesthesiology has an outstanding opportunity for a temporary / hourly Anesthesiology Technician 2 ....
job summary:
As the region's only Level I Trauma center, Harborview Medical Center (HMC) is well known for innovations and excellence in trauma care and its centers of emphasis: Trauma, Burn, Neurosciences, AIDS/STD CARER, and mentally-and medically- vulnerable populations. In addition to the centers of emphasis, HMC serves a mission population for King County. Harborview employees are committed to the vital role the institution plays in the immediate community, as well as the entire Northwest region. HMC is owned by King County and managed by the University of Washington (UW) and serves as a training site for UW’s School of Medicine. The UW is proud to be one of the nation’s premier educational and research institutions.


Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.


Harborview Anesthesiology has an outstanding opportunity for a temporary / hourly Anesthesiology Technician 2 . This individual will prepare, operate, and maintain anesthesia and laboratory equipment such as physiological monitors, blood gas analyzers. In addition, this individual will assist medical staff with technical problems related to anesthesia; under general direction, assist with the delivery of anesthesia, including the assembly, maintenance, evaluation and operating of equipment used in complex procedures such as cardiovascular, neurosurgical and multi-trauma cases; and monitor data regarding patient care both critical and non-critical situations.


Responsibilities :


Interacts professionally with patient and family.

Provides patient with explanations and verbal reassurance, as necessary.

and geriatric patients for treatment.

Performs all aspects of patient care in an environment that optimizes patient safety and reduces the likelihood of medical/health care errors.

Prepares room in a timely manner with all anticipated instruments, supplies and equipment for each individual Anesthesia procedure.

Assists in the positioning, prepping and draping of patients for surgical procedures.

Carries out medical/surgical asepsis during treatments/procedures.

Maintains safe environment for patient, co-workers and self, per facility policies and procedures.

Checks all equipment/instruments needed, prior to each procedure, to ensure proper functioning.

Protects patient’s sensitivities and right to privacy; closely observes patient with minimal disturbance.

Notifies appropriate personnel when patient complains of pain.

Follows aseptic technique when opening sterile supplies and setting up procedures.

Performs services requiring technical or manual skills, under the direction of Attending Anesthesiologist.

Anticipates needs of Anesthesiologist, Anesthesia Residents, and CRNA’s during perioperative phase.

Cleans and prepares rooms between procedures and after last case; restocks supplies, when necessary, and organizes effectively for end-of-case clean up.

Is fully responsible for care of instruments/equipment during intra/postoperative phase, including cleaning of equipment.

Follows written procedures for sterilization; knows responsibilities and the necessity for chemical and biological monitoring.

Consults with other staff members when in question or unfamiliar with equipment or procedure.

Regularly collaborates with other members of the Anesthesia team, in order to maintain equipment and supplies for Anesthesia procedures.

Adheres to and meets current standards, policies and procedures.

Establishes and maintains effective communication and good working relationship with co-workers for the patient’s benefit.

Makes decisions’ reflecting knowledge of facts and good judgment within the Anesthesia Technician’s scope of practice.

Makes decisions’ reflecting knowledge of the assigned case and equipment to be readied for the procedure.

Utilizes initiative; strives to maintain steady level of productivity; self-motivated. Organization and management of activities reflects due consideration for the needs of the department.

Performs other related duties as assigned.

education level/skills required / respon: Anesthesiology Technician positions are eligible for participation in the Employee Referral Program. UWMC's Surgical Unit has outstanding opportunities for full...
job summary:
Join our award-winning team at University of Washington Medical Center (UWMC). Among the top medical centers in the United States as rated by U.S. News & World Report "America's Best Hospitals", UWMC prides itself on compassionate patient care as well as its pioneering medical advances. UWMC is operated by the University of Washington (UW) and serves as a training site for UW’s School of Medicine. The University of Washington is proud to be one of the nation’s premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.


UWMC's Surgical Unit has outstanding opportunities for full-time and part-time ANESTHESIOLOGY TECHNICIAN 2's . We are looking for a health professional with experience in providing excellent direct patient care with anesthesia prior, post and during medical procedures. The Anesthesiology Technician 2 assists the operating room physician in preparing patients for surgical operations and procedures, examines patient vital signs, gathers data from monitors, assists physicians in the operation and maintenance of anesthesia equipment and devices, and observes patients post procedure. Patient age groups include newborn infant, pediatric, and adults. The Anesthesiology Technician 2 is an integral and essential member of the Operating Room Team and performs detailed procedures critical to the care and well-being of UWMC patients.


Additionally, responsibilities include:

Prepare, calibrate, and connect equipment such as blood pressure monitors, EKG's, EEG's to patients, and operate/maintain clinical analyzer

Install, prepare, calibrate, maintain, and modify electronic and mechanical equipment used for anesthesia

Obtain blood samples and provide blood parameters to medical staff as directed

Disassemble, decontaminate, and prepare anesthetic and monitoring equipment as needed

Present, interpret, and record physiological data

Assist UWMC OR staff with training of medical staff in routine and emergency use of anesthesia monitoring and resuscitation equipment

Related duties as trained and required to support Anesthesia Services

Competitive candidates will have a strong patient care background such as EMT or Paramedic training.


This position provides opportunities to work in a fast-paced, challenging, diverse and rewarding environment. As an employee you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.


REQUIREMENTS:


Associate of Arts Degree in Biomedical Electronics; OR two years of post-secondary education/training with emphasis in the sciences and one year of work experience in electronics service, maintenance and repair


OR two years of experience as an Anesthesiology Technician I, Paramedic, Laboratory Technician, or equivalent.


Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


DESIRED:

A minimum of two (2) years of experience as an anesthesia technician and high school diploma or GED

A graduate of an ASATT two-year approved program or equivalent

A graduate of an ASATT approved program and completion of required clinical

component or equivalent

A strong patient care background such as EMT or Paramedic training.


Candidates with current certification as an Anesthesia Technician or Technologist strongly preferred


CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT:


EMPLOYEE REFERRAL PROGRAM


Anesthesiology Technician positions are eligible for participation in the Employee Referral Program. If you were referred to these positions from a current UW employee, be sure to give them credit. In order for employees to be eligible for the ERP incentive, you must include their name in the assessment you will be asked to take following your application for this position.


For more information, contact Senior Healthcare Recruiter, Maria Kim at mariakim@uw.edu.

job summary: Job Summary

education level/skills required / respon: The Department of Anesthesiology & Pain Medicine in collaboration with University of Washington Medical Center has formed a center for Perioperative & Pain...
job summary:
The University of Washington (UW) is proud to be one of the nation’s premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.


The Department of Anesthesiology & Pain Medicine in collaboration with University of Washington Medical Center has formed a center for Perioperative & Pain Quality, Safety, Outcome (PPQSO). The mission of the center is to improve perioperative and pain quality, safety and outcomes. To pursue this mission, PPQSO will develop and employ informatics tools and technology to define and impact determinants of quality, safety, and outcomes. The Department of Anesthesiology & Pain Medicine at the University of Washington is a leader in developing informatics technology such as perioperative real-time decision support systems, aviation style checklists and barcode medication technology. PPQSO brings together the talented faculty, engineers and IT specialists to further advance perioperative care.


The Department of Anesthesiology & Pain Medicine currently has an outstanding opportunity for a PPQSO SOFTWARE ENGINEER The PPQSO Software Engineer will design, develop, implement and support sophisticated and complex computer applications and tools to advance the quality, safety, outcome and research missions of PPQSO. This includes all phases of application development lifecycle -- providing expertise on application design on a variety of platforms, extract/transform/analyze data from various electronic medical record (EMR) databases. Large data sets include, but are not limited to, the Anesthesia Information Management System (AIMS), the Amalga/Cardigm data aggregator for UW Medicine clinical data resources, the national Multicenter Perioperative Outcomes Group (MPOG) & ASPIRE databases as well as the Anesthesia Department Perioperative Quality and Research Database (PQRD). Additionally, data could be directly acquired from medical devices, auxiliary end devices and health information interfaces. Under the guidance of the director of PPQSO, the software engineer will develop and enhance features of Smart Anesthesia Manager (SAM) decision support and other applications meant for real-time data analytics, reporting and decision support. Additionally, the software engineer will also provide assistance to data reporting and retrospective data analysis initiatives. These efforts would not only apply to UWMC and HMC, but also SCH and the VA Puget Sound Hospital and may possibly extend to other hospital entities that have collaborations with PPQSO.


The PPQSO software engineer will design, develop, and support software & data management systems to support quality, clinical, and operational improvement initiatives.


The position has two core components:


1) Provide expertise, develop and support technology initiatives including SAM and other new applications meant to improve quality, safety, operational efficiency, billing and compliance.

2) Design and implement data reporting and analysis tools, produce data analysis reports for quality improvement and research requests.


Smart Anesthesia Manager: In collaboration with PPQSO director, translate existing SAM software from Labview development platform into a Java development platform, and as directed by PPQSO director, continue development and enhancement of Smart Anesthesia Manager (SAM) real-time decision support technology. This will include real-time decision support, checklists, handoff and barcoding of medications. Will integrate auxiliary data into SAM from electronic medical record (EMR) databases and devices. Assist with testing and implementation of SAM technology features. Additional initiatives will include enhancement of SAM technology into an expanded perioperative settings, integration of machine learning algorithms for predictive decision support, integration of SAM with EPIC/Cerner Anesthesia and EMR systems and medical device data systems. This will require significant knowledge of web services, T-SQL, Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) and likely programming skills in Object Oriented Languages such as Java and C#/Visual Basic as well as

a nuanced understanding of the complex operational, development, and support environment. Thorough documentation is also required. This role requires regularly reviewing and evaluating new system software products and services. After the development is completed, this position will continue to maintain and support the systems and applications.


Design & Implement Quality/Safety Data Systems: Provide support towards developing database queries, reporting tools, and supporting applications for quality and safety requests. These data extraction, analysis, and reporting mechanisms may be run against the AIMS, Amalga, MPOG, or other data systems or devices. Develop and maintain reporting tools and metrics for presenting research and quality results.


Regularly review and evaluate new system software products and services. Create and maintain data connections to required data sources, both local and enterprise level. Create and maintain uniform, well-documented, and intuitive user-interfaces for data presentation & entry, maintenance, and reporting. Write efficient, maintainable, secure, and documented code. Create and maintain system specifications, user operating instructions, and system support instructions. Enforce data validation and business rules in support of data integrity. Troubleshoot and resolve problems related to new and existing PPQSO managed systems.


REQUIREMENTS:


BA/BS Degree in Computer Science or Biomedical/Electrical Engineering or related Field and 4-5 Years' relevant experience:

Managing information management systems

Working in various programming environments and across various platforms

Managing projects from start to finish.


Technical Skills:


Excellent software engineering and programming skills in object oriented languages (Java .NET), web-based applications, and interfacing medical devices.

Good knowledge of T-SQL, SSMS, SSIS, SSRS, data visualization


Additional Requirements: :


Strong attention to detail

Excellent communication skills, both verbally and written

Ability to work successfully in a team

Ability to interact successfully with a wide variety of individuals from across the medical continuum

Substantial experience creating, querying and mining big data

Excellent analytical skills


DESIRED:


Post graduate degree in computer science or biomedical engineering preferred

Experience with Anesthesia information management systems (AIMS) and Electronic Medical Records (EMR)

Experience with Labview and Matlab programming environments

Experience with EPIC, Cerner clinical systems

Experience with HL7/FHIR


Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Criminal Conviction History, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select “Apply to this position”. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your “My Jobs” page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.


CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT:


Shared work environment


Appointment of the successful candidate to this position may be made contingent upon a satisfactory outcome of a criminal conviction history check .


The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability , and committed to becoming climate neutral.


The University of Washington is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 / 206-543-6452 (tty) or dso@uw.edu .

job summary:
VCA Veterinary Specialty Center of Seattle is seeking an experienced Licensed Veterinary Technicians and Veterinary Assistants to join the Neurology and Surgery Teams at our AAHA-accredited practice located in the thriving, Seattle, Washington suburb of Lynnwood.

We are a multi-specialty hospital that includes 24-hour Emergency/Critical Care, Cardiology, Neurology, Surgery, Internal Medicine, Dermatology, Radiology and Anesthesiology. We pride ourselves on delivering cutting-edge, progressive and compassionate medical care and world-class client service. Whether you are looking to obtain your Veterinary Technician license, your VTS in a favorite specialty in the future, or leaning towards a management role, VSC is a fantastic place to develop and foster your technical skills to help advance you in your chosen career path.

We have a current opening for:
Veterinary Assistant: Neurology - Must have clinical experience and great client service skills. Primary responsibilities will include, but not limited to, patient care, client education, and admitting patients for the neurologist. Current schedule is 4- 10s Wednesday – Saturday.

We're looking for a believer in the possibilities of high quality veterinary medicine and patient care--with the experience and technical know-how to make that happen. . ..a devoted team player who thrives in a collaborative environment, and is invested in their colleagues' success. . ..someone who takes enormous pride in their ability to listen and speak to clients like a trusted friend. . .a service-minded professional who is energized by the gratitude of others and in the satisfaction of a job done right.

We offer competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package, including: medical/dental/vision and paid vacation (for F/T employees), 401(k), generous personal pet care discounts, CE allotment and much more! If this describes you, then we want you on our team!

If interested in this opportunity, please click the “Apply” link below.

If you think this would be an ideal opportunity for someone you know, click “Share.”

Required Skills

Required Experience

education level/skills required / respon: This position promotes the goals and initiatives of the Anesthesiology Department as defined by the Manager of Anesthesiology Services....
job summary:
As the region's only Level I Trauma center, Harborview Medical Center (HMC) is well known for innovations and excellence in trauma care and its centers of emphasis: Trauma, Burn, Neurosciences, AIDS/STD, Center for Advanced Reconstruction and Rehabilitation (CARER), and mentally-and medically- vulnerable populations. In addition to the centers of emphasis, HMC serves a mission population for King County. Harborview employees are committed to the vital role the institution plays in the immediate community, as well as the entire Northwest region. HMC is owned by King County and managed by the University of Washington (UW) and serves as a training site for UW’s School of Medicine. The UW is proud to be one of the nation’s premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.


HMC has an outstanding opportunity for a full time Anesthesiology Technician Lead. Under the direction of the Manager, the Anesthesiology Technician Lead prioritizes, assigns and supports the work of the Anesthesiology Technicians. This position promotes the goals and initiatives of the Anesthesiology Department as defined by the Manager of Anesthesiology Services. The selected individual maintains professional working relationship with providers, Anesthesia Technicians and Operating Room staff. The Lead assists with and checks the work of the Anesthesia Technicians, assists with the trouble shooting of anesthesia equipment and facilitates the repair of broken equipment as well as trains and supports the technical staff in daily work and in the use and operation of Anesthesia equipment, analyzers, monitors and procedures.


Primary responsibilities:


Serve as a resource in support of assigned staff

Establish priority in the work to be done on a daily basis

Assist in the assignment and checking on technical staff

Coordinate the equipment and supply inventory.

Assist in training staff.

Troubleshoot equipment malfunctions.

Coordinate, direct or provide anesthesia support inside and outside the
Operating Room per the directions from Anesthesiology Technical Manager.


Additionally, this position will:

1. Perform all duties of an Anesthesia Technician 2.

2. Promote the goals and initiatives of the Anesthesia Department.

3. Support effective leadership by establishing priorities in the work to be done. Assist in providing work assignments,assisting in the direction and instruction of staff in the effective performance of daily tasks.

4. Help in checking the work of staff

5. Participate in the training of new staff in departmental practices and in the ongoing training of staff in general.

6. Works independently.

7. Set an example for staff with exceptional performance.

8. Develop and maintain professional working relationships with staff, physicians and patients. Abides by UW Medicine’s Service Culture Guidelines.

9. Has current knowledge of all cases in and out of the OR and assist in the direction or providing coverage.

10. Work within the scope of practice as defined by the department

11. Effectively utilize time and energy by setting the proper priorities.

12. Practice effective time management.

13. Recognize and effectively assesses probable causes or potential problems. Reason through and corrects problems.

14. Utilize own trouble shooting abilities as well as troubleshooting guides or manuals to assist in problem solving.

15. Implement and monitor quality control procedures. Detect shifts or trends indicating potential problems. Consults with Manager on corrective action before major problems develop, keeping manager aware of issues as appropriate.

16. Form productive working relationships with coworkers. Facilitate open communication between staff, manager and faculty.

17. Provide fair and immediate feedback on problems with individuals. Notify manager when issues are not resolved and of any ongoing problems.

18. Notify manager of exceptional staff performance.

19. Contribute to staff evaluations.

20. Utilize interpersonal skills to resolve problems. Consult with manager as appropriate.

21. Orient new staff, residents and physicians. Make sure appropriate documentation of training is obtained.

22. Maintain awareness of safety procedures and sees that they are followed. Set an example for staff.

23. Recognize potential safety hazards and take corrective action to resolve hazards. Notify appropriate personnel.

24. Maintain attendance standard.


REQUIREMENTS:


Associate of Arts Degree in Biomedical Electronics


OR


two years of post-secondary education/training with emphasis in the sciences and one year of work experience in electronics service, maintenance and repair


OR two years of experience as an Anesthesiology Technician II, Paramedic, Laboratory Technician, or equivalent.


Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


DESIRED:


A graduate of an ASATT approved program and completion of required clinical component or equivalent
