job summary:
Nursing Staff

1.0 FTE, 8 Hour Day Shifts
Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford is the heart and soul of Stanford Children’s Health. Nationally ranked and internationally recognized, our 311-bed hospital is devoted entirely to pediatrics and obstetrics. Our six centers of excellence provide comprehensive services and deep expertise in key obstetric and pediatric areas: brain & behavior, cancer, heart, pregnancy & newborn, pulmonary and transplant. We also provide an additional, wide range of services for babies, kids and pregnant moms.
Job Summary
This paragraph summarizes the general nature, level and purpose of the job.
The Sedation Manager works under the Associate Chief Nursing Officer (CNO) and the chair of the Sedation Committee. The position functions as a consultant for the division of Nursing, Medical Staff Offices, Accreditation and Regulatory compliance and the department of Anesthesiology. The position provides leadership to include consistent direction, consultation and support for nursing personnel and for provider-based sedation in planning, organizing, implementing and evaluating sedation practices within the applicable scopes of practice related to, anxiolysis, moderate sedation and deep sedation. Overall committee responsibilities is to serve as co-chair and provide leadership support to the sedation committee, to promote and improve adherence to accreditation, regulatory, policy and practice specific to administration of sedation in conjunction with and under the direction of the Chief of Anesthesiology.
Essential Functions

The essential functions listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.
Employees must abide by all Joint Commission Requirements including but not limited to sensitivity to cultural diversity, patient care, patient rights and ethical treatment, safety and security of physical environments, emergency management, teamwork, respect for others, participation in ongoing education and training, communication and adherence to safety and quality programs, sustaining compliance with National Patient Safety Goals, and licensure and health screenings.
Must perform all duties and responsibilities in accordance with the Service Standards of the Hospital(s).

Oversees and coordinates credentialing and privileging activities for medical staff, advanced practice staff in collaboration with the medical staff office and the Nurse Credential Review Board

Develops and maintains quality and patient safety measures for sedation and pain. Measure will align with the quality measures of nursing and anesthesia

Functions as a liaison with various other stakeholders and sedation providers within LPCH to triage sedation requests.

Functions as a liaison with providers (nursing and physicians) in each sedating department to address sedation requests and questions. Oversees sedation delivery and documentation in each department.

Functions as a sedation provider consultant for the implementation of EPIC system for sedation and sedation reporting and/or pain and pain reporting.

Tracks the implementation and collection of data/ data entry for the Pediatric Sedation Research Consortium.

Responsible for managing compliance and sedation education throughout the organization.

Serves as a member of the sedation committee which includes overseeing development of agenda and meeting minutes.

Supports compliance and accreditation readiness for sedation and pain management.

Reviews metrics and outcomes and reports out to the sedation committee.

Interprets new regulations for physicians and staff and ensures the Medical Center is in compliance
Minimum Qualifications
Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.
Education : Bachelor's Degree in Nursing from an accredited college or university (BSN)
Experience : 5 years clinical experience required
License/Certification : CA Registered Nurse (RN)
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification.

Ability to prioritize and organize tasks with excellent written and verbal communication abilities and customer service skills

Ability to work independently and as a team member as required

Knowledge of medical /clinical operations and collaborative practice models

Knowledge of TJC QI standards and other regulatory requirements

Knowledge of JCAHO survey process
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions in which the job is typically performed are available from the Occupational Health Department. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

job summary:
-

00010857

GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES:
The anesthesia technician assures the cleanliness and availability of supplies and equipment for the anesthesiologist providing anesthesia care, and assists as necessary with intubation, placing blocks, and placing lines.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS INCLUDE:
Maintains anesthesia meds, supplies and equipment according to usage, PAR levels, and maintenance schedules (in main OR and OB)

Consistently prepares appropriate anesthesia supplies and equipment for cases; responds to emergency situations promptly and appropriately

Demonstrates consideration and knowledge of age-specific issues relating to meeting the needs of patients of all ages from birth to geriatrics.

Completes annual age-specific competency study module and examination.

Reliably and consistently monitors, orders, and follows supply levels of medications, stores supplies, and special order items.

Identifies and documents equipment problems; replaces defective equipment as able / appropriate; notifies appropriate persons if defective equipment is not replaceable and/or affects the availability/capability of an OR suite.

Assists anesthesiologist as needed / as possible with difficult intubations, regional blocks, placing lines and administration of anesthesia in satellite areas (i.e., MRI, X-Ray, Lithotripsy trailer, etc.).

Maintains anesthesia workroom, supplies and equipment in a clean, orderly, organized manner. Documents daily the work and safety checks performed.

Interpersonal Relations:
Promotes effective working relationships with other anesthesia department staff as well as with staff in the

peri-operative areas.

Maintains positive attitude and is self-motivated; maintains communication with OR charge nurse, and anesthesiologists.

Shares expertise with other staff members and participates in orientation of new staff members and cross training of department ancillary staff.

Hospital and Department Policies:
Knows location of reference materials and utilizes them.

Practices within guidelines of department and hospital policies and procedures.

Sick time does not exceed six occurrences (six separate illnesses) per 12 month period for full time employee (prorated for part-time) 0-1 sick call = 1; 2-3 sick calls = 2; 4 sick calls = 3; 5 sick calls = 4; 6

sick calls = 5.

Reports to work on time, ready to accept assigned duties.

P: \MANUALS\SSppmOOUob Descnp & PPR 2004\ANES TECH2 JD.doc Last printed 01/19/04 8:35 AM Completes time-card daily, according to policy.

Takes breaks and meal times by coordinating these with the patient case flow, other anesthesia trained staff, and the OR supervisor.

Dresses according to OR dress code as stated in Surgery Policy Manual and utilizes good personal hygiene.

Maintains required BLS status, hospital safety reviews, and maintains documentation of these and required communications.

Reads and initials communication book, reads communication board, clarified questions.

Complies with hospital and department policies regarding infection control.

Adheres to all JMMC policies and procedures regarding controlled substances, biohazards materials and sharps.

Demonstrates consideration of age specific issues relating to meeting the needs of all patients from birth to geriatrics. Completes annual age-specific competency self-study module and examination.

Works as scheduled. Follows ETO policies and ETOR requesting procedures.

Shows respect, tact and diplomacy in interactions with hospital staff and patients.

Assures patient safety, privacy and confidentiality as appropriate or required.

Team work:
Accepts constructive feedback in professional manner.

Asks for assistance when needed, based on recognition of talent and strengths of peers. Addresses work-related issues and problems in an adult and positive manner.

Offers help willingly, assists with room turn overs or completes room turnovers depending on staffing.

Sensitive to and responds to priorities of the unit and peers.

Interact appropriately with support departments (i.e., X-Ray, CPD, Short Stay).

Works with managers in department to complete minimal cross training to CPD

Demonstrate recognition of peers by providing positive and negative feedback.

Promptly reports safety hazards to the charge nurse and takes appropriate initial action.

Actively provide input for change i.e., ideas, suggestions, alternatives.

Participate in implementation of change within department.

Follows chain of command in implementation of change or problem solving.

Qualifications

High school diploma or equivalent desirable.

Two years or more of experience in anesthesia services; or three years of a combination of OR, respiratory therapy, Pd, or anesthesia services.

BLS certified

Ability to assist in the OR for anesthesia related procedures, maintain clean/sterile fields in OR when assisting anesthesiologists during cases, follow OR guidelines regarding cleaning techniques/principles.

John Muir Health is a nationally recognized, not-for-profit health care organization. It includes John Muir Medical Center, Walnut Creek (554-bed acute care facility) , which serves as Contra Costa County's only designated trauma center and John Muir Medical Center, Concord (245-bed acute care facility).Together, they are recognized as top centers for neurosciences, orthopedics, cancer care, cardiovascular care and high-risk obstetrics. Other areas of specialty include general surgery, robotic surgery, weight-loss surgery, rehabilitation and critical care. John Muir Health also offers complete inpatient and outpatient behavioral health programs and services at our Behavioral Health Center (73-bed fully accredited psychiatric hospital) located in Concord. In addition, John Muir Health provides a number of primary care and outpatient services throughout the community and urgent care centers in Brentwood, Concord, San Ramon and Walnut Creek.

John Muir Health is a collaborative, patient-centered health care environment; listening, explaining and working together as a team, to help patients achieve their optimal health. We recognize those who exemplify excellence, and reward them for contributing to our collective success. From individual to department to spontaneous recognition, Employee Suggestion Program rewards, Employee Success Sharing Program, and many more, we find unique ways to thank our employees for the outstanding efforts they make every day. Competitive salary and benefit package available.

All hospitals are accredited by The Joint Commission, a national surveyor of quality patient care. John Muir Health is an equal opportunity employer.

The Anesthesiologist role will be working in the Anesthesiology specialty, located in San Mateo Medical Center - ANE San Mateo, CA. Please contact Shannon Munoz at Shannon.Munoz@evhc.net for additional benefits information.

Job Details: -No Peds-No Cardiac-No Trauma-1 in 3­

Facility Information: San Mateo Medical Center's acute care hospital, specialty services, ancillary services, emergency services, and administrative offices are located in San Mateo. Some of our primary care clinics also are located in San Mateo. We are licensed to operate 509 beds including a 64-bed medical/surgical unit, a 7-bed intensive care unit, a 34-bed inpatient psychiatric services unit and 32 skilled nursing beds in San Mateo

Community Information: San Mateo (/ˌsæn məˈteɪ.oʊ/ SAN mə-TAY-oh; Spanish for "Saint Matthew") is a city in San Mateo County, California in the high-tech enclave of Silicon Valley in the San Francisco Bay Area. With a population of 97,207 as of the 2010 census, it is one of the larger suburbs on the San Francisco Peninsula, located between Burlingame to the north, Foster City to the east, Belmont to the south, and Highlands-Baywood Park and Hillsborough to the west. San Mateo was incorporated in 1894. By car, San Mateo is about thirty minutes from downtown San Jose and twenty-five minutes from downtown San Francisco.

With more than 12,000 affiliated providers coast-to-coast, EmCare is nationally-recognized for delivering clinical excellence supported through innovation, integration and exceptional leadership.

Physician-led organization
Strong leadership on a local, regional and national level
Exceptional quality of practice backed by comprehensive support services
Optimal staffing ratios and flexible scheduling options
“A” rated professional liability insurance
Extensive variety of practice settings coast-to-coast
Competitive compensation including several benefit options
Opportunities for professional development, mentoring and career advancement

Colleague referral bonus program


Benefits vary by division, clinical specialty and employment status

Quality people. Quality care. Quality of LIFE. EmCare is a national physician-led practice management company. This publically held company provides outsourced clinical department recruitment, staffing, management and billing/collection services for hundreds of hospitals and health systems nationwide.

Known for its unique structure, EmCare develops local practices, supports them with regionally-located clinical leadership and operational personnel and provides them access to unprecedented national resources. Each EmCare practice has its own unique culture, but all sites recruit and hire clinicians who share the company's core values of being patient-focused, customer-centered and caregiver-inspired.

EmCare is a family of companies, each of which has clinical staffing needs. Full-time, part-time, and independent contractor opportunities are available through EmCare.

education level/skills required / respon: PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral...
job summary:
RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral to postoperative care. PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. Candidates for PACU jobs require critical care skills to assess incision sites, monitor body temperature, and track other indicators of stability or complications. It is important for RNs in the recovery room to quickly make critical patient assessments as the on-call doctor may be unavailable during an emergency. Ideal candidates for post-anesthesia care units have natural abilities to think critically and histories of fast, accurate diagnoses. Past experience in critical care and surgical nursing is a plus. 

Job Skills / Requirements:

Valid BLS from the American Heart Association
A valid professional license within the state of practice
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) credentials from the American Heart Association are recommended and may be required for specific registered nurses and travel nurse positions
Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific positions
Proof of right to work in the United States
Experience as a PACU nurse in a hospital setting

job summary:
Job in San Jose CA
A prestigious and rewarding opportunity is now available as a Sedation Program Nurse Manager at one of the nation’s leading Medical Centers located in the SF Bay Area.

This is a unique and exciting position that leads and advises t across interdisciplinary departments to ensure regulatory, accreditation, and credentialing and quality compliance within the Anesthesiology department. The Anesthesiology Sedation Program Manager provides consistent direction and support for PACU nurses, certified CRNAs, and provider-based sedation. The Quality Program Sedation Manager evaluates sedation practices through the medical center and develops quality and patient safety measures.

The Sedation Manager will also oversee credentialing for medical staff and advanced practice nursing involved in Anesthesiology and will function as a liaison between sedating departments, ensuring staff remains up to date on all current policies and practices. The nurse manger will co-chair the Sedation committee along with the Chief of Anesthesiology and collaborates on compliance and reporting processes. The Nurse Manager of Anesthesiology Program reports data findings and quality outcomes to committee and oversees documentation standards.

The hospital is renowned for its many centers of excellence, leading research and technology and its commitment to the highest quality of care. This is a wonderful opportunity for an experienced nurse leader to showcase their skills in contributing to the continued success and safety of patients.
PACU Nurse manager, Sedation Program Manager, Credentialing Manager, CRNA, Anesthesiology Program Nurse Manager, Post Anesthesia Care Unit Supervisor, California 5000 2016-11-01

education level/skills required / respon: Medical Anesthesia Consultants (MAC), a Sheridan affiliated practice is seeking an experienced Anesthesiologist for University Surgery Center in Merced, CA.
job summary:
Medical Anesthesia Consultants (MAC), a Sheridan affiliated practice is seeking an experienced Anesthesiologist for University Surgery Center in Merced, CA. Join a group of the region’s preeminent surgeons and anesthesiologists providing quality care in a modern, state of the art surgery center.


This position is for a Facility Anesthesia Director. Provide anesthesia services for general surgery, ENT, Peds, Ortho, Urology, Pain, Ophthalmology, Podiatry and Peds dentistry. There is no call requirement, 90% of them rooms are done by 5 pm. This position also requires someone who can work in a very fast paced environment with very short turnover time and has the ability to interact well with surgeons, staff and patients. Board certification desired and leadership experience required .


Merced, California is in the San Joaquin Valley of Northern California. It has a population of nearly 82,000 and is known as the “Gateway to Yosemite” which is a two hour drive away. In addition it is close to Monterey Bay and the Pacific Ocean. UCLA has a campus in the community, University of California, Merced. Recreational activities include Merced national Wildlife Refuge, Applegate Park, Merced Fruit Barn, Castle Air Museum and Lake Yosemite. Merced is the home to Malibu boats. Close by are Fresno (58 miles), San Jose (115 miles) and San Francisco (131 miles).

job summary:
Recruiter


Job Summary

Shape your future


A transformation is underway at CONMED. Join our recruiting team and you’ll be on the front lines with our managers as we build a talent-focused, high-performance organization.


As a recruiter at CONMED, you’ll be responsible for attracting high caliber candidates and managing the candidate experience. You’ll influence and coach hiring managers on identifying and landing the best talent for their team. You must be committed to providing the highest levels of responsive, professional support and be passionate about building a great organization.


Job Responsibilities:

Administer the applicant tracking system and recruiting process, from the time the requisition is approved until the time the candidate is on-boarded. Timely and accurate disposition of candidates is crucial.


Routinely source candidates through various databases and LinkedIn using Boolean search techniques. Proactively network through industry contacts to solicit candidate referrals. Target and pitch passive candidates on career opportunities.


Partner with hiring managers to understand and identify essential job qualifications and talents, develop sourcing strategies, and assess candidates. Educate and develop managers’ skills in equitable and valid hiring practices.


Communicate persuasively in writing and over the phone to candidates, hiring managers and human resource partners. Ensure organized, accurate and effective communication to all parties throughout the recruiting process.


Systematically map the talent pool, including competitive companies, pay, layoffs, attraction factors, etc.


Develop effective, creative advertising and outreach strategies to reach your target candidate audience, including diverse candidates. Develop a strong pipeline of qualified candidates for present and future openings.


Troubleshoot, cold call, brainstorm, problem solve as needed to fill tough positions.


Assist in the creation of reports, metrics, updates and presentations.


Ensure compliance throughout the recruiting and hiring process with all applicable policies, procedures and laws.


Assist in the interpretation and administration of company policies, procedures and guidelines.


Advise and counsel others in equitable application.


Plan, evaluate, research and recommend systematic or process improvements in the recruiting function.


Qualifications

Leave your footprint

Bachelor’s degree


Two plus years of recruiting experience


Human resources, Marketing or related experience nice to have


Excellent judgment, organizational and analytical skills


Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills


Intermediate or advanced Boolean search skills. AIRS certification a plus.


Skills in the use of Microsoft Office Suite.


Ability to effectively prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced work environment.


Prior experience with applicant tracking systems strongly preferred.


Fundamental understanding of employment laws, including Equal Opportunity Employment and Affirmative Action

Benefits

Be rewarded 

CONMED offers competitive compensation


Excellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage


Short & long term disability plus life insurance – cost paid fully by CONMED


Retirement Savings Plan (401K) – company match dollar for dollar up to 7%


Employee stock purchase plan – allows stock purchases at discounted price


Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses

Get in


CONMED Corporation is a progressive, global medical device company. Through thoughtful leadership, innovation and team work, we are changing the future of medicine. Our 3,500 employees worldwide make meaningful contributions, positively impact the business, and advance in their careers as our company and product portfolio grows.


We are a leader in Orthopedics, General Surgery, Gynecology, Gastroenterology, Pulmonology, and Anesthesiology and our employees enjoy challenging and diverse job opportunities across these varied specializations. We are headquartered in upstate New York with additional domestic facilities in FL, CA, MA, NJ, CO, and GA. We have an international presence in more than 20 locations throughout Europe, Australia , Latin America, Asia, North America, and the Middle East . Sterilization Specialist


Qualifications


CONMED is committed to developing high quality, innovative medical device products to improve the quality of life for our customers around the globe. As a S terilization Specialist you will be responsible for supporting sterility assurance company-wide while maintaining compliance with regulatory requirements and CONMED policies and procedures. Job Summary


Shape Your Future


The Director, Internal Audit will report directly to the Audit Committee of the Company's Board of Directors and administratively to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) . This person will be a key member of the CFO Staff, and will work closely in partnership with senior managers throughout the Company to assess the Company's processes for identifying and managing business risk and delivering organizational effectiveness and efficiency. The candidate selected for this position will have a proven background in audit, including financial and operational controls, and information technology. He or she will have exceptional business leadership skills, and be able to demonstrate superior business acumen


Corporate Audit

Develop and execute a risk-based operational audit plan for the Company at large, including tracking audit findings through to remediation. Most audits have a major IT component.

Sarbanes-Oxley Section 404 Compliance

Administer the Company's Section 404 compliance efforts, including control definition, self­ assessment and testing

Coordinate testing plans and results with Company's external auditors 
Responsibilities/Dutie s: As Director, Internal Audit, the candidate will bring best in class thinking to the internal audit function relative to risk assessment, audit process development, utilization of automated audit tools, and the development of the function, and will be expected to:
Understand the risk profile of the company

Drive the development of and execute against risk-based audit plans that clearly define the objective and scope of each review, employing critical thinking and appropriate testing methodologies

Provide an independent appraisal of controls over financial integrity, operational effectiveness, IT controls for security, privacy and high availability, and compliance with laws and policies
Develop strong relationships with department heads, teaching them how to think about identifying and mitigating risks in their environment
Communicate findings with management in a timely manner, obtaining agreement on root cause of issues and commitment to implement recommendations
Drive the preparation of presentations to Audit Committee
Write comprehensive, yet easy to understand, audit reports


Follow up and appraise implementation of corrective actions
Knowledge/Skills: The candidate will be expected to demonstrate:

A bias for obtaining results Familiarity with major business processes
Strong technical internal audit skills, including IT audit skills and knowledge of SOX 404 and control requirements
Strong project management skills
Ability to interact comfortably with executive level management and board members
Ability to build strong relationships
Ability to quickly assimilate relevant information in unfamiliar situations
Superior analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent listening, verbal, written and presentation communication skills
Strong influencing and negotiation skills
Passion to help to continually improve operations
Sound judgment and ability to act independently Qualifications

Leave your footprint

BA/BS and 10+ years' relevant experience
CPA or CMA preferred
Travel requirement - 30 to 40%

job summary:
Job Title: 

Generalist, Human Resources

Purpose: The HR Generalist performs human resources-related duties at the professional level and works closely with HR management in supporting designated client group. This position carries out responsibilities in the following functional areas: employee relations, performance management, policy implementation, change management, training, recruiting and onboarding, affirmative action and employment law compliance.


Duties and Responsibilities:

Maintains availability and frequent contact with employees at all levels of the organization within the designated client group with an emphasis on recognizing and understanding the needs/concerns of the workforce.
Provides HR guidance to line management in coaching and counseling, career development, performance management, disciplinary actions, etc.
Responds to employee relation issues such as employee complaints, harassment allegations and civil rights complaints. Conducts thorough investigation and make recommendations for a timely resolution.
Partners with employees and management to communicate various employment policies, procedures, laws and government regulations.
Develops and maintains positive partnership with the site leader(s) and the management team within the designated client group.
Assists management in developing and implementing policies, procedures, employee engagement activities and organizational development programs.
Recommends new approaches, policies and procedures to effect continual improvements in efficiency of the department and services performed.
Contributes to the overall recruiting effort of the designated client group including screening applicants and conducting interviews.
Participates in regular meetings within the designated client group.
Coordinates and implements community outreach efforts.
Responsibilities in some sites may also include but not limited to: onboarding, conducting New Employee Orientation, developing/conducting training programs, maintaining personnel files and other required documentation, ensuring legal compliance, etc.
Performs other duties as required and assigned. Work Experience Requirements: 3 to 5 years in a Human Resources position; with a minimum of 2 years benefits administration experience. Experience in managing projects; including coordination of cross-functional teams, project timelines, and communication.

Education Requirements: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Organizational Development, Business, or related field.

Knowledge Requirements: Strong knowledge of benefits administration; including familiarity with benefit plan designs and communication. MS Office Suite, Excel, Word, PowerPoint. Experience with HRIS systems (ADP, Oracle). Desired: Supervisory experience. Benefits

Be rewarded
CONMED offers competitive compensation

Excellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage

Short & long term disability plus life insurance – cost paid fully by CONMED

Retirement Savings Plan (401K) – company match dollar for dollar up to 7%

Employee stock purchase plan – allows stock purchases at discounted price

HRIS Business Analyst


Job Summary

Shape your future


CONMED is committed to developing high quality, innovative medical device products to improve the quality of life for our customers around the globe. As an HRIS Business Analyst on our HRIS Team, you will play an instrumental role in maintaining, implementing and updating all current or new HR systems.


Purpose:

The HRIS Business Analyst role will be responsible for working with the Human Resource Management System and any additional system supported by the HRIS team. This role will also work on system planning, controls, testing and implementation of HR solutions as well as advise HR users on systems, processes and policies. This position will work under direct supervision of the HRIS Manager.


Duties and Responsibilities:

Responsible for integrity of employee and organizational information. This includes systems and data such as ADP (EV5), Kronos, Halogen, Virtual Edge, and SABA.
Assists in any HR system implementations, upgrades, and patches.
Develop user guides and documentation for the HRIS team and its business partners.

Investigate issues and facilitate resolutions.

Performs data audits, analyzes data proactively and on request in support of HR initiatives.
Develops standardized and ad hoc reports to support business needs.

Fast and accurate alphanumeric data entry skills.

Must be detail oriented, analytical, and quality conscious.

Must demonstrate strong organizational and time management skills.

Ability to function as HRIS subject matter expert to develop and implement technical solutions that enhance efficiency and performance.

Must have a passion for process improvement, be self-motivated and able to work both independently and in a team that is fast-paced,

ever-changing high priority environment.

Leave your footprint

Bachelors degree in IT, Human Resources, or related field require. (Masters preferred)

4 years related experience or training or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel

job summary:
Maintenance Planner


Job Summary

Shape your future 

The Maintenance Planner is the on-site coach, trainer, motivator and expeditor of materials and personnel. The planner is encouraged to do this in a team spirit to promote employee motivation. The planner provides a safe operating environment by planning installation, maintenance and repair of machines, tools, equipment and utility systems.
The Maintenance Planner works with the Maintenance Manager in developing the scheduled maintenance programs and processes for the production facility to minimize impact on production. The planner pre-evaluates the need for replacement parts and places orders. The incumbent plans for interruptions in work and develops backup plans to minimize the interruptions for the production facility. The planner insures that all accounting and supply chain procedures and policies are followed in relation to performing his duties.


Duties and Responsibilities:

The Maintenance Planner is responsible for planning maintenance work orders, the repairs, servicing and efficient functioning of all machinery and equipment in a plant. The Maintenance Planner and Maintenance Manager will work together with Operations (their customer) to meet present and future goals. The Maintenance Planner will determine the technical documentation that will support the craftsman. Technical Documentation will include Drawings (PID, flow charts, etc.).


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.


SAFETY: Individual must comply with all safety standards or rules.


MAINTENANCE: Planner's duties include managing maintenance data collection and information gathering to more effectively provide the planned maintenance in the TMS Enterprise software system.


To keep operating equipment in the condition to deliver full design duty (reliability), to insure plant and equipment run properly when it is required for operation, to correct equipment and machines when the design duty cannot be achieved and then return them to design specification, and maintain assets most profitably for the life of the organization. (Life cycle profit)


Organizes training and provides appropriate documentation of training for experience in Cad or smart draw or equivalent computer aided drafting software.


Prepares Technical Documentation to include: Drawings, Spare parts list, Critical operations, OEM manuals, Updates the work-order status in CMMS.
Plan future goals of Predictive and Preventive Maintenance.


Responsible for procedures and documents used to describe appropriate job functions within the Quality Management System and others deemed necessary.


Qualifications

Leave your footprint

Five years in a manufacturing, facilities maintenance shop environment.

Minimum of 5 years of experience in industrial manufacturing and or an Associates degree in electrical, instrumentation, or mechanical engineering.


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


Excellent leadership and organizational skills.


Must be proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and Computerized Maintenance System, (CMMS).


Knowledge with computerized drafting skills preferred.


Individual must be able to work productively within a team environment. Individual must be accurate and trustworthy with a positive attitude and embracing of change in a dynamic manufacturing environment.

Ability to define problems; collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Benefits

Be rewarded 

CONMED offers competitive compensation


Excellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage


Short & long term disability plus life insurance – cost paid fully by CONMED


Retirement Savings Plan (401K) – company match dollar for dollar up to 7%


Employee stock purchase plan – allows stock purchases at discounted price


Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses

job summary:
Job Title

Strategic Procurement Lead


Job Summary

Shape your future 

CONMED is committed to developing high quality, innovative medical device products to improve the quality of life for our customers around the globe. As part of our Supply Chain team, you will have an opportunity to be a part of that important mission and to make a meaningful impact on the business. Our Strategic Procurement Analyst is a high visibility role involved with sourcing, supplier selection and qualification, supplier relationship management, contracts / negotiation and cost savings initiatives. Additionally, this role will have the unique opportunity to drive projects associated to mergers and acquisitions and to work with high level leadership at both the newly acquired site and corporate headquarters. Examples of M&A; projects include supplier rationalization projects and business process harmonization. Finally, we are seeking a seasoned purchasing professional in this role who enjoys coaching and mentoring as there could be opportunity to mentor buyers on the team. This is an outstanding role for a results-oriented proven purchasing professional eager to make an immediate impact on our supply chain.


Qualifications

Leave your footprint B.S./B.A. degree, MBA preferred APICS, C.P.S.M. and/or CPIM certification desirable 8 years relevant experience in purchasing or equivalent. Includes negotiating, blueprint reading, vendor sourcing skills Knowledge of lean manufacturing, material planning, sales & operations planning. Proven background in purchasing, negotiations, managing projects and resolving difficult problems. Good understanding or manufacturing concepts and materials for commodity grouping. Thorough knowledge of purchasing procedures and practices. Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.

About Ob Hospitalist Group
Ob Hospitalist Group (OBHG) began in 2006 with a vision to elevate the standard of women’s healthcare by delivering specialized services that improve quality and positively impact women’s healthcare by ensuring every expectant mother has the security of consistently and unconditionally seeing a physician when presenting to the Labor and Delivery department or Emergency Room.

OBHG leads the industry in developing and managing in-house OB/GYN hospitalist programs staffed with highly-skilled, Board Certified physicians 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Our team of dedicated professionals serves sacrificially to save lives, improve patient outcomes, relieve and support medical staff, and to promote evidence based best practices and clinical excellence. In partnership with hospitals, nursing staff, physicians and hospitalists we have developed a unique, comprehensive, financially viable OB/GYN hospitalist program that positively impacts the lives of women, their newborns, and the families we serve.

is expected to be able to differentiate GE’s offerings; convey compelling value proposition; lead

the opportunity; qualify customer needs; develop and present solutions proposals and quotations;

and respond to customers’ clinical/technical/process questions in order to close sales.

Financial Performance

accounts and or territory

3. Forecast orders and sales within the applicable sales funnel tools and reports for their

products/solutions/services in their assigned territory/accounts

Territory & Account Management

1. Create business plans for territory/assigned accounts including, but not limited to opportunity

development, competitive strategies and targets

strengthen relationships within the assigned accounts/ territory. Identify & respond to key account

relevant CRM tools

and lead effective counter-strategies

issues and challenges

optimum margin for GE

effectively using GE resources and approved product marketing and product promotion material to

actively support the customer through their decision making process towards a successful

outcome for GE

6. Represent the company at relevant medical conferences and technical exhibitions to promote

product/solution and company

Opportunity management

applicable) to continuously increase prospect funnel

2. Drive tender/bid process including the needs qualification, vendor selection, quotation and

closure of their product/solution/service opportunities to meet orders, sales and margin targets as

4. Ownership of order and configuration quality at the point of entry to ensure accuracy,

configuration integrity and that all requirements are tied to documented customer inputs

delivery schedules ensuring fulfillment of the order is according to customer expectations and

enhances customer satisfaction

6. One GEHC teamwork

7. Contribute to account plans where applicable at accounts covered by account

managers/executives

8. Continuously educate and coach account team members on their product/service/solution

strategy and offerings

9. Collaborate with and leverage subject matter experts and other resources within GEHC

channels to build relationships and secure business

10. Share and follow-up identified leads to other product lines within own accounts and or One

GEHC accounts

Compliance

1. Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local

Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes

2. Adhere to all applicable GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training

requirements

3. Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as

required


Qualifications/Requirements
Qualifications


1. Bachelor’s Degree or minimum 5 years of selling experience in a medical, healthcare or

technical field( e.g. biomedical engineering, medical physics) or Life Sciences field

2. Previous experience in the Healthcare Industry

3. Ability to interface with both internal team members and external customers as part of solutions

based sales approach

4. Ability to energize, develop and build rapport at all levels within an organization

5. Strong capacity and drive to develop career

6. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in local language as well as good command of

English

7. Ability to synthesize complex issues and communicate in simple messages

8. Excellent organizational skills

9. Excellent negotiation & closing skills

10. Strong presentation skills

11. Able to travel

12. Valid motor vehicle license

Quality Specific Goals

1. Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality

Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job

type/position

3. Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as

required

4. Maintain knowledge of and understand all applicable Global Privacy and Anti-Competition

Policies and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or Local/ Int’l Law is broken.

5. Maintain knowledge of and understand all applicable Environmental Health Policies (including

but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate

within them to ensure that no company policy or local / Int’l Law is broken.

6. Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to

ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System.


Additional Eligibility Qualifications

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.


Desired Characteristics

1. Proven and progressive previous experience in sales/services/promotion to C-suite and

technical decision makers e.g. CEOs, Strategic Planning Directors, Facilities/Estates managers,

Biomedical Engineers, nursing staff, medical specialty staff (Anesthesiology, Radiology, Intensive

care, Nuclear Physicists etc.)

job summary:
Description: 

Position Summary- 11:30a-8p
The Anesthesia Technician (AT) is an essential member of the Anesthesia Support Team. Anesthesia Technicians assist licensed anesthesia providers in surgical and clinical care settings. Primary duties include but are not limited to: the preparation and set up of appropriate equipment and supplies, extensive skill in using and maintaining anesthesia equipment, and providing assistance with hands-on patient care (if applicable). 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Monitors and maintains all anesthesia-related equipment

Responsible for inventory of all supplies used by the anesthesiologists in the OR and other remote areas
Identify and assemble various types of intubation equipment such as blades, fiberoptic scopes, as well as other special equipment and supplies required for difficult intubations
Assist with routine to complex surgical cases before, during and after anesthesia procedures
Perform Point of Care Testing as requested
Assist licensed personnel with non-invasive patient care as directed
Assist with placement of invasive lines, intubation, and regional anesthesia
Assist with patient transport under the direction of a licensed provider
Participates in education of new staff members as well as ongoing educational programs for department
Participate in new product evaluation at the direction of manager.
May participate in directing activities of team members as Charge AT or in absence of Charge AT, and carry trauma pager
Collaborate with external departments such as Perioperative Services, Radiology, Pharmacy, and Supply Chain Qualifications Education
High school diploma or equivalent required; additional training beyond high school preferred 

Licenses & certifications
Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification is required

PEARS (Levels - AT I, AT II) is preferred.
PALS (Level - AT III) is preferred.
ASATT certification (Level - AT III) is preferred Experience
0 - 6 mos of related experience (Level - AT I) is required.
Minimum 1-2 years of job related experience (Level - AT II) is required.
Minimum 2-3 years of job related experience (Level - AT III) is required.
Specific knowledge, skills, and abilities

Accomplish tasks by considering all areas involved, no matter how small; showing concern for all aspects of the job; accurately checking processes and tasks; being watchful over a period of time.
Develop and use collaborative relationships to facilitate the accomplishment of work goals.
Set high standards of performance for self and others; assume responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks; self impose standards of excellence rather than having standards imposed.

Physical demands . frequently, or up to 10 lbs. constantly.

This position will be a key member of the HR Team.Responsibilities: Review current process and controls and develop plan to improve and streamline talent acquisition process throughout the country.Partner with Operational Leadership to understand and determine needs. Serve as facilitator to address headcount forecasting and workforce planning.Manage vendor relationships.Develop strategy to attract and hire top talent at all levels.Design programs related to talent acquisition such as employee referral programs, social media campaigns, employer branding, etc.Create and place job postings, perform phone screenings and conduct interviews.Determine applicant qualifications by screening resumes, conducting phone and in-person interviews, and comparing qualifications and responses to job requirements.Coordinate offer letters, applicable background and reference checks.Demonstrate an ability to communicate effectively and professionally, verbally and in writing.Requirements: Minimum 5 years of talent acquisition and organizational development experience.Self-starter with the ability to work independently with minimum supervision.Significant experience in workforce planning, succession planning, talent acquisition and performance management.Proven experience driving talent innovation and process improvement.Skilled in MS Suite to include Outlook, Excel, and Word.Bachelor's degree required.SHRM-CP or PHR preferred.Job Type: Full-timeRequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:Recruiting: 5 years

education level/skills required / respon: Successful completion of a Pediatric Anesthesiology fellowship is required, as responsibilities include direct patient care in pediatric anesthesiology with...
job summary:
The UT Southwestern Medical Center Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Management seeks an outstanding anesthesiologist with a strong interest in pursuing an academic career at the rank of Assistant Instructor, Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, or Professor. Rank will be determined by the qualifications of the selected candidate.


Successful completion of a Pediatric Anesthesiology fellowship is required, as responsibilities include direct patient care in pediatric anesthesiology with teaching and supervision of pediatric anesthesiology fellows, anesthesiology residents, and other trainees. Opportunities are available in goal-oriented research in this academic practice. Applicants must have or be able to obtain a Texas medical license prior to employment and be BC/BE with the American Board of Anesthesiology (ABA). If the candidate is not Board certified the candidate will be appointed as Assistant Instructor at hire. Continued employment will be contingent upon receipt of ABA certification within two (2) years of initial hire date. Pediatric Anesthesiology subspecialty certification must be obtained within two (2) years of subspecialty training completion.


Pediatric anesthesiologists hold faculty appointments in the Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Management at UT Southwestern Medical Center; however, their primary practice is based at Children's Health in Dallas. The Division of Pediatric Anesthesiology at Children's Health is a cohesive group of anesthesiologists, CNRAs and AA-C.


To the extent provided by applicable law, no person shall be excluded from participation in, denied the benefits of, or be subject to discrimination under any program or activity sponsored or conducted by The University of Texas System or any of its component institutions, on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, or disability.

TEXAS REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER

MEDICAL TECHNOLOGIST

PRN Week-ends: 6a-6p Saturdays & Sundays and 2:30p-11p Mondays

Baylor Scott & White – Sunnyvale

(located at 231 S. Collins in Sunnyvale, TX), formerly Texas Regional Medical Center at Sunnyvale is a 70-bed hospital, serving the community since 2009. This hospital is a comprehensive medical center specializing in cardiovascular care, orthopedics, neurosurgery, urology and general surgery. Some of the services available at Baylor Sunnyvale are Anesthesiology, Back & Spine Care, Imaging & Radiology Services, Critical and Intensive Care, Pain Management, Digestive Diseases, ER, Heart & Vascular services. Baylor Sunnyvale was awarded 2014 Top Performer on Key Quality Measures, which recognizes attaining and sustaining excellence in heart attack, heart failure, pneumonia and surgical care.

The

Med Tech

is responsible for the processing of laboratory specimens and reporting of results in all areas of the clinical laboratory.

Med Tech Responsibilities:
Maintains laboratory records.

Follows laboratory policies and procedures;

Maintains quality control practices in the laboratory.

Age groups that are served by this position include neonates, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, adults and adult geriatrics.

Qualifications

:

Regulatory Requirements:

Bachelor of Science degree in Medical Technology, Chemistry or Biology.
National or State Licensure as a Medical Technologist in the following specialties; blood bank, chemistry, hematology, microbiology, serology/immunology.
ASCP (or equivalent national) Certification preferred.

Language Skills:

Ability to effectively communicate in English, both verbally and in writing.
Additionally languages preferred.

Skills:

Basic computer knowledge.
Operates the following equipment correctly and safely: microscopes, centrifuges, hematology, chemistry, and other instrumentation.

job summary:
U.S. Anesthesia Partners ("USAP") has engaged Major Lindsey & Africa to conduct an exclusive search for a Corporate Counsel to be located in Dallas, Texas. USAP is an equal opportunity employer. Interested candidates, please respond to the recruiter who contacted you about this position or email Dick Gordon, Deborah Thompson and Ann-Margaret Dudley at USAPCorpCounsel@mlaglobal.com . Do not contact USAP directly; all resumes sent to USAP will be routed to MLA for handling and will create delays.


Corporate Counsel


Company: U. S. Anesthesia Partners is a single-specialty anesthesiology practice and services organization that provides practice management services to anesthesiologists. It was recently formed by Welsh, Carson, Anderson & Stowe (WCAS) and members of management to identify and partner with leading quality groups of anesthesiologists who desire a strategic partner with the capital resources and expertise to invest in their practice support infrastructure and position them for continued success and growth within their markets.


Position: Reporting to the General Counsel, this position requires a highly intelligent, dynamic attorney who is able to provide independent analysis and counsel on legal and policy issues, oversee complex transactional issues, contract negotiations and regulatory compliance. The Corporate Counsel will also provide support to the Chief Development Officer and be responsible for assisting in corporate, contractual, and regulatory aspects of physician practice acquisitions. S/he must be able to work comfortably in an intense, fast-paced environment, must be responsive to the needs of management and have a high energy level.


Location: Dallas, TX, Houston, TX or Denver, CO


Experience: 4-7+ years of relevant legal experience as a corporate attorney, including extensive experience with corporate contracts and complex commercial transactions (including mergers and acquisitions). Experience working with clients within heavily regulated environments such as pharmaceutical, life sciences or healthcare industries is a plus.


Relos: Yes


Compensation: Competitive

education level/skills required / respon: PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral...
job summary:
RNs in the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) are integral to postoperative care. PACU nurses care for patients after surgery and must demonstrate advanced knowledge of anesthesiology. Candidates for PACU jobs require critical care skills to assess incision sites, monitor body temperature, and track other indicators of stability or complications. It is important for RNs in the recovery room to quickly make critical patient assessments as the on-call doctor may be unavailable during an emergency. Ideal candidates for post-anesthesia care units have natural abilities to think critically and histories of fast, accurate diagnoses. Past experience in critical care and surgical nursing is a plus. 

Job Skills / Requirements:

Valid BLS from the American Heart Association
A valid professional license within the state of practice
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) credentials from the American Heart Association are recommended and may be required for specific registered nurses and travel nurse positions
Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific positions
Proof of right to work in the United States
Experience as a PACU nurse in a hospital setting

Job title: Vice Chair of Pediatric Anesthesiology/Anesthesiologist in Chief, Children's Medical Center
education level/skills required / respon: The UT Southwestern Medical Center Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Management is recruiting a Vice Chair of Pediatric Anesthesiology....
job summary:
The UT Southwestern Medical Center Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Management is recruiting a Vice Chair of Pediatric Anesthesiology. The Vice Chair of Pediatric Anesthesiology will play a key role in perioperative leadership at Children’s Medical Center, particularly with regard to driving preoperative assessment, planning efficient and effective running of the operating rooms, and cross-specialty team work. In addition, this individual, in conjunction with the Chairman of the Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Management as well as other institutional leaders and hospital leaders, will plot a path forward as our pediatric services continue to grow not only with the reach of Children’s Health™, but also across the North Texas landscape, including Southwestern Health Resources, Parkland Health and Hospital System, and Texas Scottish Rite Hospital for Children.


Responsibilities include direct patient care in pediatric anesthesiology as well as teaching and supervision of anesthesiology residents and fellows, medical students, and other trainees in the subspecialty. Qualified applicants should have or be eligible for a Texas medical license, and have Board certification in Anesthesiology and the subspecialty of Pediatric Anesthesiology. As befits a leadership position, the Vice Chair candidate should possess qualifications for an academic rank of associate or full professor. Specific rank will be determined by the qualifications of the selected candidate.


To the extent provided by applicable law, no person shall be excluded from participation in, denied the benefits of, or be subject to discrimination under any program or activity sponsored or conducted by The University of Texas System or any of its component institutions, on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, or disability.
